리뷰:
Somehow I landed here on a Monday night and things were hopping. Lots of street vendors selling stuffjust say no and they will leave you alone. Once you make it to the end of the street, the food stands are amazing and delicious. Cheap drinks and fun music in the background. What a great way to end the night in Bangkok. Patpong Night Market in Bangkok is a lively and bustling destination for shopping and nightlife. The market offers a mix of souvenirs, clothing, and street food, making it a great place to pick up unique items. While the atmosphere can be vibrant and chaotic, it also tends to be quite touristy.

The food stalls serve a variety of local dishes, from skewers to fresh fruit, providing a taste of authentic Thai street cuisine. However, be cautious with prices, as vendors may inflate costs for tourists.

Surrounding the market, the nightlife scene features bars and entertainment options, adding to the overall energy of the area. While its an interesting place to visit, its worth exploring with a mindful approach to haggling and personal safety. Overall, Patpong Night Market offers a unique blend of shopping and culture, but be prepared for a more commercial experience compared to other local markets. A brightly set of stalls and food options. You can enjoy haggling with the merchandisers and get some decent food. Oh there is some exotic stuff like alligator meat if you dare to try! One caveat with street food is of course food safety. I did try some food and enjoyed it however I did see a few critters running around also  Hope you enjoy your experience! Bangkok's night food market is a place where you can experience the true diversity of Thai flavors and aromas. It's a melting pot of cuisines from various regions, offering a sensory journey unlike any other. For those sensitive to aromas, it can be a challenge as Bangkok has its own distinctive scent. Here, you can also discover dishes you never imagined existed and that not everyone dares to try. The market is crowded, but the items sold are too few, not enough for a foreign tourist like me to come and buy things that bear the mark of a culture with many interesting things like Thailand. The plus point is that the market is right in the center so it is very convenient to travel between the market and hotels, and most of the sellers are quite cute and hospitable.

Oh, but remember to bargain when you want to buy things here, the sellers shout prices a lot, you need to bid about 12 to 14 of the price the seller offers and you can buy them. But it's fun! It's also a signature!

The mall is designed like an indoor night market. Although there are restaurants on every floor, the first floor and the top floors have most. Walk to the middle escalators to reach the top floor quickly. Rather than use the other escalators that make you go around in a maze to find them.

The silliest thing I've seen is floor 3 which is just armies of smart phone sellers. Other than that the mall is a nice mall with a nice looking slick design for the exterior. Loved the experience of MBK. A multistoreyed mall with varieties of outlet to do shopping from.
The pricing is not out of the world, and they do announce discounts on the products, so keep your eyes open for sales items.
The food outlets spoil you with choices, and you can go back again to try different places there.
The location is at a busy area of the city and can get really crowded during the peak office hours.
Parking is indoor and available easily. A good mall that has been revamped and is much better in it's current incarnation than when it was new.

The mall is connected to the Pathumwan Princess Hotel.

The mall has sufficient atms and money changers to cater to tourists.

One can find shops selling clothes, nail spas, jewelery, salons, themed restaurants,  thai restaurants, cafes eg Starbucks, fast food restaurants such as Burger King.

A great mall all of 7 floors and you will need quite some time to get through all the shops and all the 7 floors. MBK centre mall is a vibrant mall with huge varieties of stores and products. Food courts offers variety of eating options. Clothing and shoe shops offer good choice and bargains. But don't forget to haggle in Thailand. A MustVisit Shopping Experience at MBK Center, Bangkok

If youre visiting Bangkok, MBK Center is a mustsee destination for shopping enthusiasts. My tour guide recommended it for souvenir shopping, and it did not disappoint. I loved the vibrant atmosphere and the diverse shopping options.

For Introverts Expect to feel a bit overwhelmed by the bustling environment, but its worth it for the great deals and the chance to immerse yourself in local culture. Youll get to see everyday shoppers and experience the lively hustle and bustle of Bangkok.

For Extroverts Get ready to be energized! Walking among the crowds, youll feel the dynamic energy of this super mall, teeming with people from all walks of life, both locals and tourists.

Pro Tip You can barter with the merchants to get better deals. Also, keep in mind that the souvenirs on the first floor tend to be slightly more expensive than similar items sold on the upper floors.

Eateries There are several eateries within the mall, offering a variety of food options to refuel during your shopping spree.

리뷰:
Paradise for shopping! Im from India and Id recommend anyone from India to surely go here for shopping. We spent almost 2 days shopping only in this mall. Its heaven. So many options and variety and very affordable pricing. Please go to each floor and check stuff,  then start buying. As an Indian i dont recommend having food from food court as its 99 only Thai food. The one Indian restaurant was selling stale food. Please go out and walk towards pratunam and find proper Indian restaurant who serves fresh and tasty food. They are also Available on Google map. Do not miss platinum mall if youre in Bangkok. THEY DO NOT GIVE ANY EXCHANGE OR ANY TRIALS. BE 200 sure before buying. All the shops have same policy here. Like the name implies Nothing but clothes, fashion accessories and beauty products. There are some good restaurants and a food court on the top floor. Super clean and fancy indoor design. There is a sky walk to Central mall and next door is Phenix mall which is an outlet mall with a good food court and underrated restaurants. There is a BK at the bottom and a skywalk to even more clothing and fashion products in smaller malls across the street. The side streets next to the mini malls have local food restaurants  no chain restaurants. Good place clothing shopping in Bangkok for adults and kids. Luggage shops are many. Food court is on the top floor. Place is neat and clean . Shop owners are friendly. Price is fixed. Higher than road side places.  Quality is so so One of the most versatile malls in Bangkok. For clothes, bags, accessories, etc this is probably the best mall in Bangkok. It's got many floors and each floor would easily have more than. 100 stalls. It's not easy to find a store unless one remembers the shop numbers.
It's priced well, and one can bargain here as well.
It's no wonder that this mall is one of the ladies favourite in Bangkok. Platinum Fashion Mall in Bangkok was constructed in the early 2000s. The mall officially opened its doors to the public in 2006. Since its opening, it has become one of the most popular shopping destinations in Bangkok, particularly for those interested in fashion and wholesale goods.

Platinum Fashion Mall in Bangkok is a wellknown shopping destination, particularly popular for wholesale fashion. Located in the Pratunam area, it's a multistory complex filled with small shops selling clothing, accessories, shoes, bags, and more. The mall primarily caters to retailers, but it's also a great spot for individual shoppers looking for trendy and affordable fashion items.

Key features

 Variety of Products The mall specializes in wholesale fashion, offering everything from casual wear to formal dresses, as well as accessories and shoes. Its known for its extensive range of styles, often reflecting the latest trends in Asian fashion.

 Affordable Prices Many shoppers are drawn to Platinum Fashion Mall for its competitive pricing, especially if you buy in bulk. Even if youre not purchasing wholesale, you can still find good deals.

 Shopping Experience The mall is divided into multiple zones, each focusing on different types of fashion items. Its easy to spend several hours exploring the various shops. Haggling is common, though prices are often fixed.

 Dining Options There are food courts within the mall offering a wide selection of Thai and international cuisine, providing a convenient spot to take a break during a shopping spree.

 Location The mall is located near other popular shopping areas, such as Pratunam Market and CentralWorld, making it easy to visit multiple destinations in one trip.

If you're planning to visit, it's advisable to wear comfortable clothing and shoes, as youll likely be doing a lot of walking!

Loved the experience of such an awesome mall. Multiple floors of restaurants, utilities, books, clothes.
You just name it, and it's there.
I utilized the money exchanger called OH Rich, and they gave a decent rate.
The shopping can be done for tourists on a moderate budget.
The escalators and stairways are added in a way to add to its inner beauty.
The only area they can improve is to add more bins. Had to keep the trash till we used the restroom where we threw it.
Parking is ample. The roads around the mall can get crowded during peak hours. I recently visited Central Rama 9 Shopping Center in Bangkok and had a delightful experience. The mall is conveniently located and easily accessible via public transportation, making it a great spot for both locals and tourists.

The variety of shops is impressive, ranging from highend brands to more affordable options, ensuring that theres something for everyone. I particularly enjoyed exploring the fashion boutiques and electronics stores, which offered a good selection of products at reasonable prices.

The dining options are another highlight of Central Rama 9. There are numerous restaurants and cafes, serving both local Thai cuisine and international dishes. I tried a few different places during my visit and was pleased with the quality and variety of the food.

One thing that stood out to me was the cleanliness and modern design of the mall. The layout is wellorganized, making it easy to navigate, and the facilities are wellmaintained. The staff throughout the mall were also friendly and helpful, adding to the positive experience.

The only reason Im giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the mall can get quite crowded, especially during peak hours. This sometimes made it a bit difficult to move around and fully enjoy the shopping experience. However, this is a minor issue and didn't significantly detract from my overall enjoyment.

In summary, Central Rama 9 is a fantastic shopping center that offers a wide range of stores, excellent dining options, and a pleasant atmosphere. I highly recommend a visit if youre in Bangkok! Central Rama 9 is located around HuayKwang area. It is commutable from MRT Rama 9 Station interconnected to the mall inside.

Many varieties here, from Robinson Store to Topps Supermarket. Its b2s stationary are on the 6th floor. Many restaurants to be pick from.

Theres are a lot of good eating options available at the place but as this place is right next to the JODD fairs market, one should try the local food in the market. This 12storey complex has hundreds of shops, restaurants, cafs, a cinema and an ice skating rink. The food court is a must visit when you are here, lots of delicious food and drinks are sold here.

It is directly linked to the MRT undergrounds Rama IX Station at the basement level.

It is a nice and cool place to go shopping especially on a hot day.

It is a place where you can spend a whole day shopping and eating. The indoor floating market was a great idea, especially since it is so hot outside and often remote. It is located by one of the ferry rides. We recommend going early, having a super late breakfast, then spending most of the afternoon there, and then taking the ferry during sunset to elsewhere. The sixth floor holds different experiences depending on the season, which is fun. I wouldnt go out of my way to come here but if youre nearby there are a ton of food options and its a well done mall with a lot of interesting design elements like the indoor outdoor feel of the food court.

Siam Center in Bangkok is a trendy shopping destination, perfect for window shopping. The mall features a wide range of international and local brands, offering the latest in fashion, beauty, and lifestyle products. The innovative and stylish design adds to its appeal. While it can feel confusing and congested at times, the vibrant atmosphere and unique retail concepts make it an interesting place to explore. With plenty of dining options and its central location, Siam Center remains a great spot for browsing and experiencing Bangkok's shopping scene. Four stars. Another mall in the Bangkok Siam shopping district. This mall is really fun and has a great food court upstairs. Lots of wellknown shops and is very popular among tourist. Its also one of the malls that connects the network of Sam malls in the area. Easy to access and a great place to come and spend a few hours. During my recent trip to Bangkok this past May, I had the pleasure of exploring Siam Center, an iconic shopping destination that perfectly encapsulates the vibrant spirit and modern flair of this bustling city. Located in the heart of Bangkok, Siam Center isnt just a mallits a cultural experience that seamlessly blends fashion, art, and technology.

From the moment I stepped inside, I was struck by the centers chic and avantgarde design. Every corner of the mall exudes a sense of creativity and innovation, with stunning installations and art pieces that make you feel like youre walking through a contemporary gallery rather than a traditional shopping complex. The ambiance is further enhanced by the clever use of lighting and open spaces, creating an inviting atmosphere thats both dynamic and relaxed.

The retail offerings at Siam Center are nothing short of impressive. Whether youre a fashion enthusiast, techsavvy shopper, or simply looking for unique souvenirs, the variety of stores caters to all tastes. International luxury brands sit comfortably alongside trendy local designers, offering a curated selection that reflects Bangkoks status as a global fashion hub. I found myself particularly drawn to the boutique stores that showcase emerging Thai designerseach piece felt like a oneofakind treasure.

Foodies will also find Siam Center to be a culinary paradise. The mall features an eclectic range of dining options, from gourmet restaurants to cozy cafes, each offering a delightful array of international and local cuisine. During my visit, I indulged in some of the best Thai street food Ive ever tasted, all within the comfort of this stylish setting. The attention to detail in both presentation and flavor was truly remarkable, making for a memorable dining experience.

What sets Siam Center apart from other shopping destinations is its commitment to innovation and sustainability. The mall incorporates cuttingedge technology in its services, ensuring a seamless shopping experience. Additionally, its focus on sustainability is evident through various ecofriendly initiatives, which is a refreshing sight in todays retail landscape.

In conclusion, Siam Center is more than just a shopping destinationit's a vibrant showcase of Bangkoks modern identity. Whether youre visiting for the first time or returning as a seasoned traveler, this mall offers something new and exciting with every visit. I highly recommend adding Siam Center to your Bangkok itinerary. Its a place where creativity, culture, and commerce collide, leaving you inspired long after youve left its stylish halls. Weekday  quiet. Excellent for those that want to take things slower and not feel too anxious with many other shoppers around.  All shops open.. promotions ongoing..  and browsing encouraged.   Catering to perhaps a younger crowd.....  Combine with all the delights of the surrounding area and convenience of BTS Siam. as with Siam Paragon, Siam Discovery, Siam Centre shopping mall has a lot to see, shop and to eat with many restaurants, and eating establishments, and while Siam Paragon seems more focused on tourists and big budget spender, this and Siam Discovery seem more focused on more budget conscious spenders, locals, youngsters and young at hearts with more diverse price range products, although i also see lots of tourists touring around in the mall

Siam Paragon is truly a gem in Bangkoks shopping scene, offering an unparalleled luxury experience. From the moment you step inside, youre greeted with an atmosphere of elegance and sophistication. The interior design is a perfect blend of modern architecture and opulent decor, making every visit feel like a special occasion.

The variety of highend brands available is impressive, catering to fashion enthusiasts, tech aficionados, and gourmet lovers alike. Whether youre looking for the latest designer clothing, cuttingedge electronics, or exquisite dining options, Siam Paragon has it all. The gourmet market and numerous finedining restaurants ensure that every culinary desire is met with quality and style.

Moreover, Siam Paragons central location makes it a key destination for both locals and tourists. Its easily accessible and provides a convenient gateway to the surrounding attractions. The service is impeccable, with attentive staff ready to assist and enhance your shopping experience.

In conclusion, Siam Paragon offers a luxurious vibe and truly lives up to its reputation as a premier shopping destination. Its a mustvisit for anyone seeking a taste of luxury and a memorable shopping experience in Bangkok. Siam Paragon Mall, located in the heart of Bangkok, is one of the citys most iconic and luxurious shopping destinations. Here are a few key aspects that make it stand out

Wide Variety of Shops The mall boasts an impressive collection of highend designer brands, including Chanel, Louis Vuitton, and Gucci, alongside more affordable options like Zara and HM. This makes it a goto spot for shoppers with varying budgets and tastes.

Gourmet Dining Siam Paragon offers a diverse range of dining options, from casual food courts to gourmet restaurants. Whether you're craving local Thai delicacies or international cuisine, you'll find plenty of choices here, including Michelinstarred eateries and upscale cafes.

Siam Ocean World SEA LIFE Bangkok One of the malls unique attractions is the SEA LIFE Bangkok Ocean World, an expansive underground aquarium. Its a perfect stop for families and offers a refreshing break from shopping with its fascinating marine displays and interactive exhibits.

Entertainment Options In addition to shopping and dining, Siam Paragon offers a wide array of entertainment, including a worldclass cinema, bowling alley, and karaoke lounges. Its an excellent place to relax after a long day of retail therapy.

Elegant Ambiance The design of the mall is sleek and modern, with spacious interiors and luxurious decor. This gives it a highend feel, making the shopping experience more enjoyable and comfortable.

Convenient Location Situated right next to the Siam BTS station, Siam Paragon is easily accessible for both locals and tourists. Its central location in the Siam district places it at the heart of Bangkoks shopping scene, connected to other major malls like Siam Center and CentralWorld.

In summary, Siam Paragon is not just a shopping mall its a lifestyle destination. With its blend of luxury brands, entertainment options, and dining experiences, its a mustvisit for anyone spending time in Bangkok. Its a great shopping mall and it is really well organized, they have the restaurant completely section from the shopping stores. Even even the shopping section is divided in sections. First section is luxury international brands and the second section is the regular international brands and the third section is the local Brands. The other interesting thing was if you were trying to leave the mall, you have different options to choose from there are a few taxi stations and also they have bus stations and train station. Overall was one of the best malls Ive ever been to.

Its one of the best centers of Bangkok. Silom Complex is one the best cleanest and most modernized buildings of Bangkok. It has all the banks , restaurants and shopping facilities for everyone. Silom Complex is a really good shopping mall. It's got a great location next to BTS and MRT stations. Aside from shops, there's plenty of restaurants and cafes inside. They also have a well stocked supermarket. Probably the smallest Central department store shopping complexes but also one of the best. Recently refurbished there are plenty of dining options and boutique shops and you can walk on to the BTS with ease. The toilets are super clean, parking is good and the Tops supermarket has some of the best fresh produce of any Tops in Thailand. A nice airconditioned break if you've been walking down Silom or in Lumpini Park.

주소: 1693 Phahon Yothin Rd, Khwaeng Chatuchak, Khet Chatuchak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10900, Thailand
리뷰:
One of the oldest Central in Thailand. Opened back in 198384.

The store can be commute via BTS 5 Yaek Ladprao or MRT Phaholyolthin. Both are interconnecting via skybridge walkway.

The place are packed with various restaurants, clothing, electronics and accesories. Tops supermarket are located on the basement level.

Kids zone are on Lv. 4 central Side. B2S stationary are located on basement floor.

The place offers many cars parking. They do have Taxi Service area on the basement floor as well as well as GRAB Service Points.

Opens from 10am daily. One of my favorite malls I've visited in Bangkok. It's large but you don't get lost in it's size. Has everything I could need almost, and at completive prices. Understated elegance is the word that comes to mind for the vibe of the mall and the people that come here. It's classy but not too showy. Chill pace and feel to this mall. Nice local mall with a japanese food fair going on in the atrium. You can find everything you need here and prices are good.

One thing is that the flow of people doesnt stop coming in from the train station. It gets crowded during peak hours so you might want to plan your trip around that. This is one mall I will encourage all to go if not been here yet. Its a big mall thats little out from the siam, chit lom or asoke. Good shops, good food and love the crowded vibes! Theres lot of eateries here you can choose from and no lack of good food. Will be back here when back in Bangkok. Huge shopping mall directly connected to bts station. It has a nice collection of top, mid and affordable range of products.

Also lots of restaurants and fast food places in the basement floor along with Tops Food Hall super market.

Also there is Central department store which has a nice collection of shoes. Clothes, household items etc.

주소: 1 Siam Square Soi 7, Khwaeng Pathum Wan, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand
리뷰:
Most famous walking shopping area for teenage for decades. Still even more popular. Lots of fashion, cafe, restaurant, skincare stores for budget street fashion to high street fashion. After 4pm is good time to walking outside. Enjoy many street show. Famous Labubu is available at pop mart siam Square, also there is reseller just outside if lazy to Q up or buy directly from them.

Nearby alot of other mall and restaurants as well Siam Square is one of Bangkok's most vibrant and bustling areas, offering a dynamic blend of shopping, dining, and entertainment options. Located in the heart of the city, Siam Square is a popular destination for both locals and tourists, attracting a diverse crowd looking for the latest in fashion, food, and culture.

One of the biggest draws of Siam Square is its extensive shopping scene. The area is home to a mix of highend malls, such as Siam Paragon, Siam Center, and Siam Discovery, each offering a wide range of international and local brands. You can find everything from luxury boutiques to trendy streetwear shops, catering to a variety of tastes and budgets. Additionally, the nearby MBK Center provides a more affordable shopping experience with its numerous stalls and smaller shops selling electronics, clothing, and accessories at bargain prices.

Beyond shopping, Siam Square is also known for its food options. The area boasts an impressive array of restaurants, cafes, and street food vendors, serving both Thai and international cuisines. Whether you're in the mood for a quick snack or a sitdown meal, you'll find plenty of choices to satisfy your cravings. The lively street food scene around Siam Square is particularly notable, offering delicious local dishes such as pad thai, mango sticky rice, and grilled meats, which are perfect for those wanting to sample authentic Thai flavors.

Siam Square also offers a variety of entertainment options. Its home to several cinemas, including the luxurious Paragon Cineplex, which provides a fantastic moviegoing experience. The area is also a hub for nightlife, with numerous bars and clubs that come alive in the evenings, making it a great place to unwind after a day of shopping and exploring.

Overall, Siam Square is a mustvisit destination in Bangkok for anyone looking to experience the city's modern, energetic side. Whether you're a shopaholic, a foodie, or just someone who enjoys exploring lively urban environments, Siam Square has something to offer everyone. The mix of highend and affordable options, along with its central location, makes it a convenient and exciting spot to spend a day or evening in Bangkok. This area is surrounded by clothing, stores and food stores as well so just exploring this area gives you plenty of options to see what you want before you go into other stores. Not a busy area compared to other establishments.
Gentle woman is in this area and its their flagship store that has three floors. There's so much to do here! It's a big space with malls, street stores and kiosks. There are some street performances by students, and occasionally you see Thai artists filming or taking photos in the area. There's lots of things to see, try and buy. The items are mostly on trendy and targeted at younger crowds, but across the bridge, you can go to high end luxury fashion brands at Siam Paragon.

리뷰:
Not crowded. Few people are there as it is mid day time. Good not so expensive. Quality good available. Have lots of parking facilities around. Many shopping areas around. I like the place Off the beaten track for sure and catering to smaller businesses and budgets but still offering all the conveniences of mega malls.. perhaps with a bit less glamour and vibes... Also conveniently closed to MRT Thailand Cultural Centre. The Street Ratchada shopping mall, conveniently located near Thailand Cultural Center MRT station, is a great spot for a casual hangout. While you won't find highend brand showrooms here, the mall offers a variety of fairpriced clothing and products. It features a diverse range of amenities, including a food court, restaurants, dessert shops, cafes, hair salons, bars, gift shops, a grocery store, daily product shops, aesthetic clinics, and even a 711. Additionally, there's an outdoor night market that sells everything from clothes to food, adding to the vibrant atmosphere. I always enjoy visiting for its relaxed vibe and variety of options. Highly recommend checking it out if you're in the area! I love the mini night market. Small but sells delicious food. Opens till late, need to go after 6pm. That place has improved, I remember of it quiet and with many shops empty.
Now it seems that all the place has come to life.
Many shops and restaurants

Gym
Supermarket
Many clothes stores
An affordable food court with many choices and place to sit.

리뷰:
Very cool chill trip. Good guide. We were only 6 or 7 guests. So it was very nice and a lot of space.

You get quite a lot explained of surroundings . Places for art lovers! I was there when there's an exhibition of detective conan comic. You can find many art galleries that not only for displaying but selling as well in that mall. Also, the entrance is free. Great place for escaping the busy of the city and indulge in the beauty of any kinds of art there. The place is very beautiful with one of the best location . Ive been there before many times , this time is for rooftop movies

1. The gallery mall is super interesting , full of galleries and restaurants, even if its a bit pricey. But if staying a whole afternoon and evening, why not ?

2. besides the mall , there are many galleries nearby , the streets around 1km , can just walk around Ana explore .

3. The rooftop is comparatively not so special , but the movie I the rooftop made it special . The open space for a movie at night , with the nightview of the river and the opposite side of Iconsiam are amazing . Also the movies are romantic movies . Which is really  really really romantic , perfect idea for dates

4. There are still a lot of street food stalls outside , the food is also good , more expensive than normal street food , but good and cheap  enough compared to either the restaurants in the mall

Recommend to go and explore Went here for the ATM only, didn't know there would be art galleries here. And it was a very pleasant surprise. I enjoyed all the galleries so much. If only I have a place to put some of these arts, I would buy some. I especially liked Chubbynida's contemporary art and their take on a person's struggles to find their own identity and achieve their goals and dreams. Would love to be back here and explore the other floors. A mall for art galleries. Very unique mall for those looking for some artistics items even have a Pokmon store! It's along the Chao Praya river where you can also take a cruise ship for the sunset and buffet dinner place. Tickets are sold here. A few good restaurants selection available here as well. Not too crowded mall.

주소: 271 Thanon Khao San, Khwaeng Talat Yot, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰: Nice spot to chill but the cannabis quality extremely poor. If you care about smoke quality and price dont shop here. I went there to look for anime figures and I wasn't prepared for the incredible variety of different shops. You can get many figures from small statues at retail prices to massive artdesign figures for over 1000 US dollars. I go to Coffee World for great Thai coffee and I go to the Buddy Lodge gym. Only workout place around Khao San Buddy Hotel has the adjacent Plaza and another open air restaurant very nearby. Mulligans Irish Pub has indoor seating upstairs and ourdoor seating downstairs good for people watching and wine.  Buddy's open air restaurant nearby has excellent ambiance and good seafood and cocktails. Brilliant accomodation in the center of one of the busiest backpacker areas in Bangkok. Nice roof top pool with a bar. The in house food however let's the establishment down quite badly, it's poor quality however that shouldn't be a problem given that just outside there are hundreds of places to eat! All staff speak a small amount of English but actually understand alot more than they speak. English speaking manager too from what I could tell upon my first visit. On a side note the music from Koh San road goes on very late if you're a light sleeper avoid however for people who can handle a small amount of noise it isn't much of a problem. Rooms were always clean and filled with the necessary provisions.

주소: 107 Soi Sukhumvit 63, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
Great donki place, not as extensive as the ones in Japan but we'll stocked. You can buy frozen goods and have them it for you for a fee. No escalator or elevator going to second floor though which was a hassle. 2nd floor also was very hot during our visit. Nice place to shop many things at one place.
Also can do duty free  shopping from here. It is only one place in hamamatsu other than airport from where you can do duty free shopping. Prices are reasonable if compared to other market in Hamamatsu. You can also purchase refurbished electronic item like mobile, laptop, etc from here. I love this supermarket, you can find all kinds of Japanese food and drinks at very good prices. Besides all this, they have a huge offer of prepared dishes every day such as sushi trays, rice dishes, onigiris, skewers, mochis and much more! You can go late in the afternoon and they have many offers of ready meals, they also have tables inside the supermarket so you can eat there everything you find and you feel like eating  I've been visiting this Japanese mall for a while now, and it seems the chef never introduced any new dishes since a while now.

While the Japanese meals are good, it's a bit pricey, and it still gives off a faint plastic smell when you open the lid of the meal. The quality resembles supermarket food.

Additionally, sometimes there are a lot of people, and you have to wait a long time at the checkouts, especially during peak hours when it gets crowded.

Despite these drawbacks, I appreciate the authentic Japanese food offerings at this mall. Took the parents to visit Donki at Thonglor branch for the first time. They were very amazed of thr size of the Mall as well as the varieties of Japanese good available for purchase. Ranging from consumer products, ready to eat Japanese food, snacks, cosmetic and much more. The price is slightly higher than if you find exactly the same product in Japan. However, considering that you don't need to fly to Japan, the slightly higher price is totally acceptable. There's good parking building there so no need to worry. Visit again is a must for us.

주소: 628 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Tan, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
Nice place to visit in Bangkok. A new mall with a lot of things to do here. Many restaurant to explore, party zone, big TV screen to cheer football, beauty zone, bank , car and plenty more stuffs which u can find all here. Must visit. I would recommend  EMSPHERE, the newly opened mall by The Mall Group, is a vibrant addition to Bangkok's shopping scene. We visited on a Sunday afternoon, and it was completely packed, especially on the two food floors. While it can be tiring and overwhelming for some, it's a fantastic spot for youngsters. A great tip is to check the queues to find the best eatsthe longer, the better! The other floors are less crowded, offering a more relaxed shopping experience. Plus, there's an IKEA store above. More for the young and trendy, super many food options and very vibrant place. Worth every of your time, ikea is here and even selling cars right on top.
Whats cooler is there are bars right on top, feels pretty hot though even on a evening! A hugegrand foodcourt with some shopping options as a topper. I spent so many hours just sipping on the delicious drinks the mall offered and always had a snack at hand. Lovely people who always welcomed you in with a smile and the food joints were fab. One thing I appreciated about all the malls I visited in Thailand is that no one bothers you even when youre a walking alone  which is a relief given how it is in India. I enjoyed being happily invisible until I asked for attention.
The upper floors of these malls have a huge array of shops and I visited Dior to try on some perfumes. The SA was so nice and welcoming, I came back the other day too.
Overall, a great day spent at the mall exploring delectable food and drinks. We visited the newly opened EmSphere in Bangkok last May 2024, and it was a great experience.

The place has a cool and trendy design, making it stand out as one of the newest spots in the city. Its definitely worth a visit, especially if youre into stylish and modern spaces.

I was particularly excited to find the Deus clothing store there, which is one of my favorites. The overall vibe of EmSphere is fresh and vibrant, making it a mustvisit destination for shopping and exploring the latest retail and lifestyle offerings in Bangkok.

주소: เลขที่ 22 Soi Phetchaburi 47, Khwaeng Bang Kapi, Khet Huai Khwang, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10310, Thailand
리뷰:
Bangkok Plaza is located within the campus of Bangkok Hospital.

This is very convenient for the families of patients being treated at Bangkok Hospital, and even for the patients themselves.

It is not a very large area, but it has everything you need.

For example, there are many restaurants from different countries, such as Japanese, Chinese, Thai, Westernstyle food, fast food, Starbucks, Dunkin', and even Lebanese food.

Additionally, there is a 7Eleven convenience store open 247, a shop selling fresh fruits daily, and some simple shopping options to help you pass the time.

Although the prices are not as cheap as street food, you can be assured of the quality.

You can completely relax at this place. Its a small but packed with multiple restaurants and businesses at this sites. Many delicious restaurants from multiple cruises to choose. My personal favorite has to be the LebaneseIndian restaurant at the highest level. Due to the complex being part of the hospital, it is very clean and well maintained This is a mini mall with small restaurants, a 711, boutiques, a florist, few cafes, a bakery, and bank branches intended for hospital staff and visitors.  However, many nearby residents also sometimes come here to eat, relax, or run errands at the banks.

The building is connected to nearby the central hospital department on the 2nd floor.

The place has security, is air conditioned, and well maintained.  However, the place needs to do something about the HUGE automatic sliding doors because they let out all the cool air on the first floor. This is a great little shopping mall. There is so much  in a small space. It has a good selection of restaurants and so many shops and banks. Talk about bad service. Oh my gosh. First off I had to repeat myself twice for each thing I ordered. Second, the zombie style staff were totally not on planet earth. They didnt smile, were disrespectful and unfriendly. Third, waited over 10 minutes to get my coffee. Terrible service, terrible staff, and terrible work ethics. Manager, you should darn well learn how to do your job properly and train your staff so that they can respect customers. All the After Yous in Bangkok are pretty bad, but this one is the worst. My gosh....

The Paradise Park is a like mega shopping mall which is worthy for visiting. My wife and I stayed near this mall, so we visited it very often. Had massage, coffee and shopping here, highly recommended! Spacious mall that is very relax to be in. A shopping mall that having a lot of rental for your business. They have some restaurants and other shops for shopping.
Parking are available on both Paradise Place and its building. As a frequent visitor to Paradise Park Shopping Center, I can attest to its vibrant atmosphere and diverse offerings. The array of shops, restaurants, and entertainment options make it a goto destination for all occasions. Whether I'm indulging in a delicious meal at one of the restaurants, browsing the latest fashion trends, or enjoying a movie night out with friends, Paradise Park never disappoints. The convenient location and ample parking add to the overall convenience of the experience. It's definitely one of my favorite places to spend time and unwind.

주소: อินทราสแควร์ .ราชปรารภ มักกะสัน ราชเทวี Khwaeng Thanon Phaya Thai, พญาไท Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10400, Thailand
리뷰:
Must visit. Buy amazing shoes at 500 bhatt, we bought chocolates from first floor. We bought amazing neon tiger print shirt and a lot of stuff. Many Indians are there and they guide you well. Some bargaining is possible. Good quality stuff. This is one of the best places to buy souvenirs and chocolates if you are leaving Thailand after a vacation. You can find a wide variety of products here at prices that are often cheaper compared to other markets. Bargaining is an option to reduce the price of any product you purchase, but most wholesale shops do not encourage it.

It is advisable to check with multiple shops before buying a product, as different shops sell the same product at different prices. You might find that some shops on the first floor sell the same products as those on the ground floor at even cheaper prices. By comparing prices across several shops, you can ensure you get the best deal.

If you plan to buy electronic products, make sure to check whether your flight allows you to carry the battery in your checkedin luggage. If batteries are not permitted in checked luggage, you can carry them in your cabin or hand luggage. This is an important consideration to avoid any issues at the airport.

Additional information Dont plan to visit the shop in the evening, as almost every shop here closes by 8 PM. Allocate at least half a day to explore all the shops and another half day to make your purchases. Keep in mind that you wont find any original branded products here most items sold are duplicates, first copies, or unbranded. Despite this, the variety and affordability make it a worthwhile shopping experience for tourists looking to bring home gifts and mementos.

To make the most of your shopping experience, arrive early and take your time exploring. The market offers an extensive range of items, and careful browsing can lead to some great finds. Whether you are looking for traditional Thai crafts, unique souvenirs, or delicious chocolates, this market has something for everyone. This place is for shopping and they had variety of shops and this place is mainly for indians and lots of Indians works here. They have almost all the items here. Compare to other shopping malls, this place is good and affordable. I purchased luggage, shoes, accessories and clothes here for reasonable prices. You can also bargain here if youre good at it. If youre in Bangkok you should check out this place There are lot of shops to purchase. We can do bargain little bit they will reduce. Need to check and buy the quality of the item. 리뷰:
During the weekend, I decided to spend some free time shopping at Siam Premium Outlet. The venue is wellorganized, featuring a wide array of international and branded products, along with numerous food outlets for shoppers to enjoy. I spent the entire afternoon browsing and ended up purchasing some clothing and skincare items. Overall, it was a great shopping experience however, I believe adding more outlets and hosting extravagant sales events throughout the year would enhance the experience even further. Additionally, the information office could better serve a diverse range of tourists beyond just those from Laos, Vietnam, and Cambodia, who currently receive special privileges. Anyway, the office do give away some souvenir for tourist after validated our passport on first come first served basis which served as sweetener. Been to many outlets in Thailand n this place is actually a better outlets to be...
This outlets have lots of fashion n sports brands ...even have some branded brands that I don't really see in other outlets....

Location is abit far from town but they actually have buses that comes here from Siam Paragon....just have to check the timing for their transport...

Great Place to come for some great bargains.. Siam Premium outlet is a good place for shopping . Maximum all the brand outlets are present here . They have lot of outlets having food and beverages option also . Its nearby to airport around 1015 mins .
But all the outlets doesnt have good collection or discount . Now a days we get better options and discount online also.
Best things to buy from here are shoe and cosmetics . Clothes and bags are normally priced . The ones in discount are not great . Electronics is also somewhat cheap . Nike Showroom photo and video is not allowed . It is a good choice when we have little bit shopping time to the flight on BKK airport, around 15 mins from airport.

There have many choice of famous brand store in here. Overall the product with various style and some shops have great discount such as Nike. But we need to consider there have sunshine for the outdoor area.

We have shoot the video for quick review in this outlet, check it out and support us on YouTube rcenjoylife

Thank you so much Nothing to do on a Sunday.. Woman has destination.... Siam Premium Outlets Bangkok... I grumbled a tad. I am not the best shopper but I was informed that there was a Starbucks and she wanted to buy me a wallet.
35 minute drive from center of Bangkok, well kept and they had shaded parking available on a Sunday. Layout was as other Outlet malls open and breezy.
The decor was interesting in places and it was all in all well presented, maintained and serviced. Playground for kids, coffee for adults and lots and lots of stores.

리뷰:
Nana Square in Bangkok is a shopping mall that suffers from terrible traffic congestion, making it advisable to use alternative transport like the BTS, walking, or motorcycle taxis. The mall itself is unimpressive but clean, featuring restaurants such as Burger King and coffee outlets like Starbucks. While it offers basic amenities, it lacks standout features. Overall, I wasn't particularly impressed with Nana Square and would rate it 3 stars for its cleanliness and convenient dining options. Opposite of Soi Nana is the Nana Square mall. It is known to have had better days. Apart from the food, which is actually pretty good and decently priced, it presently is mostly either populated by overpriced knock off shops for fashion, small service outlets like a barber and a bunch of tourist trinkets. I went to help a friend whose visa agent was located here so I had some time to stroll around. As said the food is good. There's a food court on the third floor and on the ground floor you have a new Prime burger place which I prefer 100x more over the Burger King next door. Parking is the 1st on your right entrance on Sukhumvit. Don't take the second one as that's from a bank who not surprisingly overcharges you 30thb per hour for parking. Perfectly cooked waffle, best I've had in years. Either they water down the syrup or buy the cheapest made which takes away from the complete taste. However, I'll just buy and bring my own because they are worth eating weekly. Lovely food court on the top floor  great local Thai food, real flavours, clean, friendly staff. Recommended! The mall for the rest is sadly quite empty. Nana square ..!! A deserted mall in bangkok city with few shops inside

Starbucks and few other dress shops are there ..!!

Nothing much to see in this mall

U can just visit here ..!

Mixt Chatuchak is a trendy lifestyle mall located near the Chatuchak Weekend Market in Bangkok. Heres an overview of what you can find there

 Key Features

1. Shopping Mixt offers a diverse range of shops, including fashion boutiques, beauty stores, and lifestyle brands. It caters to both local and international tastes.

2. Dining The mall features various dining options, from casual eateries to sitdown restaurants, serving Thai and international cuisine. The food court offers a wide variety of affordable meals.

3. Art and Culture Mixt often hosts art exhibitions and cultural events, showcasing local artists and crafts.

4. Accessibility Conveniently located near the Mo Chit BTS station and Chatuchak Park MRT station, its easy to reach by public transport.

5. Modern Design The mall features a contemporary architectural style, creating a pleasant atmosphere for shopping and leisure.

 Tips for Visiting

 Explore Beyond Shopping Take time to enjoy the art and cultural events, which can be a unique experience.
 Weekday Visits Like other popular spots, it can get crowded on weekends, so consider visiting during the week for a more leisurely experience.

..Chat.G.P.T.. Wow, this old mall surrounding Chatuchak Weekend Market blew my mind! Auntie Anne, Dairy Queen, and cafes are available here, too.

리뷰:
Bangkok Fashion Outlet no more. Don't come here hoping to find fashionable clothes or shoes !! All my favorite shopping clothes spots in Bangkok are disappearing... why oh why  ???. Bangkok Fashion Outlet my mustgo store for buying nice and discounted clothes from asian brands like Bess, Journal, Nextphase, Easypieces, Britishindia, pieces usually coming from released stock of the Central Stores, unfortunately no longer exist.  Also gone the sports shoes shop outlets. The space it's now occupied  by small one man stands selling gems, practically the only thing you can buy nowadays in the building. When I was there two days ago, it looked like the only people milling around  apart from the indian vendors were office workers coming to eat in the food court on the ground floor... I give it a few months for the building to be remodeled for other uses. So dead. Nothing to see or buy. Only go there if you need jeweleries god knows if they're real or not. Quite gloomy and shady atmosphere. Bangkok Fashion Outlet is a decent shopping destination if you're looking for branded items at discounted prices, but it does come with its limitations. While the outlet offers some good deals, the selection is somewhat limited, both in terms of stock and variety of brands.

One of the main draws of Bangkok Fashion Outlet is the promise of bargains on wellknown brands. There are indeed opportunities to find discounted items from reputable labels, making it a worthwhile visit for those seeking to save money on fashion purchases. However, the range of brands available is not as extensive as one might hope. Shoppers might find themselves with fewer choices compared to other larger outlets or malls in Bangkok.

The stock levels can also be a hit or miss. Often, certain sizes or styles may be unavailable, which can be disappointing if you're looking for something specific. The inventory seems to rotate frequently, so it might be necessary to visit multiple times to catch the best deals or find what you're looking for.

On the plus side, the shopping environment is clean and wellorganized, making it easy to browse through the available merchandise. The staff are generally helpful and ready to assist with any queries, adding a positive touch to the overall shopping experience.

In summary, Bangkok Fashion Outlet is a reasonable option if you're hunting for discounted branded items, but manage your expectations regarding the variety and availability of stock. It's worth a visit if you're in the area, but might not be the best choice if you're looking for a wide selection of brands and a consistently plentiful inventory. A lot less clothing outlets and more gems shops now in 2024. Still good for cheap sports shoes, and the factory outlet of cheap casual clothes .
The sports outlet is still going well, but the jewelry and gem outlets are now spreading into the 3rd floor zone where clothing used to be sold. Very bad experience, it is a disgrace that they even call this a Fashion Outlet most shops are empty, only a few stores actually sell fashion, but not much choice and no good prices. I did not buy anything here, waste of time. Took a cab to Platinum Fashion Mall close to Central World. You better go there for fashion.

리뷰:
Completely diserted. Im not saying you can fly your drone there, Im just saying its empty. There aren't many shops here at all. I came here in 2019 when it was known as 'Show DC', and I understand there are less shops now than there was in 2019. It has a Starbucks, McDonald's and a food court and is emerging as a music concert venue.  This is a Deserted Mall you don't find anyone, no people, and no shops are open.

 This place doesn't give the vibe of a mall it's just an empty space to relax I guess.

 All the shops were closed nothing to see, nothing to do Completely Boring I would come again and would recommend the others to come.
1. Feeling so comfortable here because there is not much people here.
2.The tourist lounge is awesome. Good to rest before taking a plane at night. The phone can be charged for free here.
3. Some items here are having up to 70 discount which is very worthy to buy.
4. The XL locker here is charged for 60Baht for 2 hours, oversize is 70Baht2hr. The price is reasonable to me. Due to not much people in the lounge, luggage can also be put beside me in the lounge.
5. The fried chicken of McDonald here is tasty and juicy. Love the new cafe, Sahara opposite Show DC Mall  also the biggest gym at 3600sqm  in Bangkok. Fit Whey Gym opens from 10am till Midnight and have expansive classes, weights, treadmill. Love it!

Perfect place for fitness enthusiast

i have to visit on saturday but bad experience Saturday majorities shop off but so many precious stones options Nice if you look for jewellery and stones Worst place to sell your precious gemstones. I believe they operate together to give you a very low price for your gems and rip you off.
For an example, i tried to sell a Royal blue sapphire from Sri Lanka 1.3ct and most of them told me that they have plenty of ceylon blue sapphires above 1ct and therefore maximum they will do is 350 USD per ct for the particular stone. Most of the stores, specifically the indian ones quoted similar prices.
I was surprised when my friend checked their selling price for a similar stone which was above 1000 USD!
I went to an office outside JTC and sold the same stone for 700 USD per ct.its unbelievable how these JTC people try to almost steal your merchandise.

In essense, dont sell here and dont buy from here. Its not like other shopping centres but this place good for you looking for beautiful stones and Gems. The restaurant is ok . Good place to buy Sapphire,Ruby, Emerald,Jade,Amber ,plenty of semi precious stones and also Rough stones..Gems lab Like AIGS,ICA,AIG and More..
Its a mall that sells clothes, food and a lot of jewellry. Youll get a lot of precioussemiprecious stones here. Worth a visit if youre into it.Best place for Gem Loves

주소: 71 Thanon Lat Krabang, Khwaeng Lat Krabang, Khet Lat Krabang, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10520, Thailand
리뷰:
They have a variety of shops inside to choose from. You could pretty much find most of the things you are looking for, clothes, shoes, foods, cinema. This is very good place for shopping and dining. I have seen the clothing are selling in more discounted rates at the moment and best time for shopping here.ATM, Restroom , all kinds of restaurant and movie theater and play station, kids areas available. Multiple parking facility available. A decent place for shopping and dining, if you are staying near the airport During a recent visit to Lat Krabang in Bangkok, my family and I stumbled upon Robinson Lifestyle Mall, a hidden gem that wasn't there on our previous visit. A few years ago, the area was merely fields, but now it's transformed, boasting this charming shopping center.

Robinson Lifestyle isn't overwhelmingly large but offers a comfortable size spread over two floors. The range of merchandise is impressive for its scale, with a focus on midrange brands that strike a balance between affordability and quality. While you won't find highend luxury brands, there are several aspirational labels and lesserknown brands that offer unique finds.

One of the highlights was the surprisingly low prices. Despite initially planning just to browse, we ended up spending over 4000 Thai baht on a backpack and some small appliancesitems that are hard to come by in the UK. The backpack, which I had been eyeing for a while, was offered at such a tempting price that it was impossible to resist.

Adding to the excitement of our visit, a Thai celebrity was at the mall that day. While I wasn't familiar with them, my wife was thrilled, briefly turning into a starstruck fan. It was a delightful moment for her, and seeing her so happy made the experience even more special.

The mall itself was clean, welcoming, and wellmaintained. The staff were friendly and helpful, contributing to a pleasant shopping experience.

In conclusion, Robinson Lifestyle Mall in Lat Krabang is a delightful discovery for those looking for quality shopping at reasonable prices. It's a testament to how much the area has developed, offering a comfortable and enjoyable shopping experience without the overwhelming hustle of larger malls. Whether you're a local or just passing through, it's definitely worth a visit. One of a nice lifestyle shopping mall from Central group. Quite convenice for people around this area.
Parking are available both parking building and on ground which can be park huundreds of cars.

리뷰:
Central Chidlom has truly outdone itself with the recent renovation. As one of Bangkok's OG department stores, it now boasts a compact and easytonavigate layout. The new design is fantastic, offering a quiet and pleasant shopping experience. There are numerous offers on products ranging from cosmetics and luxury brands to kids' appliances and kitchenware. Even if you're not shopping, it's worth a visit just to admire the place itself! Wow the Chidlom location has gone through a massive renovation and it has a lot more luxury brands than before. VM has definitely improved and there are more new brands that I have not seen elsewhere in Asia like Sporty  Rich. Worth a visit and it connects to Central Embassy and there are tons of food options on the way there. The department store has a refreshing facelift since my last visit in Sep 2023 Glad to see its more arty, lively and young.. Central Chidlom is one of the Original Central stores in Thailand.
The department store just been renovated as of Q2 2024.

With still keeping its heritage floorplan, the newly renovates space becomes more modern and vibrant for each floor.

The fasion zone for both men and ladies are slight more premium and more focused on imported fabrics luxury zone.

Muji is still located on the higher floor floor 6th.

The basement level are tops supermarket zone as well as the foodcourt or known as FoodHall. This is a large department store under the central group which I think is probably the largest department store  mall chain in Bangkok. They offer fashionable clothes here as well as shoes, accessories, personal hygiene, cosmetics, skin care and so much more. This place is connected to Central embassy

리뷰:
A trip to this department store's rooftop zoo could make even the most staunch atheist believe that Hell exists. Conditions are beyond substandard. Arboreal apes like orangutans lie on concrete floors, depressed and with no enrichment. A gorillahighly social animals that live in family groups in the wildsits alone in a rusted cage, starved of the interaction she so desperately needs. The eyes of the world are upon you, Pata Pinklao. Please do the right thing and release these poor creatures to sanctuaries, where they can live out the rest of their lives in comfort and peace and attempt to regain some semblance of normalcy. I can't imagine the director of this sorry excuse for a zoo would want to spend 30 years behind bars with nothing to entertain him but a tire swing and some ropes! I really recommend this place
It is another memorable place of mine
I grew up with it and it never gets old for me

2 years ago i visited here and it brought back all old memories

When i was young my mom took me here to the zoo and i had such a great experience

I also had gone to IT city here to buy a bunch of PC games and i had a blast playing all of it

Right now it is being renovated, i can't wait to be here again Animal abuse!!! How can someone built zoo in department store is out of my mind. Let animals live in decent conditions in sanctuaries and tear this old terrible building down This place very old, wasteful not have guests i think it not call department store but just first floor only , on roof top have zoo but in cage it so dirty. Its sad to see that the animals are still in this poor and caged environment, i went to pata zoo as a child over a decade ago and hoping this would improve but it has gotten worse.

주소: 789 หมู่ที่ 2 Sukhumvit Rd, Tambon Thai Ban Mai, Amphoe Mueang Samut Prakan, Chang Wat Samut Prakan 10280, Thailand
리뷰: Its best known place for shopping, dining and activities for kids in Samut Prakan area. Its just a 2 minute walk from BTS Phreak Sa. You will have Big C on the other side and night market just beside it. Excellent place for family and there are events while we visited. Very sad place, nothing interesting. Didnt see many interesting discounted things. Bike parking is hidden in the deepest depths of the backyard. The place you can find good food at an open air cooked food market. It has tops supermarket where you can get your daily necessarry groceries. When it comes to restaurant , it has few of them includes Pizza, steaks, KFC , MAC D,  Ramen, Sushi , Hot Pot, Grill ,Ice creams, few bakeries and Tea shops. Common brands are available for shopping such as HM , Lee, Levis, Giordano, MC , HARA, and sports brand. The shopping mall is not very big but you can get your basic and neccessary stuff in a short walk as compare to bigger malls. Took sky train to Keha terminal station to discover Samut Prakan area. On my return chanced upon this place ap j went in for a look, also looked for something to eat and shop. It's not huge but it's adequate,  very much favored by the locals in the area. There's some sort of night market right outside the building.  It's a very short walk from the sky train station.  Not that u want to go out of your way to come here, but it's certainly worth  a visit if you're passing by, like I just did.

주소: 119 Soi Ban Kluai Nuea, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
We ordered this steamed seafood curry, which was absolutely delicious. Ate it with rice, some clear Tom yum soup and Phad Thai and finished with a mango sticky rice.

Oddly the mango sticky rice was served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The mango wasnt particularly sweet but the sticky rice was good. Also my mango shake wasnt all that great.

Overall the steamed seafood curry was so phenomenal that despise those flavors its still a 5 food rating.

PS loved the deco and environment inside. The name of restaurant really suits the place as it does make you sit and wonder when look around. The staff were friendly, and the ambience is really good too. Not too loud and not too noisy. The food was incredible as well. The Mango Sticky Rice is amazing! I love this local Thai restaurant! The decor was such a vibe, with old film cameras and artsy things on the shelves. The chicken pad thai was only 75 baht and was very tasty! The watermelon shake cost 70 baht and that was also delicious! Yummy food, amazing prices, lovely service, and a very welcoming atmosphere. 1010 I stopped in here for a quick, light meal. I decided on Thai iced coffee, some wings and the papaya salad. All three were great! The papaya salad was awesome and as the coffee. The wings were maybe a bit over cooked but nonetheless, had excellent flavour! 2 minute walk from Marriott Hotel. Cute little place. Air conditioned. Thai food.

I had the pad Thai which was OK. Only 75 baht. Much cheaper than the hotel.

The sweet lemon tea was way too sweet. The iced long black was perfect. Happy with the flavour and strength.

I was able to sit here for a few hours working. I enjoyed the energy of the place. A nice amount of people, music was comfortable volume, and people not speaking too loud. Many people seemed to be here for some work discussions.

The staff don't speak much English but are still friendly. The menu has English and Thai writing.

Note if your bill is less than 300 baht you need cash, not card. My two drinks and meal was less than 200 baht, thankfully I had cash.

이름: FOOD UNIVERSE Thai International Cuisine - Century The Movie Plaza Sukhumvit
주소: Century The Movie Plaza Khwaeng Phra Khanong Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
Taste of the food was really good. But the quantity was kinda less than my expectations. Expensive considering the quantity offered. The kiwi smoothie on the other hand was absolutely delicious and worth every baht! The service was good. The staff is friendly and professional.  The ambience is excellent.  Their cutlery is very cool. Recently, I had the pleasure of dining at FOOD UNIVERSE Thai International Cuisine, located in Century The Movie Plaza Sukhumvit, right by BTS On Nut station in Bangkok. This restaurant turned out to be a hidden gem, offering a wide array of Thai and international dishes that delighted my palate.

As soon as I stepped into FOOD UNIVERSE, I was welcomed by a modern and vibrant atmosphere. The restaurant is spacious, clean, and welllit, making it a pleasant spot to enjoy a meal. The menu is extensive, featuring a variety of Thai favorites as well as some creative fusion dishes. I was particularly impressed with the attention to detail in both presentation and flavor.

One of the standout dishes I tried was the traditional Thai red curry. The curry was rich and creamy, with just the right amount of spice, making it a perfect comfort food. Another highlight was the vegan stirfry rice noodles, which, despite an initial hiccup with the ingredients, was delicious and wellseasoned. The restaurant also offers a dedicated section for vegan and vegetarian options, which is a thoughtful touch for those with dietary preferences.

The service at FOOD UNIVERSE was impeccable. The staff were friendly, efficient, and more than willing to accommodate special requests. They provided excellent recommendations and were very attentive, ensuring that my dining experience was smooth and enjoyable.

I also appreciated the affordability of the meals. Despite being situated in a prime location, the prices were reasonable, making it a great option for both locals and tourists. The ambiance of the place, combined with the quality of the food, made every baht spent worth it.

In terms of feedback from other diners, FOOD UNIVERSE has garnered positive reviews for its diverse menu and quality service. Many visitors have praised the restaurant for its delicious food and welcoming atmosphere. There were a few mentions of occasional inconsistencies with some dishes, but overall, the reviews have been overwhelmingly positive, highlighting the restaurant's ability to cater to a variety of tastes and dietary needs.

Overall, my experience at FOOD UNIVERSE Thai International Cuisine was exceptional. The combination of great food, excellent service, and a comfortable dining environment makes it a mustvisit spot in Bangkok. If you find yourself near BTS On Nut, I highly recommend stopping by FOOD UNIVERSE for a memorable dining experience. You won't be disappointed. Speechless!!!!!!
It's not cheap and it got great points on Googlemaps so we have expectations.
However, the spaghetti is too salty and the shrimp in it is not fully cooked. It's a little raw. And the fried pork chop is not good either. The noodle soup is almost uneatable. The only notbad item is chips. I saw 4.8 points and went here. DON'T KNOW WHY it is like this!!!!!!! Had lunch here seeing the awesome reviews and also since the place is right next to metro station. Service is nice, however, the food taste in general could have been better. Great atmosphere.  Great food. If you are in the area stop by for a meal.

주소: 372 Thanon Samsen, Khwaeng Talat Yot, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
This joint is perfect.

Service is what I would call "relaxed" which is my polite way of saying that they are perfectly balanced between not giving a toss and being bloody lovely. Food will satisfy the pickiest of eaters as well as purists, and everything is cheap with free ice and Chinese tea to boot away from the bustling street but not difficult to get to, I literally cannot fault this place and I wish I came here sooner so I could eat every second meal here. As all other reviews say, it works for tourists and locals alike and I tend to agree. I saw a complaint about the smells and smoke from the kitchen getting in diners faces but for me this is a plus without question. I want my nostrils to flare with the choices of my fellow diners to sacrifice tomorrow's rear end. Plus that old abandoned floating barge is Wak. Tops. Nice food for a good price. We ate there few times for dinner when we stayed in Bangkok. We never waited for food more than 15mins. Very nice Tom Yum soup! Admittedly, didnt go for the full divein on this one after recovering from some food poisoning on our trip but took some bits here and there of my friends dishes. Love the location. Favourite place to eat before 56 in Bangkok. Have come here almost every day for the past two weeks  and several times on previous journeys. Every dish I've tried here is delicious and fresh. The chefs really have a magic touch.
Prices are surprisingly low for such high quality food. The best food we had in Bangkok. Tasty, super cheap. Great, chilled atmosphere.

주소: Thailand, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon, Vadhana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon, Soi Sukhumvit 63, Horizon Eakkamai
리뷰:
My wife and I recently came back from our first visit to South Korea and she was looking for high rated restaurants in Bangkok. We finally were nearby enough to visit. It did not disappoint. We had only one issue that I had ordered boiled dumplings and received fried but they were still good. Thick dumpling skins. Not recommended to go at 3pm because the resto closed from 3305pm. I went at 305pm and rushed myself badly. The waitress get off from worked punctually. I had my leftover food packed and left at 335pm. Am not sure because I walked in late or not but the cashier seems cold.

Shrimp fried rice has nice aroma from the wok but tasteless and the shrimp is the cheap frozen type. I asked waitress if the combo comes with janjanmian. I misunderstood that it would come with noodle but its not. Another dish is lemon creme shrimp sauce. They use a better quality of shrimp and bigger size. Taste sweet but delish. Better eat fresh cook coz they r batter deep fried. It becomes socky if u pack home. Overall i prefer other dishes i tried before. There definitely seems to be a hygiene issue. I didnt have to go to the hospital like some of the other reviewers, but I had severe diarrhea all night... The food was tasty, but I suffered all night. Im never going back. The restaurant is run by a Korean. Design is simple and clean. Not many tables but it is full when we went for a Sunday lunch. Water and appetizers are at free flow as the same as other authentic Korean restaurants. The price listed on the menu is net price without surcharge.

The dishes are hot and delicious. The portion is very big. The ice cream cooler outside the restaurant is also interesting.

The Thai staff provided not so good services.  However the Korean is very nice. It's just like a Korean style chinese food.
You don't need to pay for the water...
It's better than Korean Chinese restaurant..
I actually don't eat the jjambbong soup whereever I go....
But it's my first time to finish up the soup twice...
It's really delicous...
Aug 31st '24
Still great taste and service..

주소: 313, 315 Maha Chai Rd, Khwaeng Samran Rat, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
I hear the lines are long to eat here. Thankfully my party attended on a Monday afternoon and we were seated right away.

At our table we had shrimp pad Thai, chicken pad Thai, and another shrimp dish. No one was disappointed. One may argue theres smaller, less touristy pad Thai joints, that edge this place out but come here for the iconic experience and wont walk with a disappointed pallet.  We visited this restaurant because it's often hailed as one of the most recommended spots in Bangkok for Pad Thai, with the added prestige of being recognized by Michelin for its street food. The variety of Pad Thai options on the menu was impressive, and the flavors were generally good. However, I found the dish to be a bit too sweet for my taste.

After trying other lesserknown spots around the city, I have to say that this place feels a bit overpriced for what it offers in terms of flavor. While the food is decent, it's not the best Pad Thai Ive had in Bangkok. That said, the service here is topnotchthe staff are friendly and attentive, which made the experience more enjoyable.

The restaurant itself is clean, wellmaintained, and provides a comfortable atmosphere, making it a great place to relax for an extended period. However, both tourists and locals may find it quite expensive, especially given the range of affordable and equally tasty options elsewhere in the city. Overall, its a good place to try, but if you're looking for the best value for money, you might want to explore other options. One of the most famous Thai street food restaurant in Bangkok. The queue was crazy when we were there but we were persistent as well. Waited for a few hours just to have a taste of it but there wasnt any regrets. The pad Thai was really the best I ever had. I wasnt really a pad Thai fan to begin with. I felt that the dish was very heavy on carbohydrates and eating too much made me feel bloated. But the pad Thai here wasnt like that. It wasnt as heavy as I would expected. Savory and sweet at the same time. The prawns were huge and fresh. The prices were high based on local standard but I still thought its worth it. At least try it for once but I probably wouldnt want to queue for hours again. Since 1939, Thipsamai Pad Thai has redefined the standard of Thai street food, serving one of Thailands most famous dishesPad Thai. The original restaurant offers a clean, fully airconditioned environment, making it a comfortable dining experience. The customer service was exceptional, and the food was superb. We thoroughly enjoyed every dish.

We even decided to order takeout and bought some meal prep kits to try at home. Their freshly squeezed orange juice is a musttry!

We highly recommend this restaurantcome and experience it for yourself! I visited this restaurant because its often praised as one of Bangkoks top spots for Pad Thai, even earning recognition from Michelin for its street food. The menu offered a great variety of Pad Thai options, and while the flavors were decent, I found it a bit too sweet for my liking. The highlight for me was the orange juicethough pricey, it was absolutely delicious and highly recommended. Be prepared for long queues.

리뷰:
authentic thai restaurant in the heart of Bangkok  Siam square. good place to stop by after shopping in the area.
good food with reasonable price.
the queu is long but does not take lot of waiting time to get in.
the atmosphere is local vibe, not luxury but clean and well organized.
the taste is quite strong kinda salty to someone but will be balance when eating with rice or rice noodles.
highly recommend green curry dish.
1 thing we did not satisfy was the dish we ordered was out of stock but they only let us know after waiting for almost 20 mins.
last order at 8.15pm and the restaurant closes at 8.30pm. A highly acclaimed and widely recognized restaurant that draws a diverse clientele. While the staff was satisfactory, there was a 30minute wait time. However, we took advantage of this by enjoying a leisurely stroll in the vicinity.

The culinary offerings were prepared promptly and proved to be both delectable and satisfying. There were no dishes that failed to meet our expectations.

Particularly noteworthy were the grandma fried rice and the papaya salad, which we had the pleasure of trying for the first time here and found to be exceptionally wellexecuted.
Prices are reasonable too and cheapish. One of my favorite restaurants in Bangkok during our trip, we went here almost everyday. The line could get pretty long, but it goes by pretty fast. They make one of the best fried rice ive tasted in Bangkok, affordable price too! The food has a high costperformance ratio and tastes great. The service is fast, and there are plenty of seats. Located in the bustling Siam Square, it's very convenient and a great spot for group gatherings! I. Basil Pork  Just average, it is fragrant but the pork is overcooked, and tastes a little powdery
Ii. Phad Thai  Lacking in terms of flavor, just feels quite bland  just slightly sweet, and does not have the fragrance that comes with high heat cooking
Iii. Oyster omelette  crispy omelette which was nice, but oysters are very small and no umami
Iv. Chicken wings  Nice crispy fry on the skin, but as the restaurant wanted to create the illusion of having more by cutting the mid wings into 2, it caused the wing to dry up
V. Tom Yum Goong  The only highlight I had over here, super umami, and not a single component that dominates the whole dish, it is the right amount of spice, acidity, even slight sweetness and light enough to make me want to finish the whole bowl by myself
VI. Larb pork salad  Refreshing side, taste was bright and acidic, making it appetising for other dishes but the meat can be a bit overcookedpowdery

The queue moves relatively fast, but I would say not necessary to visit specially for this unless youre in the area

Food is served relatively slow as well

 This is my best place for food in Bangkok. They have some good choices of food with reasonable price. You will find a long Q but believe me, it is worth to try.
