주소: 92/1-3 94 Rama I Rd, Khwaeng Wang Mai, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand
리뷰:
The Korean barbecue experience was excellent, especially the premium option. The side dishes were plentiful and delicious, so it's advisable not to overorder main dishes. The beef and pork were satisfactory, with a preference for the pork over the beef. Although we opted for the premium beef, it was quite fatty and did not compare to Japanese A5 beef. The pork, however, was exceptional, with each piece labeled according to its aging period. The service was commendable as it ensured we did not get our hands dirty while grilling, allowing us to focus solely on enjoying the meal. Overall, a truly absolutely amazing experience. The grilled meats, side dishes and cold noodles were all very flavourful and tasty.

Service was impeccable, meat grilling was done by their welltrained staff, and side dishes refilled without you even requesting. You only ever needed to lift your hands to feed yourself.

The entire experience was so good that my family and I dropped by twice during our 1 week trip. If you want the best KBBQ experience that Bangkok has to offer, this is the place to go to. A very satisfying Korean BBQ meal! We ordered a beef set 2250 that came with three different types of aged beef, a Korean shabushabu, and various side dishes, including grilled cheese, pineapple, and mushrooms. The beef was tender and delicious. I particularly enjoyed the grilled cheese beef rolls, where melted cheese wrapped around the juicy beef. Just eating the grilled beef alone was filling enough, but we also had the hot pot, mushrooms, and other side dishes...and also watermelon after the meal. It was truly abundant!

The restaurant is only a few minutes walk from the National Stadium station. The atmosphere is great, and the dining space is spacous even you have only two people. You don't have to do the grilling yourself as experienced staff will take care for you. BBQ lovers shouldn't miss it! Phenomenal Korean BBQ experience in Bangkok, only good things to say! Ordered the Beef Set to share between two and it was perfectlyportioned and wellpriced 2,350. The selection of meat was incredible, but me and my boyfriend agreed that the ribeye and short rib were better than the brisket. The banchan was very delicious, we especially loved the japchae and kimchi. The cheesewrapped beef in the end is also a delight, but a very rich mouthful! We ordered tteokbokki and it was also very tasty, with a nice seafood taste. The whole process is so smooth the meat is cooked to your liking by the staff, and the banchan refilled without asking. The staff are very friendly and attentive they ask you how rare you want your meat to be cooked, change the grill according to the meat being cooked, and frequently adjust the exhaust fan so there is no oil spatter they provide aprons and plastic bags for your bags, so if there is any there is not a worry. They dont take reservations and Id imagine it gets pretty busy on the weekends, but we went on a Monday around 6 and didnt have any issues. Better than any Korean BBQ Ive had in London, Singapore, and Toronto, so if youre in Bangkok and want Korean BBQ this is a must! A wonderful well service 2 floors restaurant. The meats are bbq by the staff. As we are eating slowly, the waitress is kind enough to ask if she should stop the bbq and come back later after we finished the meats on the plates.
They are also attentive to you and ask if refill is require when you have finished the side dishes and the sauces.

주소: 54 Surawong Rd, Khwaeng Si Phraya, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand
리뷰:
The Ruenton Restaurant has been awarded the Michelin Bib Gourmand for two consecutive years, thanks to its incredibly delicious Hainanese chicken rice. One order is enough for two people to enjoy.
The restaurant has recently been renovated in a retrochic style.

I went out for lunch with my family. Normally, I would order Hainanese chicken rice, but this time, I decided to try something different. Unfortunately, I was disappointed with my choice because the seafood wasn't freshit was clearly frozen. Considering the price and the fact that this is a hotel restaurant, more attention should have been given to the quality of the ingredients.

For the service, I would rate it 3 out of 5. Compared to the service before the renovation, it was much better back then. The staff used to be very attentive, but now it's not the same, which leaves me feeling disappointed.

I hope that in the future, the restaurant will improve the quality and freshness of the ingredients, as well as the service. If these improvements are made, I will definitely return to dine here again. Chicken rice Chicken rice Chicken rice!
Must try and portion is for 2!! Love the rice, the chicken and the sources.

If you are around the area, would highly recommend the place. It will be pack during lunch hours, arrive before 1100 or after 1330 would be perfect time for lunch. Another great chicken rice!

My my fav menu is absolutely the chicken rice. The bean also surprisingly good. Their yentafo was quite sweet not my preference.

The chicken rice come with huge portion. Which i can share with my mother and both still getting full. Really enjoy every component of it. Good as always.

Ps.their chrysanthemum tea was super aromatic. Nothing much to say it is the legendary place for chicken on rice in Thailand always in TOP 5 best list so you wouldn't go wrong much here but surprisingly the other dish was nice too so i would recommend to try it out Absolutely delicious chicken rice, Chinese food and Thai dessert! I love Chicken rice because the chicken was tender, and the rice perfectly cooked. Great value for money. The staff were friendly, and the ambiance was welcoming like home. The chicken rice exceeded my expectations  flavorful and cooked to perfection. Will definitely be returning.

주소: 186 Dinso Rd, Khwaeng Sao Chingcha, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
Located in a quaint, fairly quiet spot of Bangkok between Khao San and Chinatown Yaowarat, encountered Mit Ko Yuan by chance while looking for good traditional ThaiChinese cuisine. Got some local favourites and some unique takes on regional specialities. The crispy noodles were amazing, the seafood tom yum soup is the perfect mix of sour, spicy and umami, the fried kale with crispy pork was well infused with "wok hei".  The salted egg squid deserves special mention  instead of the crumbly or creamy versions often encountered elsewhere, this version has the salted egg prepared into a smooth, tart and savoury sauce that is very appetising and not overly rich. Definitely will definitely come back! This is a very old ThaiChinese restaurant that serves homestyled dishes.

Mr Saksun, the current proprietor's grandfather started the business about 100 years ago after arriving in Thailand from Hainan by boat.

It is open everyday but only during lunch and dinner hours only, not the whole day. There are two sitting areas, the front section is non air conditioned and back section is air conditioned. Prices of food are the same, irrespective of where we sit.

The taste of the food is authentically delicious and reminds us of homecooked food. Service is fast. Prices are very reasonable too.

A very recommendable place. One of the masks around this area food prices is reasonable you cannot miss the crispy noodles. The recipe is over that 80 years ago since King Rama V. The parboil cockles is so good. And the Tom Yum is pretty nice. Aircon room available, if you want. Small family run Thai place. Its run in third generation since 1966. They still have the original first menu on the wall.

Very nice Tom Yum. Well balanced with a touch of sourness.also the deep fried beef and razor clams are excellent.

The place has a beautiful old style front room with fan and a back room with AC. Service is very good as well. If youre looking for an authentic dining experience in Bangkok with absolutely delicious homecooked dishes, you have to stop by Mit Ko Yuan. They serve the kind of ChineseThai cuisine that locals with Chinese ancestry would eat on a daily basis. Most of the dishes have been on the menu for years and the recipes have stayed the same. Their dishes are simple and absolutely delicious. Super affordable. Very causal. A great option for casual lunch or dinner in the old town area. My favorite dishes are their stirfried morning glory and Tom Yum Kung. Im Thai and I can tell you that the way they do it here is the way we cook at home!

주소: 32 32/1 Soi Sukhumvit 23, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
The grilled pork appetizer was amazing with the sauce.  I loved the southern fish curry.  It was very spicy but was also very flavorful.  I was warned not to order it but Im happy I did.  The only disappointment was the mango and sticky rice.  The mango was soft but had no flavor.  Ive had much better mango on the breakfast buffet at the Mandarin Oriental. The name probably says it, a very local taste with quality ingredients and some rare ingredients from different regions of Thailand. Solid, not fancy, though quite pricey matching up to their Michelin Bib Gourmand. The highlight dish for me was the Massamun beef cheeks which melts in your mouth. The mixed appetizer was a nice little opening adventure. Great atmosphere, a good place to bring foreign guests. I visit The Local every time I come to Bangkok.  It has always been outstanding.  Except this time.  Everything I had tonight from the lemon grass salad to the curry, to the tea and desert, was overly sweet and unidimensional.  It wasnt that anything was bad.  The place is still very nice and the service highly attentive.  But rather, much better flavour can be found on more humble, often small and plastic, tables just outside. This is my second time.

Food superb. 1010 Ask for less spicy if you cant take spicy food.

Service very good. Foods and drink served very fast.

Atmosphere traditional Thai style design with antique decorations. Indoor with air conditioned and outdoor with fan.

Highly recommended. Please make reservation before you come. This place is really pretty and the environment is wonderful. Only issue I had was the service staff, although they are busy, its not right to totally ignore customer and constantly showing an unhappy attitude.
Food was great and I enjoyed it, everything came out fast and hot, which is really good.
But dont think Ill visit again, many other places with much better service to dine at.

주소: 1481 Charoen Krung Road, Khwaeng Silom, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand
리뷰:
A cozy restaurant with a cool vibe and a tourist friendly menu.

The menu is quite extensive with a wide selection of Western and Thai food. We ordered a simple and delicious lunch of Pad Thai 210b, Oyster Omelette 180b and Stir Fry Morning Glory 150. The serving size is quite generous.

Service is friendly.

Note because our meal is less than 1000b in total, an additional charge of 3 is added for payment with credit card, on top of the 7 VAT. The restaurant is good for young generation and salary man.

Food Good for all ingredients and simple menus with delicious  tast. The squids  were excellent including local salad.

Service Good in attention and come to ask satisfaction time by time.

Location Not really roof top restaurant just 4th floor of business building. We need to walk up until the last step. Quite difficult for senior citizens or who has problems with knees.

We will think again if decision to go there. 1st time to be here which followed the review from others. The location is good you can take the train to Taksin then walk only 2 minutes. But parking is limited you need to park somewhere nearby with paid service. The rooftop is nice can see the city view and enjoy the windy if lucky. Or else, you can sit indoor from 1st floor to 5st floor, if you prefer the live band the 5st floor will be good choice. Foods are good you can pick the recommended dishes from the menu list with reasonable price. The drink is and option for beers or you can go with liquor but no wine list. This is my first stop in Bangkok. Was hungry after getting to the hotel, saw it was close and had a good rating. Amazing. The pork belly was sweet and crunchy. I had the spicy raw salmon dish and wow. Not just a spicy dish, so many flavors like I was hoping, like a spicy ceviche. Last thing I had was the beef curry.  Delicious. I didnt get it as the waiter said Thai spicy, but I should have. Very delicious! Sat on the rooftop bar and the atmosphere was lovely for dinner.We tried out the chinese cabbage, amongst many other things such as the crispy pork belly and pork shoulder which both melted in our mouths, after not having it before, it won over the whole family, so definitely worth trying if you come! Zaw was a lovely waiter and so were all the other staff! Recommend massively

주소: 68 Sukhumvit 21 Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
This place was recommended to us by a Korean local who has been living in Bangkok for decades, claiming it's the best  she's had anywhere.

It certainly did not disappoint. Portions are generous and the taste was amazing.

The  was just ok but the seafood jjajangmyun and jjampong were  I visited Aisung in Pattaya and I was so satisfied that I visited Aisung in Bangkok this time.
It was really nice to hear ".   ." I don't know about Bangkok, but in Chiang Mai Korean restaurant, most Korean owners leave their seats.
That's why most people order from Thai staff when they go to Korean restaurants.
As expected, the food was really good as well as welcome Korean.
A couple of 7 and 8yearold kids visited together and ordered 2 ganjjajang, sweet and sour pork medium size, 2 plates of fried dumplings, and yangjangpi.
It was so good to order how good the yangjangpi was.
Every food I ordered was so delicious.
I ordered a lot of food and ate it at home because I packed lots of leftover food, but it was also so delicious.
The staff were also so kind and especially a young Korean female employee I don't know if she is the boss was so kind.
And my daughter said she is so pretty.  Everything was the perfect meal.
Thank you. We are visiting Bangkok for the first time and craved some jjajangmyun and jjompong noodles and of course tangseuyuk sweet and sour pork. All the dishes were excellent and simply better than the same dishes in the greater Seattle area. The next time we visit Bangkok, we are seriously considering getting a room in this neighborhood for easy access to Isung  Taste is really good and size is no joke. If you come alone you can order small size. Vibe and services are friendly. And they play all Kpop music  Found the restaurant on google and decided to try out the food and it was great experience!!
Chef is Korean, all dishes has small size if you come alone or big portion for group sharing. Strong recommend the Tangsuyuk

주소: 20, 1 Thanon Khao San, Khwaeng Talat Yot, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
A decent restaurant if youre looking to try some very unique and interesting flavors as well as some of the most popular dishes from Thailand and India for very decent prices.

Very tasty food available for dine in or takeout. Seafood was tasty but a little overcooked. Very tasty Tom Yum soup and fried rice. The dragon fruit frappe was delicious too!

Friendly, fast and efficient service. Available also in Thai and English.

Payments accepted with cash or card.

Reservations not needed even on weekdays during busy season.

Handicap friendly and wheelchair accessible. Seating area a bit tricky and smelly

Parking is safe and easy nearby.

Printed menu.

Vegetarian options available.

Outdoor seating with fans. The best street food in Khaosen road.
We arrived here at peak dinner hour. However, the staff were helpful in getting us a table promptly.
Contrary to other Street vendors, their menu is really limited but made us wish we order every item.
Served on a cute bamboo platter, each dish is adequate for 1 person and hence priced accordingly. Quality, hygiene and taste was top notch.
You can enjoy the hustle of the Khaosen road while enjoying your meal we also enjoyed live music from next door cafe.
Must recommended in Khaosen !! The Mixed Fried Rice is excellent! Their shakes are also amazing we got strawberry, passionfruit, mango and they gave me a whole coconut! Still not sure if that was supposed to be made into a shake instead of sold whole We also got a squid fried rice and a spicy pork basil rice thing. While it was all delicious my american taste buds were not ready for thai spicy. The mango shake has bland taste. Pad thai was okay. I can get a better shake from other the stand on the same street with the same price. Ngl.
I would say this should be a Thai restaurant that surprises me THE MOST during the trip half of the trip now lmao
Tiny restaurant but exceedingly TASTY!
Pad Thai good!
Stir fried water morning glory wondrous!
Spicy glass noodles salad BLEW ME AWAY!
Watermelon and mango shake are completely outstanding!
10 out of 10!
Budget friendly, relatively large proportion.
I have been to NARA Thai cuisine. But I love this one more than NARA. TBH, this Thai restaurant is def a mustgo!

리뷰:
Great place! Cold beer, fresh hot food, quick and charming service, and great price  we sat outside to soak up some Bangkok atmosphere, which was great for us, but fully airconned inside if that is more you! Well worth a visit if you are in this neck of the woods! Loved it! Excellent visit  food! The place was packed with only few free tables, but they were able to handle the service very fast. Tasty food with reasonable prices. Awesome staff! Brought the family here for their first Thai meal, and it definitely did not disappoint! It was a good welcome meal especially that they have not had much Thai food previously. Highly recommended if youre in the area.

Minor comment the pad thai noodles were not as firm, probably slightly overcooked. Second visit of this restaurant in Bangkok on July 24.
We arrived at dinner time..Restaurant was pretty full because has just probably 89 tablesbut we got fast our table.
Our order arrived very fast and had good taste.
Also here u can ask spicy how u like .
All dinner was smooth and was a pleasure eat here..food,atmosphere and staff.
See u soon again very authentic and flavourful food here! the food was prepared and served very quickly and they were very savoury and yummy. left me feeling more hungry.

주소: 65th Floor State Tower Bangkok 1055 Si Lom Rd, Khwaeng Silom, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand
리뷰:
Came here to celebrate my birthday. Excellent service that you can expect from a two Michelin stars establishment. I like the main course and their complimentary fresh baked sour dough bread. The special add on menu, the oyster from the chefs home town was creamily delicious. Other menus are creative. It was a great experience dining here. Great services and amazing view of the city. Food was very enjoyable, especially with the pairing. Great sommelier, who gave us a different wine for the dessert which we enjoyed a lot. Overall, among some of the best restaurants in Bangkok. My husband and I were delighted with this restaurant. Our friends also admire him
We were kindly given the best table in front of the open kitchen in honor of our wedding anniversary and were also given a wonderful dessert.
The workers are polite, speak good English and are professional.
We visited this place in December, the menu from the chef was magnificent I still can't forget the dish with sea urchin caviar, avocado and black caviar, and my husband dreams of the amazing Kobe beef You don't stay hungry, there are many dishes and each dish is special.
This place really deserves two Michelin stars, great experience! Thanks to the boss and his team for the work done By any measure, Good. Relative to others in the same price range, that is the question!

For a start, we would say that you Must do the wine or sake pairing. Without this, half the magic is lost. The sommelier has put some thought into trying to bring out flavours with the wine. That said, some pairings are better than others. The thing we like to look out for is when the resultant experience is greater than the sum of both parts food and winesake. This happened for some and not others. But nothing clashed, for sure.

If you're there with cooperative company, a good plan is to get 1 of each option and share. The staff don't seem to mind at all and even suggested this. What's the use in getting uptight about this anyway as we see in some Other places! We had the summer menu. All good. Truffle menu with Black truffles isn't our thing but that's just us white truffles are a different matter.

Interesting to note katsuramuki   cucumbers as opposed to dicon smoke infused Wagyu not just binchotan and not the usual Straw flamed stuff  good use of Koji shima I came to celebrate my girlfriends birthday, we had an amazing experience. The food was outstanding specially with the Japanese twist. I took the Sake pairing something rare but incredible. The service was very meticulous and attentive to detail I will be back for sure.

주소: เลขที่ 13 Thanon Tanao, Khwaeng Wat Bowon Niwet, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
So so beautiful!

At first I thought the meals were a bit pricey but they are definitely worth what they cost. Not only is the food absolutely delicious but also beautifully presented and super colorful.

The ambience is lovely and the service very friendly. Must visit!

This restaurant is so good I came back 2 more times to try other dishes on the menu

Many vegan options, the food is delicious, but the presentation takes the cake. Beautifully served, I had to take photos of everything

The staff are super nice and friendly, there are cute cats and the place is just a great vibe

Also the coffee was the best so far in Bangkok for me The curry was mindblowingly delicious!! So many interesting ingredients and spices included. I was in heaven at this place. The staff was very kind and know the difference between vegan and vegetarian. I wish i could try everything. Dont miss it! Its the most delicious thing Ive eaten in Thailand so far. We absolutely loved it!
As somebody who has severe problems with dairy products and anxiety regarding unsafe foods and drinks i felt incredibly safe with the meals at Mango! I was so happy to have found the restaurant on my very first day in Thailand. I probably went there 34 times.
The food options are amazing and the size of the plates astronomical. You will definitely not be hungry afterwards! Drinks and desserts are also very enjoyable and delicious.
Bonus they had 2 cute cats that were in the front from time to time I've visited here a number of times over the years and have never been disappointed. The restaurant serves healthy vegan food in large portions at reasonable prices. Big enough to share! They also have gluten free options on the menu
It usually gets quite busy after 7pm, so go early to avoid the rush.
Today, we ate banana, gluten free pancakes with coconut ice cream, cruffle with fruit, coconut ice cream and chocolate sauce. Fruity som tam.
There is a range of drinks on offer including herbal tea. I highly recommend adding this place to your list

주소: 54 Soi Sukhumvit 19, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
Food is very nice. Staff service is friendly and excellent. I like the magic so much while waiting the food. Id highly recommended this restaurant. We were very happy to come. Hello my fellow followers and everyone else who want to read this review!

I never knew this restaurant existed but I was really intrigued by the name and lo and behold I took my dinner group here last night for some really good Indian food!

We got 4 people to join our group and we had a great conversation we all ordered something little and it was tasty!

I was really hankering for the daal tharka fry with tandoori roti and I love it!  I asked for the onions and green chilies with lime on the side so I can put it inside my daal!

Some people ordered the MurgMalai and naan and other ordered a lamb kebab and one had the paneer also with naan!

Wine  beer  was plenty so it was a good conversation overall!

Best part was when the owner started showing us some magic tricks with cards it left us intrigued  and puzzled  and wowed !!

We had a really good time and had a good conversation with the owner Mr. Singh!

I would highly recommend if youre in the area to have a quick bite or a nice family meal it would be a really nice place to go for Indian food!! 

Follow Fauzia  for more foodie adventures in and around Bangkok and beyond you can follow us here as well as Instagram Facebook YouTube and TikTok!! Click the link in our bio to see more indepth reviews!!! 
 We read the reviews and happily were entertained by Mr Singh. The food is delicious and not the standard Indian. A big call out to the caring staff as our son had sore pool eyes. We took the leftovers home and they even included 3 plates and cutlery. Spotless, caring and tasty. We had 3 starters and 2 mains with garlic naan  and rice. I had the pleasure of dining at Indique, again on September 10th.  The food was absolutely delicious,  The seasonings were well balanced and the flavor superb.  It should be noted that the staff are very attentive and friendly.  I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone that enjoys the taste of India.  This will be one of my new "GoTo" restaurants.  The location is also excellent as it is a very short walk from the Terminal 21 mall.  Truly enjoyable! Newly started Indian Restaurant. Food taste is good. A bit expensive 2 people 1000 THB ordered 3 items. Ambience is good and new place. Should try and checkout and only Indian restaurant on Sukhumvit Soi 19

주소: 444 Floor 2, MBK Center, ถ. พญาไท แขวงวังใหม่ เขตปทุมวัน กรุงเทพมหานคร 10330, Thailand
리뷰:
To all food lovers, the dishes were tasty and reasonably priced. Not street food cheap, but more in line with casual restaurant pricing. The flavors were great and not spicy, which some might appreciate. We had two curries, two pork dishes, and four drinks for 1100 baht. The downside? The ambiancebeing in a mall didnt add much charm, and the service was incredibly slow. But overall, the food made it worth a try! This place looks famous.  I have bookmarked it some times ago and finally I tried it.  I ordered lemon sauce fish and fried veggie.  The fish comes with a small fire to keep the fish and soup hot.  The fire will be gone about 5 minutes so it won't over cook the fish.  The fish is fresh and the size is right.  Both items are super tasty and both are a bit too spicy to me.  After the meal I feel thirsty so I guess the food is added with msg. First time trying Thai food in MBK mall. Despite what other reviews say, I thought the food was pretty good.  Papaya salad and morning glory were spicy as hell, but I still finished them because they were super delicious. Chicken wings and shrimp springrolls were pretty good, but a bit greasy.  Nonetheless, I thought it was pretty good value for money. I am going back for lunch. 6 ladies meal!

The food here is really affordable and very delicious!! We ordered
 5 bowls of steam rice
 2 Coke Zero, 1 lemonade, 1 Thai lemon tea, 1 Thai milk tea, 1 tomato juice
 Shrimp Cake very crispy and fluff
 Steamed Sea Bass very flavourful spicy  sour
 Egg Omelette not bad, fluff and not dry
 Rice cracker with dip the sauce is cold and not much minced meat
 Papaya Salad  Refreshing and flavourful one of the best so far!
 Tom Yum Soup Prawn we wanted the clear soup but it came with the red milky one. The soup was ok.
 Grilled Pork Shoulder Juicy, and mustorder
 Stir fried Cabbage in fish sauce could be cooked longer as it is a big crunchy full of Wok Hei taste!
 Mango Sticky Rice really creamy and nice
 Red Ruby if you like the ruby tapioca layer to be thinner and the chestnut to be huge bits then this is it! very fragrant!

Overall all the dishes are very very good! Must come and must try!

2756Baht This restaurant has moved from Siam Square to MBK. Tried several in their old location and first time trying it here in MBK. Their fried chicken wings is really crispy and delicious. Other dishes worth trying are the som tam, shrimp cake, steamed fish, fried cabbage and pineapple rice.

Highly recommended

주소: 392, 2 Maha Rat Road, Khwaeng Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
Fire Penang curry. Can get a good meal for 80120 baht. Fast service at this very busy spot!! Locals  Tourists. They make fresh lime juice too, so I had a lime soda. It was fresh and 60 baht.

They have wifi  AC  fresh coconuts. Dedicated vegetarian menu, too! We stopped here to grab a bite while visiting the temples and palace, and take shelter from the heat. We had to line up, but not for long we were third in line and waited less than 10 min. Staff is welcoming and seems used to foreigners. Venue is a bit crowded but at a cool temperature.

Decently sized menu, we enjoyed the shrimp fried rice and green curry with pork. For some dishes like the curry you get to choose between mild and spicy but beware, we found the mild option was still quite spicy. Would come back again! Quick and friendly service. Limited seating area. Menu are all thai traditional dish. There's clean toilet inside. Perfect place to cool down after exploring Wat Pho, before crossing to Wat Arun. The coconut price is cheap, even cheaper than some street seller. Will come back if we are in the area next time. Pad kra pao and pad thai taste good, drinks are refreshing. Friendly staff, nice cool Aircon to cool down after visiting Sleeping Buddha.
Highly recommend the Thai Egg Omelette see pic! Wished I had more. Thai ice tea was legit tast too.  Thai curry was ok but too watery prefer thick gravy. Sweat sour was ok to good. Minced pork rice was nice and spicy. Came back 7 years later and pad Thai only increase by 10 baht ! Impressed and taste exquisite still  happy us!

주소: 392/16 Maha Rat Road, Khwaeng Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
A friend recommended me this restaurant as he shared about the nice ambience and food quality. We booked this place in advance and so excited when we got here. We got the seat by the window with reservation time at 530pm and got the best sunset view! Staff were attentive and helpful , checking in on us if we enjoyed the food. It certainly helped in the whole dining experience. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone who wishes to have authentic Thai food with good service and fantastic view of Wat Arun Temple ! One of the best meals we had on our trip to Bkk. If you ever find yourself near Wat Arun, this is a must go. Big portions, so much flavour, 1010 amazing. I had a fantastic experience at RONGROS, best food I have ever eaten in my life, The food was delicious, full of authentic flavors, and beautifully presented. The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming, making the whole visit even more enjoyable. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for great Thai cuisine!
Special thanks to Iva and the stuff for the welcoming host! Thanks again for all!
Looking forward to visiting you again from the US Thank you for the nice lunch we had. The restaurant is not as spacy as you think, but enough for 2030 seats at once. Lunch or dinner are avail for a satisfying menu to enjoy with the view of the river and boats. Need to pay attention to the toilet, need more lighting and routine cleaning service. Appreciate the staffs, chefs and waiters for excellent taste, services and the hospitality. This place made a great impression. The taste of the food is very delicious. The atmosphere of the restaurant can greatly enhance the enjoyment of eating. The staff take good care of you. I think I'll come back if I have a chance.

주소: 371, 373 Yaowarat Rd, Khwaeng Samphanthawong, Khet Samphanthawong, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10100, Thailand
리뷰:
Traditional Chinese restaurant in the heart of Chinatown. There are some unusual dishes on the menu such as the pork rib in preserved rice flour, intensely seasoned bacony pork ribs served with a variety of raw vegetables and aromatics as pallet cleansers. My favourite was the braised duck with dumplings. The duck melted in the mouth, just the right amount of gamey taste and very juicy. The shrimp dumplings had very slippery casings but the shrimp.filling was awesome. Great meal at a reasonable price. Antique kinda chandelier and the down lights were charming the atmosphere one might miss. The staff were friendly and we were usher to our seats without delay. Orders were facilitated even with different languages. This restaurant is endorsed to be 9.510 by my 83yo Chinese dad. The 0.5 loss was due to the stir fry kailan with salted fish to be abit too salty. Both of us thumbs up on their mixed meat platter, especially their duck. Simply Mesmerising. A traditional Chinese restaurant in the heart of Bangkoks China Town suitable for killing the hunger after enjoying barhopping in the area. Authentic taste for me. Id give five stars if I didnt have to go out for an ATM to get cash to pay.  We were at Wat Arun. We took the ferry to Siam Center and then to Chinatown ferry stop. My daughter found this restaurant. She did an incredible job picking this location. The food was amazing. The service was on point. Prices are a bit steeper than traditional Thai restaurants, but it was worth it. We had a variety of dishes from BBQ pork sticky buns, shrimp spring rolls, chick3n dumplings, noodles with duck, and fried noodles with chicken. their food is not bad here, noodle is the most great among all the menu i ordered here, the roasted duck also good too

however to talk about their dimsums i guess not really for me, just ok only
and their dumplings is nah, disappointed coz the rice is uncooked inside and not hot at all

service is very fast and responsive

주소: 195 N Sathon Rd, Khwaeng Silom, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand
리뷰:
The decorations for the restaurant is comfortable with background music. The breakfast buffet with one main cause start from 630 to 1030 every morning. I have stayed three nights in this hotel ASAI that means I had three breakfast buffets while I stay at hotel. The food is delicious and the service is good. Its more than I expected. One of the staff in restaurant named Guide is very nice with his good service. Actually the all staffs are very nice. As the food is delicious and the service is good, thats why I want to share with others. God blessed everyone. April 2024 Absolutely love the fried eggs and fried chicken skin at this restaurant! The combination is divine, and the flavors are unparalleled. A musttry for anyone looking for unique and delicious dishes. The service is excellent too.

July 2024 Back with friends so that I can tried more dishes. I highly recommend their fried egg salad This restaurant is located on the second floor of a hotel, and we were greeted upon arrival. The service was friendly but quite slow we had to wave them down to get utensils and water after our food arrived.

Now, onto the food everything we ordered was absolutely delicious! My favorites included 14 Nang Kai Tort, which is chicken skin that strangely tasted like potato chips but was very good 25 Moo Sam Chan, kojimarinated pork belly with excellent sauce and seasoning 25 Pad Gra Pao Nua, minced beef with basil and a fried egg and 36 Yum Kai Dao, a spicy salad with egg and toasted rice that burned my mouth but was impossible to stop eating. My least favorite was 12 Khao Niew, steamed sticky rice, which was bland and slightly too firm.

We also ordered a highball and a Sathorn Thai. However, the Sathorn Thai required multiple followups before it finally arrived, and it tasted like just gin and lemongrass because they seemed to have forgotten the brown sugar. After adding the brown sugar ourselves, it tasted much better. Overall, the food was good, and we are glad we got to try it. The total cost for everything we ordered was about 55 USD. Shaken, Stirred, and Seduced A Cocktail Masterclass at Asai Hotel

My recent cocktail workshop at Err bar in Asai Hotel was a delightful blend of education and indulgence. The inviting atmosphere of the bar, coupled with the expert guidance of the mixologist, made for an unforgettable experience.

The workshop began with a brief overview of the history and techniques of cocktail making. Our instructors Khun M and Khun Fluke were incredibly knowledgeable and passionate, sharing fascinating anecdotes and tips along the way. We then got down to business, learning how to prepare new recipe cocktails with melon and dragonfruit.

The handson experience was particularly enjoyable. We were provided with all the necessary tools and ingredients, and the instructor patiently guided us through each step of the process. It was a great opportunity to learn new skills and experiment with different flavors.

The highlight of the evening was undoubtedly the tasting session. We had the chance to sample our creations and compare them to the instructor's expertly crafted cocktails. It was a delicious way to appreciate the nuances of each drink and to see how small changes can make a big difference.

Overall, the cocktail workshop here at Asai Hotel was a fantastic experience. Whether you're a seasoned cocktail enthusiast or just looking for something fun to do, I highly recommend checking it out. Food is great!! Staff is super friendly. We have had breakfast here two days in a row complimentary breakfast and they didnt disappoint at all!! My fave is the fried chicken sourdough and the passion fruit in the continental breakfast bar. We also received great help and warm welcome from staff especially Guide and Rudy!! Would love to stay here again ! Location of the hotel is excellent, its around 34 mins walk from the saint louis BTS station!! Only 4 stations from Siam.

주소: 76 Soi Samsen 2, Khwaeng Ban Phan Thom, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
Really, a lovely barrestaurant. It's in a quiet enough street, and it felt quite serene and idyllic, sitting outside and enjoying a cold shake or a cocktail.

The service was polite and helpful throughout.

The drinks' prices were reasonable. He food was a bit on the pricier side of what you can find in the area, but it was tasty.

The venue is the best part. It's really welcoming and relaxing. I can't say enough good things about So Samsen! From the moment you step in, you're greeted with warm smiles and an inviting atmosphere. The authentic Thai cuisine here is simply unparalleled. Every dish is bursting with flavor, from the spicy tom yum soup to the perfectly balanced pad Thai. The ingredients are always fresh, and the presentation is beautiful.

The staff at So Samsen are incredible. I come here quite often, and they always take amazing care of me. They go above and beyond to make sure you have an exceptional dining experience. They're attentive, friendly, and always ready with great recommendations. The ambiance is cozy and perfect for both intimate dinners and larger gatherings.

If you're in Bangkok and looking for an unforgettable meal, So Samsen is the place to be. It's a hidden gem that deserves all the recognition and more. I highly recommend it to anyone craving authentic Thai flavors. Your taste buds will thank you! The foods are delicious !! The drinks are strong and tasty !! Services are beyond standard, staff are friendly and very helpful. The Lady owner is very kind Love the decoration, would look great at a beach. Had the banana blossom salad and the green curry. Both were excellent. They have a good menu that covers a bit more than the standard tourist fare. Super great people, very nice and polite,great food and atmosphere,ok prices.We will come again when we come back in Bangkok

주소: 6 Soi Sukhumvit 8, Khwaeng Khlong Toei, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
Took breakfast here two days.
Good coffee.
Good menu for a full breakfast or something lighter.
Big western selection and a few thai options for breakfast.
Not busy when we went at about 9am each day.
Quick and fresh. Open kitchen.
Place always busy when we passed at night too.
Inside and outside seating offered. Overall great experience, friendly staff, great tasting food. Big portions for the money as well. Simply very nice Love this place. I have been there for both breakfast and dinner. Wide selection of foods from Thai to Mexican to pizzas you name it. Great place to chill to have a drink all day eatery really. The staff even though very friendly sometimes there's a language barrier but their kindness and willingness to take care of their guests makes up for it. Prices are a bit higher than usual but the quality is good. Sometimes there's live music there if you are lucky. Great place It was the second time now that I entered the restaurant through the hotel door and ordered the breakfast offer for hotel guests with extras. Because nobody asked if I wanted coffee or tea, I already knew something had gone wrong. I had to order my coffee later and again request the included fruit plate and water. The food is very good so far, but please train your staff. It's very disappointing. The food and the atmosphere here is very good. We had lunch here. They offer Thai food, as well as western food,burgers,pizza and fish and steak. We ordered vegetarian Thai fried rice which was delicious! And green chicken curry along with jasmine rice. Medium spice, really tasty, chicken very tender. Overall amazing! Price is also good. The waiters super nice. I recommend this bar also to just have a beer or nice tomate juice!

주소: 8 Soi Tha Tian, Khwaeng Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
This traditional momandpop Thai restaurant is a hidden gem! The food was fantastic, especially the chicken cashew, which was perfectly seasoned and flavorful. The stirfried basil was an excellent choice, as alwaysfull of authentic Thai flavors. To top it off, the watermelon shake was simply amazingrefreshing and delicious! If youre looking for a cozy spot with great food, this place is a mustvisit. The papaya salad IS amazong. Order It!!!
Th thai shrimp  corn salad oh my god!!!
You can change the shrimp for tofu.
The service IS EXCELENT.
THE music.... SUPER RELAXING
The food..SUPER!!!!! Delicious Thai fast food. Good for a quick bite out of the heat. Food was delicious and with the right amount of spice. All Meals Sawasdee at Bangkok is a very small restaurant near the Wat Pho temple. You will find a lot of locals and westerners here and the place is super crowded always. We had to wait for 20 minutes whore we got our seats. The restaurant can seat around 25  to 30 people max. The food was too good and we enjoyed every meal we ordered. I loved the sea food Thai fried rice names are different in Thai language, however I would recommend you try them. The portion quantity is perfect and it is not less or more. Food was served quick and the staff are super fast. They are too busy to even give you an eye contact which is understandable as the crowd as large. I will recommend you to try this place out if you are in this area. Great food, good atmosphere. We had authentic Pad Thai, Pineapple shrimp fried rice and spring rolls. The taste was really good and the attention was amazing.

리뷰:
Food Excellent the taste is original as expected which the kitchen team really work hard to get this state. The product really fresh and matched with all ingredients. We were ordered five dishes it was really impressive.

Location Excellent along the river great executive view.

Service Opposite site with food comments. All staff,  doesn't have patterns of service and how to handle guests request, food or else. Staff needs to pay attention with customer as per many guests always wave their hands to ask for help. We went there last night. After food arrived on our table, no one come to care our table anymore once we need to order more food.

Their need to Training for customer service. We visited the place during lunchtime, it's beautiful. The food is good and affordable. It's more beautiful and romantic during sunset to dinner because of the lights surrounding the area, the bridge and  band music.
Staff are nice and accommodating too.   visited Monday, 7pm.
Sold out dishes Crab w Vermicilli, Small Crab w curry powder. River prawn small

Ordered
1 Chef Recommendation Vermicelli w prawn and veg. Super dry and unflavourful. Look at photo.
2 Tom Yum Soup  taste like Salt water, very little herbs used. absolutely disgusting.
3 Salted egg yolk squid  Overdose of garlic. no salted egg taste. squid texture acceptable.
4 Chef Recommendation Crab Omelette  Super dry. yucks.

Overall. great views 55. Great live band, volume just nice. Great place for drinks and finger food but not for serious dining. The location next to the river is great. There is live music. Service is friendly and efficient. The decor is practical and with high ceilings. Check the weather for rain. Book the Aircon room if it is going to rain. You can still get photos later. Food is average. Check the freshness of the river prawns. I was really looking forward to visiting this place, but unfortunately, my experience was disappointing. Some friends from Thailand had recommended it to me for my birthday, so I made a reservation. However, the service was subpar. They asked if I was alone, then moved me to a table by the side, took ages to take my order, and never brought me the bill, even when I requested it. They also mentioned that if I'd booked through Facebook, I'd get a free dessert for my birthday, which seemed odd. It felt like they prioritized tables with bigger groups, which didn't align with my expectations of Thai hospitality. The venue itself is lovely, and the ambiance is great, but they could improve the service to make it a better experience for customers, especially solo visitors like myself.

First day, I had a take out and then the food was so good that I decided to eat at the restaurant. You have to experience hospitality of the restaurant. The staff members were very friendly. Great jazz music to make you feel relaxed!!! Great atmosphere ambiance and decorations. If you happen to be near Democracy Monument area, please please stop by and try it for yourself.

I had the chicken pad thai today but will try other Pad Thai from this restaurant and will edit and give added review

Second day, Shrimp with Fried Noodles, restaurant's specialty!!!

I absolutely highly highly recommend this restaurant  SUPER! Crispy pad thai was amazing. One of our favourite pad thai in Thailand or abroad. Friendly service. Went before lunch around 11am and the place was empty but they were very welcoming and we had a delicious meal. Amazing shrimp pad thai! My friend doesn't eat vegetables and they did some fried noodles with only chicken because of that, also very good. The staff is extremely nice and friendly! First time to visit here. I ordered Pad Thai crispy noodles , it was so good. Highly recommended if you guys want to try a fun and yummy dish.You better try this restaurant!!  Great food! This place has a great atmosphere as well as phenomenal service. They are always willing to help and answer questions. Not to mention the food is great as well. They make the best original crispy pad Thai and the tea is really refreshing. 1010 would eat again

주소: 113 ซอย จรัสเมือง Khwaeng Rong Muang, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand
리뷰:
The first thing you will notice is the immense queue to dine at this place. The big question, is it any good? Does it live up to the hype surrounding this place?

The biggest draw here is its version of Mama Tom Yum noodles. If you stripe it all down, its just instant noodles but, Jeho Chula elevates this humble dish into something entirely different.. it came out amazing. Dont forget to order the raw salmon and roast pork as well.

Go try it at least once when youre in Bangkok. Overcrowded but good food. We had our luck , when we came this restaurant and no wait time no queue.
We came in the right time and right moment.
The food really good, a very good thai food.
We ordered 
 tom yum noodle soup
 spicy salmon salad
 sausage
 crispy pork
All good and awesome.
We will come back here again someday. Be prepared for a long line, but the food is definitely worth it! I was lucky and didnt have to wait too long that evening. We loved everything we ordered. I recommend to come with some friends so that you could try different dishes. The Mama Tom Yum noodle soup is a must! Ill come back again to try other dishes, with the Mama Tom Yum noodle soup for sure! Yummy local fare but be prepared to wait. There was a long line of people waiting on a midweek evening at about 5.30pm. go straight to the counter near the door to get a number then explore the many kiosks and eateries in the area before returning to wait for your number to be called. The tom yam noodle was very good. The pork had crispy skin and comes in big chunks, delicious. Worth the wait. We were curious to try the food since there were so many people lining up. We took a number and waited about 30 minutes to get a table. We ordered noodle soup, prawns, and fried scallops.

Noodles 8.510
Generous portions with a comforting, slightly sour but refreshing broth. Ill definitely order it again.

Prawns 910
Fresh prawns with a mild to medium spiciness and good portions.

Fried Scallops 710
I would have preferred them grilled instead of fried.

Overall, the experience was great. The service was fast, the atmosphere was nice, and the prices were reasonable. It was not disappointing!

주소: 155 Soi Sukhumvit 11/1, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
Not too sure whats the hype but the food is average at best. Not worth the queue. The best dish however was the pork boar noodles whereby the broth and meat was pretty tender.
Do not, and I reiterate do not order any other sides. Take my word for it. Hands down, this is the best Thai food I've ever had!! This place has truly set the bar high. We tried a variety of dishes from the menu, and everything was delicious! My first bite of Chicken Larb with white rice was amazing! The aroma of fresh basil was simply intoxicating. The shrimp pad thai, Thailands national dish, was really good. And those wings? Perfection! They had just the right balance of crispness and tenderness, without being greasy. Also, if you get the chance to sit on those high chairs facing the bustling city of Bangkok, it's definitely an experience.

I would give this place more than 5 stars  We had a fantastic family dinner at this excellent Thai restaurant. The food was authentic and flavorful, offering a true taste of Thai cuisine. However, the restaurant was quite popular, and we had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated. Despite the wait, the dining experience was worth it, and the service was attentive once we were seated. Highly recommend it for a family meal. Came out for breakfast here good price good food especially for breakfast.

Braised beef noodle was great, curry noodle was alright, and mango smoothie and Thai milk tea also great as well. 

PS. You can pay with credit card if total order is over 200 baht. Location in Sukhumvit area, very close to Nana station

Food too spicy for me. We ordered seafood vermicilis salad, chicken with rice, chicken green curry fried rice, thai milk tea. The salad was delicious really spicy though. The rice was okay, nothing special, too spicy I could not finish.

Price reasonable. Food portion is generous.

Atmosphere the restaurant was full when we come for dinner. Had to queue for about 510 mins. The restaurant is an openspace type, no aircon so it can get very hot during the day. It was really noisy since the restaurant was full, plus noise from the vehicles going by from the main road.

They had a togo mango sticky rice booth in front of the restaurant that look promising. We didn't try though.

주소: 10 Pramuan Rd, Khwaeng Silom, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand
리뷰:
Great food great service as usual.

This is real royal cuisine open for public. Taste is authentic full and complex flavours.

If you never taste real royal Thai cuisine, please come to this restaurant first.

Staff's maner are very polite as used to work with royal before. Came here as the dishes were meant for royals. Beautiful dining place and great service provided. Love the deep fried corn and fried fish with crispy garlic. The Chinese kale leaves were too thick for meang kam, better with bai cha pluwild pepper leaves. The red curry with roasted duck is more to the sweet side. The jello with rambutan was good. Excellent traditional Thai food. I had Khao Cher which only serves during summer months but apparently you can call ahead and ask them to make for you all year round.

The downside is the place is an owner's house so it can get crowded easily and the price is quite high. Almost can transport you back in time with the setting of a 70s fine dining restaurant.  Food is a bit too sweet for my taste and presentation is lacking compared to its price. For our last night in Thailand we hit the jackpot. This was hands down our best meal on this trip.

The restaurant is charming and quaint with a history. It was named in honour of Her Serene Highness Princess SulabhValleng Visuddhi who was once the head cook in the Sumhothai Palace for her sister.

We tried three dishes and all three were outstanding.

Tofu with basil and chili  packed with flavor.

Roasted duck red curry  they used pineapple instead of lychee. It had a nice hint of sweetness to it. The duck was cooked perfectly.

Massaman curry with chicken  well balanced and flavorful.

주소: 444 Phaya Thai Rd, Khwaeng Wang Mai, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand
리뷰: Have been eating here for 20 years, still one of the best Korean BBG in Thailand. Raw beef salad is amazing! Staff have very mindful service and reasonable price This was a great experience for us. This was the first time in years my fianc was able to eat prongs. He is allergic in the states but in Thailand he is not. The wait staff is amazing. They were always changing the grates and making sure we had what we needed. We definitely recommend this place. Best Korean BBQ in Bangkok! Good meat and lovely service. also not too expensive and the drinks were included. It was the very first time we had dinner here and I must say it was a delightful experience for both hubby and I. Quality of food was good and service was on point. Will be back again. Amazing yummy food, nice place to relax and the service was very attentive. Will recommend to others to come. I will come again!

주소: 30 Soi Samsen 4, Khwaeng Ban Phan Thom, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
We stopped here for a quick lunch in the sweltering heat before heading to our next location in Bangkok. The portions were generous, but the flavor was just okayIve had better. The place wasnt too crowded when we arrived, with only two other customers.

However, I was a bit disappointed that the owner rushed us out, saying she was expecting more customers. We had ordered a lot and hadnt been seated for long, so it felt unfortunate. That said, it was still worth trying, especially since they offer good vegan options. Also the price is relatively cheap. We came first to have the green curry for dinner, which was spectacular. As a Brazilian I had to try the mango smoothie, it was so good that I had to return to have lunch.
It was equally great, we had pork omelet, fried chicken with cashew nuts with rice and fried egg.
Were going to be back to try other dishes at Jeng Noodle, for sure its going to be always a tasty experience. A restaurant that uses five ants for seasoning.
A restaurant that urges sales and obsesses under the guise of laughter.
It's been less than 10 seconds since I sat down, so I'm not ordering quickly.
It's a good restaurant that allows you to clean up your plates and pay quickly before the meal is over.
It is a restaurant that turns off the fan and saves electricity as soon as the spoon is put down.
Due to the nature of the president who prefers white people, it is a restaurant that offers all kinds of items to other white customers, from menus in front of the table to tissues.
A restaurant that allows Europeans sitting on paddy fields on other tables with many seats to sit down to evict other customers.
It's a good restaurant with lots of bugs and fly mosquitoes.
It was the same when I visited for the first time, and when I ate with my friend, the owner let me use an umbrella and delayed it for more than 10 minutes without the customer's permission even when the customer had to move.
There was no apology at all, but rather, the old grandfather's owner got angry because he got rained on.
The owner's wife acts like she takes it for granted.
a restaurant that avoids Asians and prefers white people.
If it's okay to receive this service, it's a restaurant I recommend.
It would be good for visitors to refer to it as a must. This is a great little place for some quick, easy, tasty and cheap food. The staff are very friendly and food is cooked and served really quickly. Beers are nice and chilled and they have a good list of other drink options. Some of the reviews here are judging the place with the wrong criteria  you want top gourmet Thai food? Go and pay top prices somewhere else!! Duh! All of the dishes we had were very tasty all vegetarian and the Papaya Salad had a nice spicy kick too! They actually have a completely separate menu for their vegetarian choices  how cool is that?? This was our second time here and food was not disappointing, on the contrary. It was amazing specially the soup.

주소: 25 Soi Chana Songkhram, Khwaeng Chana Songkhram, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
This Korean restaurant has been in the Khao San area for a while. It's a small business run by a family with just a few employees. Don't miss their signature grilled pork dish, served with fresh vegetables, side dishes, and Gochujang sauce. While other menu items are good, they often blend in Thai flavors to cater to local tastes. If it's busy, the food might take a bit longer. The staff, mostly aunties, do their best to take care of every guest. This Korean restaurant located along the extended Khao San Road, known as DongDaeMoon, is truly authentic. The owner, originally from Korea, imports a diverse range of genuine Korean flavors. The variety of dishes captivates tourists who can't resist walking in.

While the threetier pork buffet might be overwhelming, opting for the pregrilled option is recommended.

After indulging in the extensive menu, the fried chicken brought to the table is a musttry  succulent, crispy, salty, and sweet.

A visit to this place, tucked away near Rambuttri Alley, promises a delightful Korean culinary experience with reasonable prices. Highly recommended for those seeking delicious Korean cuisine while exploring the Khao San area. food is soooo yum and they gave us a few things to try for free! so sweet and nice family atmosphere. fried chicken is incredible got two orders For this one is good for buffet 290bathpax exclude drinking. I had tried only buffet here never tried a la carte before. I was here 2 times with my best friend . The sides which come along in buffet is not that bad 3 sides and you can feel it unlimited. Buffet itself has only fat belly pork which you cannot put any sauce on it while you are grilled it. I am not sure if that point because the staffs are lazy to clean or that is a rule as my first time I met with owner , he saw that we put some sauce on fat belly pork on the pan . He said how do you know to do that ? I said my friend was made me once in Korea after that the staff came to blame us that you cannot do that. It still on my mind until now . For a la carte I think you should try another Korean restaurant which not far from this place. the first time i visited this place, i got to meet the owners. they were very nice and welcoming. the food servers are also very accommodating. the food is great! i especially love the side dishes, the fried chicken, and japchae.

주소: 46 Thanon Khao San, Khwaeng Talat Yot, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰: Had late lunch here today with the fam bam. We were starving to death that we could only appreciate the kind service of the male staff who tried so hard to talk to us in English. We had stir fried dishes and pad Thai, the taste was okay but you need the side condiments to better the flavor. The fruit smoothies were not that bad either. The server receiving the order was very kind. It was good because it was cheap and tasted good. Stirfried Morning Glory and Pad Thai were especially delicious. But I was disappointed that the shrimp in the fried rice smelled a bit fishy smell. You have to eat Tangmo Pan no matter what. We came in for the mango sticky rice as it was late and at least we had a place to sit, the prices were great the mango sticky rice at 50 tbh and the large beer at 100 tbh but the portion of rice it was extremely small and half mango only. We came the day after for some smoothies and if youre coming for a smoothie here be careful as they are using syrup instead and not fresh fruits!! One of the smoothies had two syrups and yogurt and you can clearly see on the photo the final result and when we asked him how much it was he wanted to charges more than what it was and it was not even done with fresh fruit. Go better in the front stalls they have proper fruits for the smoothies and mango sticky rice at the same price with better portions. During the night it was quite unpleasant it was this young Indian guy all the times with the laughing balloons which it was pretty annoying. Amazing food on khaosan road , the lady that works here is very friendly and even helped to get a group of men away from us , if you are staying near khaosan road I definitely recommend here. It is open late aswell which is amazing. Amazing authentic Thai food that accommodated to our dietary requirements of being vegetarian aswell. Couldnt recommend more xxxx Cheapest meal I found on Khao San Road, and I got what I paid for. The noodles were fairly bland and didn't come with lime or sprouts to help. The egg white wasn't fully cooked, but there was nothing offensive about the the flavor and chili and peanuts were at the table.

주소: 86 Chakrabongse Rd, Khwaeng Talat Yot, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
Been to this place since 2007
Lamb ShawarmaHummusmutabal are perfectly done well. Food s tasty. You can add on saladchips dip as you wish.

Order Mintlime drink with the meal. It s a good combination with the food. The price is reasonable compared to the portion and quality. Dont forget to try chocolate lava as dessert.

Very homy place and service is great too.

Ps. You can order to take away pita and walked around the old town too. Tried the chicken schnitzel, and falafel pita. Both dishes were fresh and delicious. The hummus , salad and fries were tasty and food compliments to the meals. Pita bread was soft and delicious. Food was great, had thai pad with shrimps and soup. Gf got mussels. Good prices! I visited there with my Israeli friend.
She has been there many times and I think it means the food is really good.
I actually liked their foods, too. It was before more then 30 years when I first  visited this restaurant with Israeli food.. I remember at that time after finishing that legendary plate humus,falafel, chips, salad  pita bread often I remain hungry because portions was so small..
But this year after 5 years I return to Bangkok and of course comeback again to Shoshanna already 3,4 times..But this time
portions was so big that maybe 2 times I couldn't finish all plate because they were too big...!!
Food was very good  and this time they also served with bottle of olives oil...
I told Shoshana, owner of this place about this facts and congrats her...

주소: Trok Silp, Chanasongkram, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
High quality food! Amazing pizza and pasta! Very cozy place at Khaosan!

I love this place so much, that decided to celebrate my birthday here. The management was very kind and proposed me the whole floor! My friends very amazing by the quality and general vibes of the place, so all in all it was a blast! Olive Kitchen is a great, reliable and clean place to eat! We had a chickenmango bowl, shrimppineapple rice and burrata  all three were surprisingly tasty and healthy.
The staff was super accommodating and the vibe was calm and lovely.
Must visit! 55! Great ThaiItalian restaurant! I tried the mangosalsa and it was awesome, The price's fair compared to the quality of food and their staff is nice and welcoming. Great place to stop by and chill out! Highly recommended. Guys, you want to eat a good pizza Neapolitan style? Go to that place! Very attentive service and best pizza we had in Bangkok.  Excellent choice of local and regional IPAs. In a quiet corner away from the din of Khaosan, which is absolutely the reason I landed up here.

Great service, good local food and an amazing dessert with an amazing IPAs, what else can one ask for !

주소: 222, 1 Prachathipatai Rd, Khwaeng Ban Phan Thom, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
Amazing food, amazing people!

It was by chance that we visited there, so much surprise, in a hidden place.

Authentic Thai food, many choices, very welcoming service.

All the dishes in the pictures are fully recommended.

Its an address to be saved. Small but cute restaurant nestled away from the main road. I order the pad Thai, spicy papaya salad, and passion fruit smoothie and they all tasted great! My server was friendly and chatty which was nice whilst solo. Would highly recommend refueling here after a class at Thanomsak Boxing Club around the corner! Off the beaten path, a really good surprise. Simple but delicious food. All the classics of Thai cuisine in a relax atmosphere. I came here with my family and everyone was so disappointed  Even the manager was very kind, he forgot our order two times and theres only one person who was cooking for everyone and she kept talking with other employees and neighbors while some customers were waiting for a long time. Tom yum noodle was good but others were just okay. Oh smoothie is very good! The place I aimed for was closed so we came here as a second option and I havent checked the menu previously as I usually do, being vegan I like to know what to expect. The menu was in pictures, hard to understand exactly what is what, but the waiter is glad to explain and give recommendations. I ordered a vegetable fried rice without the egg, he asked if i wanted tofu with it  always nice.
Food was good, nothing crazy, but not too fatty, good size portion and I really enjoyed the atmosphere!

이름: Jasmine Siam Kitchen จัสมิน สยาม คิทเช่น
주소: 497, 14-15 Phetchaburi Rd, Khwaeng Thung Phaya Thai, Khet Ratchathewi, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10400, Thailand
리뷰:
This is exactly the kind of dining experience Im looking for  a quaint little restaurant offering authentic local fare. Service was top notch, the friendly atmosphere is very inviting. I had the shrimp tom yum soup and it was the kind of meal that warmed me to the bone. And you also get a complementary serving of mangoes as an appetizer. I bought a tiny pink clay elephant to remember my trip, and as a memento to the wonderful dinner I had here. Definitely a core memory for me in Bangkok! Was searching for Authentic Thai food. I m bit hygiene freak. This place is super clean, food looks super fresh and taste super yum. Most important thing is they don't use MSG. The food portions are very good. Complimentary sweet mango was enough for me as dessert. Will definitely come back here. Excellent food.
The menu is extensive with all your favourite Thai dishes.
They have a separate vegetarian and vegan section.
The food was fantastic, and the portions were HUGE!
Definitely worth checking out.
The staff were nice and the place has a nice atmosphere, with chilled music. My wife and I have now been to  6 times and we have always eaten incredibly good food.
The food in this restaurant is of a different quality.
We are skeptical about restaurants in Thailand and only eat street food. But this restaurant really impressed us and blew us away with the taste.
The prices are of course expensive by Thai standards. But the food is worth every penny and we can recommend the restaurant without hesitation!
The ambience in the restaurant is also very appealing. Me and my partner had a wonderful dining experience here! The food was delicious and exceeded my expectations. The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive, making our visit even more enjoyable. The ambiance was perfect for a relaxing meal. I was very happy with everything and will definitely be coming back. Highly recommended!

주소: 27 Pramuan Rd, Khwaeng Silom, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand
리뷰:
Founded back in 1975, this is the original outlet of this popular thai restaurant. Menu is extensive and made to be like home cooked style. Great casual bistro.  Omelette wasn't as crispy as I hoped but the salad was good value.  The cherry pie was lovely and felt like "mama made it" with a thick biscuit base.  Quite a few dishes are no longer available. Lovely restaurant in the garden indoor and outdoor available Ive been to this restaurant at other branches but would say this one has a big lovely cozy space.  There are many choices of Thai food. Some food was nice, some were just okay, but there are plenty of cakes and desserts which were pretty good.   Service is lovely. Car parking is available next to the restaurant, but if you park more than 1.5 hours, you have to pay 50thb fee  Our family have been regulars here for more than 40 years. The food continues to taste good. Lots of varieties and cakes are the best! Well worth the visit. Very easy to get to and plenty of parking.

Back again. Still yummy  This is a really good restaurant.
There are more locals than tourists, which means it's really delicious.  I ordered several dishes and they were all good.

이름: MYTH | Bangkok Street Food | Superb Mango Sticky Rice
주소: 84 Chakrabongse Rd, Khwaeng Talat Yot, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
The best food ever!! I have been multiple times to this wonderful restaurant and can honestly say it is the best food around for miles. Ive never had a bad meal. The staff are all wonderful and so friendly! Highly recommend to anyone looking for top quality, authentic food in Thailand. The food is amazing, among the things I ate here I must say that the Tom yum was one of the best I had here in Thailand. Staff is friendly and nice. They could improve the bathroom tho. A good restaurant  a combination between Thai and Indian kitchen. The food was tasty and well seasoned. The papaya salad was little bit to spicy to our taste. The stir fry vegetables with cashews were amazing. The panang curry with shrimps was also great. The chicken curry was also nice. Overall a great experience. This little street food location is absolutely what you were looking for.

After landing in Bangkok and leaving the hotel for the first time we found this little kiosk that serves typical Thai food.

The shrimp pad Thai is breathtaking and the sweet and sour chicken keeps the pace well.

Location is immersed in a very local set and service is nice. A decent restaurant if youre looking to try some very unique and interesting flavors as well as some of the most popular dishes from Thailand and India for very decent prices.

Very tasty food available for dine in or takeout. Seafood was tasty but a little overcooked. The pad thai was a little mushy but the taste was good. Cold Indian tee was delicious.

Friendly, fast and efficient service. Available also in Thai and English.

Payments accepted with cash or card.

Reservations not needed even on weekdays during busy season.

Handicap friendly and wheelchair accessible.

Parking is safe and easy nearby.

Printed menu.

Vegetarian options available.

Restrooms nearby on site.

Indoor and outdoor seating.

주소: No 170, Soi Samsen 4, Khwaeng Ban Phan Thom, Subdistrict, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
The food here comes super fast and is great value for the portion size you get. If your not a fan of spice you can also ask for less spicy which is great if your a fan of papaya salad but cant handle too much spice. Would deffo recommend the pad Thai and papaya salad. I decided to eat here as this place was near my hotel and it seemed to be always full of people. I value a good meal and it didnt disappoint. My Pad Thai was delicious, the portion was big and the price was very fair! Many traditional Thai food options. I would come again, great local eatery option if you are in the area Remember when food used to be uncomplicated and simply delicious and fresh without the pressure of having to be social media worthy?
Well, here you have it. I have been so tired of eating out and I came across this place late at night after watching Muay Thai fights. I was a bit skeptical due to being in a calm dark alley, but Im glad I trusted the reviews. I had young coconut milk smoothie, chicken satay and papaya salad. Everything was delicious. The smoothie took me by surprise, I didnt expect to like it this much.
Give it a try they also have English translation on their menus a huge plus for me. Only negative is no AC. But they have plenty of fans on. The food came out quicker than expected, I would say within 5 mins for the spring rolls we had and 10 for the pad Thai! Absolutely lovely staff and the mango shake was delicious. For our first Thai dinner in Bangkok it did not disappoint! Was close to my hotel and tried it out. It was a great experience. The fried chicken was absolutely delicious, red curry was very fragrant and not too spicy as well. Recommended to all.

주소: 262 Surawong Rd, Khwaeng Si Phraya, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand
리뷰:
Sunday brunch is good. Recommended.

The spread is good with varieties of choices. The self served meat  seafood corner is impressive. Surprisingly the quality of meat seafood is unexpected. They have Hokkaido beef, Aussie beef and river prawns etc. very into detailed thats using different containers to classify the cooking methods. Oysters are also fresh. Drinks and desserts are also nice.

Tables are set with distance which provide a cozy experience. Great experience, booked on eatigo with a discount so makes it much more value for money!
Great atmosphere, very nice decor!
Staff super friendly and happy to serve both chefs and wait staff.
The cook to order seafood and meat is unreal!
Fresh and cooked perfectly.
I wish there was abit of a larger range of cooked food. Korean oysters was abit of a letdown. Fresh but not so tasty.
Nonetheless still great experience! Very good value for money booked through Eatigo, staff were very friendly and helpful, lots of seafood and beef choices, plenty of Thai food options as well.
Really liked the juice bar!
Certainly will come back again in the near future. I booked through Eatigo that gave me a deal! The staff was thoroughly helpful from booking to bill payment. They were very prompt to clear the table too so we can bring in more dishes. Kudos!

Ambience was wonderful  the seafood wall was the most notable, followed by the dessert spread and the juice corner.

Spent under 3,000 Thai Baht for 2 pax on a nice Sunday afternoon. This is the place for wonderful seafood buffet! One of the best buffet by Marriott, i came few time and quite like it, carful with the parking lot it is abit tight, the restaurant on the 3rd floor cost per head 2400 for buffet lunch. This is international good by the way

주소: 6 Maha Rat Road, Khwaeng Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
Our guide Tao brought us here for lunch. The food was excellent! The shrimp pad Thai was perfect texture and delicious. Chicken curry was sweet, rich and creamy  with coconut flavor.   The pineapple pork fried rice was a large plate with generous portion of  meats, nuts and shrimp. Excellent choice! Perfect finish with mango sticky rice. A good restaurant if youre looking to try some very unique and interesting flavors as well as some of the most popular dishes from Thailand for very decent prices.

Very tasty food available for dine in or takeout. Cert refreshing drinks. Highly recommend the watermelon. Green curry is very tasty too and theyre nice about adjusting your spiciness level.

Friendly, fast and efficient service. Available also in Thai and English.

Payments accepted with cash or some payment app, no cards.

Reservations might be needed on weekends, during busy season. Only 5 tables inside.

Handicap friendly and wheelchair accessible.

Parking is safe and easy nearby.

Printed menu.

Restrooms nearby on site.

Indoor seating only, with AC.

Great WiFi, free with password at table. Its a really pleasant and cozy place to be in. There are literally 6 tables in this restaurant. It is ran by a family. The food was really nice and fresh, however Tom yam which Ive had, was a bit too sour compared to the ones I had around Thailand. But overall  great place with a great vibe and really good food. I think the payment here is also cash only so if theres any downside its that. But Thailands motto is cash is king so no surprise there. Definitely worth a visit and try. The prices are also very ok! Delicious! Pad Thai was great but it was kinda spicy for me.  Will definitely go back here. Nice food, the waiter was really nice with us !  The spiciness of the food was perfect for us ! Soups, appetisers and even the bacon carbonara was really delicious !

I would definitely recommend this place for you !
