주소: 76 1-2, Khwaeng Talat Yot, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
My favourite padthai in all of Thailand. Fresh and great portion of chicken. Very friendly and super clean. Amazing value for only 2.20 AUD 14 years ago i ordered my first Pad Thai with Mama Cherry. Still to this day she is my 1st stop in Bangkok. I will travel whole Thailand but will only eat the Pad Thai made by her.  Her Pad Thai is made with so much love. The ingredients are super fresh. The portions are perfect. You can add extra peanuts, dried shrimps ... Super nice chicken and egg Pad Thai at 50B. Delicious and super tasty. You gotta try it! It is located at Khao San Road market. Our favorite spot for Pad Thai in all of Bangkok City!!
Super affordable and delicious 
Cherry and her Mother who also work the stall have a good understanding of vegan pahthai ie no eggs, no fish sauce etc etc.

We went back several times!

A small food stall situated amongst shops, market stalls, restaurants and bars. Close to the infamous Khossan road. Take your own recyclable takeaway container and cutlery.

We're sure you'll love it!  Honestly the best pad Thai Ive had in Thailand, super cheap and tasty! Made fresh infront of you, theres a little station to add peanuts lime spice which is great, sad to have found this on my last day!
영업시간: no operation time

이름: Onkijung Thailand l อนคีจอง l ข้าวเกาหลีหน้าล้นต้นตำรับ
주소: ชั้น 6 ห้อง B631, ข้างร้านหนังสือ Central World, Khwaeng Pathum Wan, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand
리뷰:
All the dishes serve here are very tasty. My favorite is the couple set, the tempura rice bowl and kimchi soup. Highly recommend if you want to try tasty Korean dish. Onkijung offers a cozy atmosphere, making it a great spot for a casual dining experience. The food and drink were normal, nothing particularly outstanding, but the Korean BBQ jeongchan for two people stood out as a highlight. If you're in the mood for a laidback evening of Korean BBQ, Onkijung is worth a visit for its inviting ambiance and flavorful signature dish. Very good Korean restaurant! Delicious food! Quite spicy for all the dishes. Very polite staffs. The ownermanger comes out to serve the food himself. The limited dishes for 2 people here look amazing!  They are super huge, but we did not order. They serve a variety of korean food. mostly rice set and don.
however, the highlight would be hansang bbq pork set if i remembered its name correctly, which only served for the limit number of set per day.
the set was very good. bbq  pork was delicious. the set even came with water and bingo. it was a good refresh after the meal.

the place was clean, organized and cozy.

the staff was polite, friendly and very helpful

the price was very high around 500baht per set, but it came in big proportion. A modern Korean establishment hidden in the top floors of Central world. They have over 10 branches in Korea and the first one in Thailand.

The atmosphere was comforting and casual. A great choice for a fast meal for 24 or even solo.

The taste was sharp and refined. The variety the sauces, and the components were fun and enjoyable. The kimchi was the best,  not only the taste which incorporate saltiness but also the sesame oil which makes it so appealing. I cant stop eating kimchi here!

주소: 11/2 Soi Charoen Krung 42/1, Khwaeng Bang Rak, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand
리뷰:
Great restaurant 2 steps away from Lebua or mandarin oriental hotel
Staff is friendly and speaks English
All dishes were tasty and not to spicy as we asked
Recommend Very broad choice of food grilled, steamed, fried and wok. All sorts of currys, fried rice, vegetables, grilled meat and fish. Boutique style, big but still cosy. Very friendly staff. And awesome cocktails and mocktails. Definately will come again. Bit more expensive but worth it. I'm an Italian chef working in phrom pom, this place it's a tourist trap!!! The atmosphere wasn't so bad, the location great! Everything from food and drinks are overpriced storebought junk food, the spritz were watered down, only two draft beer, with only the boring one available, this is clearly a scam for foreigners. Mazzaro is a nice fusion restaurant with a mix of Thai and Italian. Good range of pasta and pizza and Thai food. The Ambience is nice and staff are friendly. The service is quick and the food is good in both quantity and quality. Parking availability and spacious restaurant in busy are of Chan road Three years ago we ate every dinner here because it was close to our hotel ShangriLa and we really enjoyed it here. The food, staff, everything was great.

Today we came back again and had to say the quality was still great!
Super super delicious foods, a lot of choice as well as Thai and Italian.
Nice service.
This is one of our favorite restaurants in Bangkok! Highly recommended!

주소: บ้านเลขที่9, Soi Sukhumvit 8, Khwaeng Khlong Toei, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
I had been dining here before, and while it was really nice in the past, this time it was pretty disappointing. The food was nowhere near as good as last time. The Red Curry that I ordered was pretty pale and not creamy. It was really nothing special at all. Came here for supper after landing in bangkok as it was near our stay. As it was nearing their closing time so there were limited dish left. However, it was good enough! The crab omelette with curry powder is a must! ended up ordering 2 more portion of the same omelette because its so good. Their orange juice is 30 baht and its quite good as well

located in the alley of the noisy street, this place is definitely a hidden gem Super tasty Thai food at reasonably prices!! We ordered Fried Snapper with Chili Sauce and were blown away by the crispy texture and the sour and spicy taste! Such a nice and appetising dish for hot weather!

The coconut chicken soup is the best one Ive ever tasted. Its made of fresh coconut juice, instead of coconut milk  its light and has natural sweetness!

This place is a hidden gem in Sukhumvit area where you can taste authentic home cooking Thai food at good value! Located in a small alley, this restaurant seems to be popular among the locals and tourists.

Ordered a fried fish, pai thai, vegetable, crab omelette, plain rice and the total price was 600 bhat which was reasonable pricing for two person. Do check the pricing of the fish as it is not listed in the menu which I assume is seasonal price.

Additional info There's a resident cat but it's not really that friendly.  I was looking on Google Maps and found this wonderful restaurant. I was staying down the Soi at Hopeland Hotel and decided to give it a try. I met my daughter and her coworker for lunch. We had shrimp pad thai, chicken pad thai, green curry chicken spaghetti, and papaya salad. The food was delicious and I highly recommend this restaurant.

이름: Pad Thai Fai Ta Lu @Dinso Rd
주소: 115/5 Dinso Rd, Khwaeng Wat Bowon Niwet, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
Pad Thai here is absolutely delicious. Although the portion of the noodles are quite small, but the meat whether you order chicken or grill pork collar, its absolutely stunning. Very unique flavour and tender to the mouth too.

Services are quite good as everyone here is attentive. Ordered Pad Thai w White Shrimp  Pad Thai w Signature Iberico Pork. The pad Thai is absolutely delicious and the shrimps are huge. The pork is great, and the skin is really crispy. However, youll get sick of the crispy skin easily. Portions are small and leave you wanting more of the Pad Thai noodles! The interior is also pretty cool and slightly retro. If you have to pick 1 dish, go for Pad Thai w White Shrimp! I had Iberian pork jowl.
1st impressions this is soo tiiiny!! And expensive!
1st bite just take my money, this is of the best pork I've ever had, this dish just switched my brain off. It was so good I ordered a white shrimp pad thai next  this was real good as well! The shrimp was like caramelized and very good, but still... The pork was unbeatable.. like how is this pork... Just, just no words. Amazing gastronomic experience. I am still shocked at the quality of what I've just had... Absolutely delicious. Unique flavour profile for pad Thai. Not surprised they keep getting Michelin recognition! On a Saturday night at 830, there was plenty of seating. Pad Thai portions are on the smaller size but still sufficient for a meal. Prepared super quickly. A bit spicy. 130 baht, but this was one of the cheapest things on the menu. A Pad Thai restaurant around Democracy Monument area. The quality of foods was good. Using fresh quality of pork jowl, crispy pork, and shrimp. Pad Thai was tasty. Attentive service.

주소: 9 1 ถนน ศรีเวียง Khwaeng Silom, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand
리뷰:
Came here because of the Michelin star status. Some of the dishes were excellent, with the star of the show being the papaya salad with blue crab. The shredded pork noodles felt a little bland in comparison but overall this place has a huge array of authentic Thai dishes to choose from at a great price. The noodles with mackerel were also another table favourite. The only downside is food is brought out when ready and placed on the table without being told what it is, so it can get a little confusing trying to workout whose dish is whose. Ill definitely be back to try more from this menu. Unusual dishes but they tasted so good. Every dish we had was excellent. Very busy but informal. Can see why it is a Michelin guide regular. Price was fair and we tried a lot of food from the menu as it was one of the more interesting ones we came across in Bangkok. One of the best Somtam I tried in Bangkok.
 young coconut with shrimp somtam tastes very subtle and spicy. Yet, all the gentle sweetness, sourness, saltiness, unique smell of fish saucenot the funky type are all there!
 their signature somtam also uses the fermented fish brown color sauce but it literally helps bring your dead appetite back to life!!! Must try
 the gengsom? was also very spicy and good.

Overall, the food is amazingly good. If you are not good with spicy, please ask for level 1 spicy!  Michelinawarded shop, though, I was able to have a seat without booking, maybe it was a bit late hours and also shop has many tables.
Mood is very good. especially the sounds of crush nuts and hot peppers made good BGM.

There are so many menus with reasonable price.
Papaya salad is must.
Also I loved coconuts icecream which tastes very thick.
I will definitely come back! One of my favourite restaurants in BKK.
This was my second time visiting, my first being about eight years ago.
Since then they have renovated the restaurant and became apart of the Michelin Guide congratulations team!.
I did not know this before we arrived, so it was very busy.
I asked the host if I could drink a beer outside while we waited, which he said yes and bought it out to me 
We only had to wait for about thirty minutes before a table was available.

The food was delicious!
Our whole fried fish was cooked to perfection and the som tum was great with an awesome amount of chilli. We also loved the crispy porkrice entree and the corn salad this had fish roe in it which was a nice surprise!.

The service was great, every staff member was working hard and they were all very nice.

The restaurant has great air conditioning, it was extremely clean and good bathrooms.

Everytime I am back in Bangkok, I will always visit this restaurant.

Aroi mak mak!
Thank you again to the staff for looking after us  you are all great

주소: 28/8 Ram Buttri, Khwaeng Chana Songkhram, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
Some of the best food I have ever had! The service is also great, and there is a cute cat. I would give them more stars if I could.

An update we came back after a few weeks in Thailand and this was one of our favorite restaurants. Amazing food and prices. This is a Korean restaurant that is a gem in the Khaosan area.  It is said that it has been in business since 1995.  If you want to eat real authentic Korean food, definitely go to this place.  It is Korean restaurant common manners that when you order a main dish, many kinds of side dishes and soup are provided free of charge.  I enjoyed grilled mackerel in a cool, clean atmosphere in this restaurant. Bangkok has incredibly delicious Korean cuisine, very tasty and cheap!! A very cozy place with a good atmosphere Restaurant
The owner is super nice guy. You get the appetizer in the form of a tiny bowls of veggies and kimchi, which is very good and filling.
Also a bottle of a barsley tea with ice filled glasses.
The food is very good, healthy and for the quality, very cheap.

Overall, everything was very nice. Very clean and cozy restaurant. The apetizer are amazing and we appreciated the tea as well! The food is very good but the kimchi pancake could be more fried.
The owner is really kind and friendly, would definitely recommend!!! Price is also very cheap, would definitely come back!

주소: Thanon Phloen Chit, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand
리뷰:
Food  as usual, Thai food always delicious. Please ask for less spicy if you cant take spicy food.

Service  they provide good service. Food served fast after I ordered.

Atmosphere  table are big, spacious. The Tom yum soup was great and it tasted really good, the fish dish we ordered didnt taste good at all, could be that it was my first time here and didnt know exactly what to order. The service was slow, took some effort to get waiters attention although the place wasnt as busy as how you would normally see it. Might try again Authentic Thai fare in a nice restaurant located at a high end mall  Central Embassy. Good variety in the  menu to select from. Our all time favourite is the beef green curry platter, absolutely moist slices of beef in a delicious green curry, served with vermicelli, cucumber and bean sprouts. Chicken in white coconut broth go so well with rice. Overall an enjoyable meal at slightly higher prices, but worth it. thaifood bangkokrestaurant Just walk into this place and it was a pleasant surprised. Food quality was really good,  drinks were really nice.  Too much food,  no room for dessert.  Will come back to try. Decent Thai food inside central embassy mall. Not as busy as other locations. Vegetarian friendly.

Deep fried taro is my fav.

주소: 1031 เซ็นทรัล เอ็มบาสซี่ ชั้น 5, Thanon Phloen Chit, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand
리뷰:
Like everyone else said, the yellow curry with crab meat is the thing to get here. I've had yellow crab curry at many other restaurants but this one is the best. The portion size is also very big a small is enough for 24 people. The other dishes are also good but not as special as the crab curry. I like to come here for the curry and skip the rest of the menu. We enjoyed our dinner here. It was extremely busy so recommend making a reservation. The curry crab was delicious, as was the kangkong. The prawn beehoon and river prawns were quite fresh but not our favourite, perhaps due to the different flavour profile. Overall we thought pricing was fair, way cheaper than Singapore for the quality. One of the best restaurants in Bangkok Ive tried!
For the hot plate oyster omelette, its just so good! The omelette was tender with good smell from onion and white pepper. The oyster was juicy and fresh, the best oyster omelette Ive tried in last 3 years!
The curry crab comes with a lot of sauce, you better order rice to mix with the sauce. Its not spicy at all so you can feel the freshness from the crab! The taste is not heavy, its right amount of softness, definitely want to try again!
Pork rib is just okay, not bad and nothing to shout about. Waitress or floor manager helped me pick a meal big enough for 1. Portions very big. Very flavourful and worth the price. The grab curry plus the green chili sauce makes a perfect combo. Would definitely go again. Fish, curry, rice and beer for 33. Crab meat curry and oyster omlette!!!! No one will be disappointed with these. Service is a bit like they are tired of all these people coming for their food. Like ok but not super happy to have you. Even when the dining hall is half empty. But crab meat curry is worth this grumpy service experience.

주소: 33 Soi Ram Buttri, Khwaeng Talat Yot, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
This is our goto cafe in the afternoon for a couple of cold beers and a light meal.
The staff is very friendly and attentive, unlike quite a few of the competitors who beg you to come in and then never give you a smile or check on you.  Maya, who seems to be in charge there is sweet and personable with many of the customers.
Prices are on the lower competitive side with the rest. We had drinks here one evening and the atmosphere was fantastic. There was a singer also playing a guitar and he really created a fantastic atmosphere. The cocktails are nice and the happy hour drinks make the prices better. My favourite restaurant and bar in Rambuttri Village.  Friendly and kind service staff and very good food and drinks at reasonable prices.  They have the best American breakfast set you can get in this area. Moreover, it's a very nice spot in the evening to have a snack or drink and watch tourists passing by. Loved the live entertainment.
There's also a large screen tv for people wanting to catch up on sports  Manchester City vs  Arsenal.
Fried crispy fish was ok as was the morning glory. We also had dragon fruit juice and mango juice.
There is indoor and outdoor dining.
The place has a laid back welcoming ambience.
It's a fun place to people watch  next to street stalls and passing traffic  including guy driving a very shiny tuk tuk with a large dog in it.
This is a mostly pedestrian thoroughfare but you get the occasional vehicle. Very kind service and a PlayStation with FIFA to enjoy a great time playing. You can choose between a lot of menus with Appetizer, Main Course and Beer for 300 Baht 

Food was good and plenty

주소: 150 Soi Naradhiwas Rajanagarindra 3, Khwaeng Silom, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand
리뷰:
I recently dined at Yo Giyo Restaurant and it was an exceptional experience. From the moment I walked in, I was welcomed with warm smiles and a cozy atmosphere.

The food was spectacular, with each dish offering a delightful blend of flavors. The ingredients were fresh, and the presentation was beautiful. Every bite showcased the chefs skill.

The service was equally impressive. The staff were attentive, knowledgeable, and passionate about making sure every guest had a great time. They offered helpful recommendations and accommodated special requests with professionalism.

In conclusion, Yo Giyo Restaurant excels in both food and service. I highly recommend it for anyone seeking a topnotch dining experience. The first time I ate Korean food in my life was actually in Thailand. All the food is very delicious, especially the pig's feet. The beautiful lady boss is very kind and her English is also very good. I will come back again. The Chicken was very crispy and flavourful and the spicy sauce on the noodles was excellent The workers are very nice too. The seats are comfy and it's an amazing and affordable place to eat with friends and family. I loved everything I tried there Five stars is not enough to express how good my experience was Nice, authentic and affordable traditional Korean cuisine. Food were nicely prepared, with complimentary Korean appetizers on the sides with generous topup and complimentary bottled cold water. Beers were served well chilled and cold.
Service was timely, waiters were very attentive and in particular, the lady boss was very kind, friendly and hospitable.
Strongly recommended, especially for all authentic Korean food lovers. I brought my 10 coworkers to dine in at this korean restaurant after a long day of work. We were greeted by a smile and joy. The owner and staff served us well and the food was superb. 1010 definitely going back

you can get access to a private table and that not too expensive , youll be extremely well taken care of the entire night. I really liked the hospitality from the servers and VIP hosts, as they remembered us throughout the night, making sure we dont get lost as well. Theyre also people we can joke with and have fun with. Disappointed with my experience at Lucy Club Bangkok. Arrived around 11 PM, and the place was almost empty with no crowd or vibe. Ended up having to head over to Thonglor for a better nightlife scene. Not the best spot if youre looking for a lively atmosphere. I genuinely rate this 2 star so people will read this review.

The place is a scam. They told us it was full and it genuinely had 3 people in there. Upon exiting and complaining they then claimed they told us it wasn't full.

In future I would advice Lucy club bankok to accurately reflect the business of their club, and not use false business tactics to entice tourists. It is also illegal to attack people who call you out on this. Worst pub ever! Please dont visit, DJ is good but put is too small. We cant even dance properly. Its not pub its discotechth. 주소: Marché Thonglor, 3rd Floor, Tower B, 148 ถ. ทองหล่อ แขวงคลองตันเหนือ เขตวัฒนา กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
We will remember this place only for its excellent RnB music! That's all the pluses.

I have never seen such impudence from a bartender. We ordered a classic cocktail. They put a block of ice in the glass, the same volume as the glass itself. There was nothing to drink, after two smoothies the drink was gone and minus 500 baht. A regular 0.5 liter bottle of water  100 baht.

It was as if there were no waiters, everyone was standing along the wall. Our table was wet throughout the rest. The contingent  Thai youth students. What acoustics to another level DJ and music depends the day you choose to come no entry fee but prices are expensive for the drinks you need deep pockets The shop is very fun. Enjoy it to the max. My friends are happy and dance to it. I with my 1000th visits here at Echelon. Nice songs and vibe. Good place to hang out with your friends. Not so crowded but fun still. Reasonable price for drinks 100 outta 10!!! Unique concept of daily party flights boarding from one of its kind cocktail bar and night club concept ! Its an amazing cocktail bar in the evening that turns into a happening night club by night and treats you with the best of dining and music experience!
They welcome  you with boarding passes of your name written on it and you celebrate with them whole night woohoo !
I loved their cocktails and the mixologist is just  amazing at his craft !
I must say if you want to live the best night life , echelon is the place to be at with great crowd , fabulous music great photo ops and best part is you take back home memories with your very own boarding pass of partying
영업시간: no operation time

주소: Sugar Club Bangkok, 37 Soi Sukhumvit 11, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
Sugar Club Bangkok is a good spot for hiphop fans! The vibe is electric with awesome DJs, great music, and a fun crowd. Drinks are wellpriced, and the service is quick. Just make sure you have a valid ID like a passport for entry. Perfect place for a great night out! Don't come too early like we did. The action and the vibes kick in only past midnight, with the banging Hiphop  RB tunes.

Not exactly the cheapest, but if you can get access to a private table, you'll be extremely well taken care of the entire night. I really liked the hospitality from the servers and VIP hosts, as they remembered us throughout the night, making sure we don't get lost as well. They're also people we can joke with and have fun with.

Thank you, team, for making sure that our bachelor night party crew enjoyed themselves thoroughly. Went with my wife and was charged a total of 700 baht which includes two drinks..got my drink and stood at one of the tables near the bar which was free.. loved the music and the vibe.. great place to party.. guess they have two levels..was not bothered about buying a drink.. the only small error was that they got my mixer wrong and gave me coke instead of soda.. loved the place and will come back.. Ladies have to pay 300 Baht with 1 drink of your choice. 500 Baht for the men.

It was great. But party dont start till like 1130 and I went on a Saturday Night. I dont know because I came 1130 and the place was not even half full. The music on this Saturday Night is a soso, when it had to be banging!!! But it wasnt. It was just trying to be chill music and super loud.

Never had food here so I cannot comment on that.

They didnt even play Rihanna songs as much, Starships, EDM remix or anything very lively. It was like going up and down music all the time and it bored me. But it was packed anyway.

They need to change the DJ I think, the place is good. The DJ seems to be playing songs he likes, not what the crowd would like.  Because remember, your customers are mostly coming from Western countries, so it should be solid music.  Good club for those who like hip hop music. Prices are ok and the atmosphere is great. Unfortunately some guests are not very reasonable and sometimes aggressive . My experience was very washed out .

리뷰:
Would give a 5 star if the entry was free, although entry came with a free drink and the price was decent, its more expensive than other options so money adds up in small quantities for entry.

This club was great, lots of people, great atmosphere, anything you want to find youll find. There was great music vibes and service. No drama or disturbances, friendly people both local and tourists.

Recommend highly if your in Bangkok especially in khaosan area this place is a crazy packed street full off loud music and everything one could expect for an intense but enjoyable night out.

Also recommended at the end of the street almost opposite the club is a club called Rocco club think thats the name its a beautiful 67 story bar, restaurant and club with stunning views of the chaotic pastry street and Bangkok city then after another small entry fee an almost hidden sound proof club that one would barely notice is so intense from the outside! Went there on a Tuesday night 1020pm, so the crowd wasn't as crazy. It was slightly empty until more people started coming in after an hour.

We spent a few hours in the club, entrance was free, and the DJs they had was decent. It's nice that they played music and songs that we know so we can sing along, whether it's English or Spanish songs. The music genre was EDM which I personally like. Our group of 4 ordered a tequila bottle and juice to go with it that was enough for us with me getting slightly drunk. However although I'd give the music a solid 7.5810, the energy of the DJ is about 510.

The toilet is clean and big enough. The staff did a great job explaining the menu and drinks to us as well! The lighting is decent, the speakers were decent too but it would be great if it had a bit more bass. There's a nice spot near the DJ for you to get onto and dance, or you could just dance at the regular floor if you want! Securitybouncer might be lacking a bit, but maybe that's because it's a weekday.

Would come again with friends  Honestly, I don't know if I'll return again. Khao San Road is such an oxymoron that anything along the same road gives off the same emotions. This is probably a little more filtered in energy, vs anything you find outside along the main road.

We arrived around 3.15am, got a table like we were bosses, and the energy was definitely riding upwards. Ambience, lighting, music, vibes, everything was on point.

Until you actually scan your surroundings, absorb everything, get your drinks served, realise that it's such a diverse crowd, see that there's a change of DJ, and everything starts to crumble at 4am clubclose, lights on.

The Club unfortunately doesn't give off the "it's safe to lose yourself and just party" feeling at any one moment. It's not just about the number of security guards standing around, or whether you have a table...

As much as it was an enjoyable evening, for someone who would rather pay for personal safety and enjoyable vibes, I'm sure there are better spots elsewhere around Bangkok. You should pay 250 Thb as entry which is included one free alcoholic drink.
Also the music is the best in khaosan road I went to the club. They are charging 250 bhat per person and you'll get one beer or mixer. The atmosphere is OK, the DJ keeps repeating the song and most of the crowd leaves the place.

The club owner came to me and asking for my phone. When I showed him, he took my phone and trying to give fake reviews. I caught him and then he started abusing me. This is my genuine review and I wrote what I observed there. The club owner went to those people who are too high. He takes their phone and gave fake google reviews.

Instead of going to this club, I recommend going to "the one at khaosan" and "lucky beer". The vibes are amazing and also you're gonna enjoy the music there.

리뷰:
Its my first visit there few days ago we have total 3pax . Entry was fast and no queue maybe due to weekday lesser crowd . Buy an entry ticket for 300B and u can exchange it for a drink inside . I was expecting a local Thai music section which they dont really have after asking a few staff there . They have 3 section Kpop  least crowd  EDM  mild crowd  HipHop fully crowded . Was in the EDM side throughout the night until close . Price for drinks is acceptable and the interior of the club and lighting is awesome . Service is alright staff are attentive and drinks are served fast  . The music selection and DJ mixing is still acceptable . But I guess I will not be back again as I do not like any of the 3 theme music there . Today it was very crowded, a lot of people, big clubs, both hip hop.  edm and kpop in the bathroom, there's a live band too, and there's food if you're hungry, me and my mom had a lot of fun today, thank you. It a nice club to enjoy. very crowded on the Friday night.
Would love to recommend one of the nice night club in Bangkok when you visit. Yo, this place was sick! It was 300 Thai baht to get in and you got a free drink anything under 200 baht. It's way more fun if you go with a group! They had different rooms with different music themes.

The dance performances were awesome! The dancers were all hot and the routines were really cool.

The only downside was that the Kpop room was kinda boring and the songs were old. The main hall was also a bit of a let down. I was there for 4 hours and the DJ's music choices were just not it. It was a bit disappointing, especially since it's in Bangkok. If you're looking for a place to party the night away in Bangkok, Route 66 on Rama IX Road might just be the perfect destination for you. As a wellestablished night club that's been around for over 15 years, Route 66 has made a name for itself as a hub for huge parties and a popular destination for university kids and young Thai party goers.

The club boasts three to four dance zones, with a large openair space for partygoers to let loose and have fun. With a cover charge of 300, Route 66 offers a great deal for entry, and buying a bottle and asking for a table upon arrival can save you some money.

One of the main draws of Route 66 is the music. The club features live bands playing Thai pop, hip hop, and house, while three rooms offer different genres of music. Room 1 is dedicated to oldschool rap and hip hop, while Room 2 features a rotation of live bands and singers. The main room, Room 3, is devoted to EDM, house, and electronic music. With such a diverse range of music styles, there's something for everyone at Route 66.

The crowd at Route 66 is primarily young Thais and students, giving the club a vibrant and energetic atmosphere. Whether you're looking to dance the night away or just enjoy some great music with friends, Route 66 has something to offer.

In summary, if you're looking for a fun and exciting night out in Bangkok, Route 66 is definitely worth checking out. With its huge parties, diverse music offerings, and lively crowd, this club is sure to offer a memorable experience.

주소: 45 Soi Sukhumvit 45, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
Having been deeply immersed in the music and nightlife scene of my own city, Sing Sing Theater in Bangkok offered a refreshing and captivating experience. The ambiance struck me immediately an eclectic blend of gothic elements and mesmerizing lanterns, casting a moody, yet enchanting atmosphere. The attention to detail in the dcor evoked a sense of mystery, setting the perfect backdrop for an unforgettable night.

While the venues design had some structural quirkssuch as precarious stairways and a dimly lit environment that could easily pose a riskthe bouncers did an excellent job at maintaining a safe and smooth experience to the patrons.

The sound design was superb, filling the space with a pulsating rhythm that complemented the crowd, which was a wellbalanced mix of locals and tourists. The DJ kept the energy high, skillfully blending tracks to keep the crowd moving until the early hours. I was a bit annoyed with the excessive use of ice for drinks, resulting in overly chilled drinks that somewhat muted the flavor. Yet, they were still enjoyable.

Sing Sings true charm lies in its theatrical flair, which sets it apart from other clubs. The live performancesa samurai and a woman gracefully swinging from the ceilingadded a playful, surreal element to the night, enhancing the clubs theme and making it a more immersive experience.

One drawback, however, is the pricing of water. I noticed this is common in many Bangkok venues, but charging a premium for something as basic as water feels out of place, especially when many international clubs provide it free of charge.

In sum, Sing Sing Theater offers a unique, theatrical twist on the usual clubbing experience, with topnotch music, a vibrant crowd, and an ambiance thats both edgy and enthralling. It's a mustvisit for anyone seeking a latenight adventure, running until 4 AMa rare gem in Bangkoks nightlife. This venue offers an electrifying atmosphere with its dark, industrial design and vibrant red lighting that sets the perfect mood for a night out. The DJ booth, elevated and surrounded by unique decor, allows the beats to fill the space, creating an immersive musical experience. The setup is professional and the sound system is topnotch, making it ideal for those who love to dance the night away. Highly recommend for anyone seeking an unforgettable nightlife experience! On Thursday Girls night there were 20 girls and 80 guys, but overall the spot was completely dead and empty. Enjoyed the free drinks of my girlfriend though. So, thanks. Sing Sing Theater in Bangkok offers a unique nightlife experience with its dramatic, oriental Chinese mafiainspired decor.
this club features intricate wrought iron designs, hundreds of red lanterns, and plenty of dragon imagery. The space is divided into multiple levels, with two downstairs bars, a central dance floor that doubles as a stage, and a balcony overlooking the scene. The vibe is both stylish and theatrical, complete with silkcovered walls and a humansized bird cage

The club is known for its immersive themed parties, hosts a variety of performances, including burlesque.
The music selection is eclectic, covering house, jazz, and hiphop, ensuring there's something for everyone

Cocktails are reasonably priced, featuring premium liquors and creative signature drinks.

highly recommend it for its unique ambiance and lively entertainment. Loved everything about this place. Easy entry to getting drinks at the bar, the club is built nicely and has different levels that suit your mood. You can stand by the bar or order drinks at your table. You can always go a level up and groove on the tunes played by the DJ.

I went on a Thursday and a Saturday  liked it more on Thursday tbh. Good mix of locals and expats. Highly recommended.

Drinks are on the pricier side so come prepared!

리뷰:
Unique experience in Bangkok ! They know how to please techno lovers with various Djs from all over the world.
Also the staff and service here are impeccable.
Highly recommended place to go for those who know what real techno is Id like to give big compliments for Dois service. He is a dedicated employee. He took our order with great attention to detail and ensured we had everything we needed. He made sure our drinks were ready for us in no time. I wasn't entirely satisfied with the other staff member, but Dois performance made up for it and made my evening memorable. Ill come back for him. What an impressive guy! The music here was really good, the DJs were very engaging and the crowd was really chill. Drinks were slightly on the pricier side for what they were serving. I've consistently had the best nights here in all of Bangkok. It's a place for music lovers  not a pick up bar, although you can definitely still get lucky. But let me talk music for a moment. The techno here is sublime. The DJ's really know how to get the crowd moving and I've danced from getting through the door to closing time on many occasions. If you love good music, a great bar, and lots of cool people  this place is for you. Incredibly weak club and atmosphere. Djs are absolutely amateurs, overpriced drinks, aggressive staff and an owner who could care less about the security as many flights and assaults are provoked by them. I would avoid this hole like the plaque and see Andy anytime

Their entrance fee is 400 baht  is not worth at all, waste of money. Music seems fine but atmosphere is dead. Khaosan is the king of nightlife in bkk. Period.

리뷰:
Vibrant cool venue, live band fully engaged with audience. We had a blast, there wasn't a dull moment during our two hour sing along.

Drinks were reasonably priced. Would recommend. Amazing live band, great music selection. Energised vibe with crowd interaction. Dancing, singing, everyone had a fantastic time right through to closing. Drinks pricing fair. Definitely will be revisiting this bar Great club that just gets better as the night goes on with live music The best Bar  Club in I ever visited. What make it so awesome is their bands, we sit through both bands sessions Saturday night and went up to their club after the bar closed. This is the best night I had in Bangkok. The atmosphere is awesome, beer is 150 baht per bottle. Great music great people friendly staffs.

Side note, there are genuine girls partying there, not full of agendaoriented freelance. Oh man. This place was great. If you love live music like I do.

Went here on recommendation of the bartender at Whisgars. I never made it past the ground floor bar.

But that was all I needed. Cheap relatively drinks and great music. The bands were all great.

You may get hassled a bit by some women looking to spend the night with you I was but a polite no is enough to get them to move on.

I will be back tomorrow for sure!

주소: 4 Soi Na Phra That, Khwaeng Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
The Thai National Museum is a hidden gem that far exceeded my expectations. While the exterior is already stunning with its traditional architecture, the inside is a true treasure trove. The museum houses a remarkable collection of beautiful, valuable, and historic artifactsfrom ancient sculptures to intricate carvings and textilesthat vividly tell Thailand's rich story.

The exhibits are thoughtfully curated, and the staff are both knowledgeable and friendly, making the experience even more enjoyable. If you love culture, art, or history, the Thai National Museum is an absolute mustvisit! Very good place to spend a meaningful time during a hot sunny day with parents who prefer indoor. They have different hall to show a specific topics.

Nice setting to present thai history and sufficient space to showcase their tools and heritage. Especially enough for thai's most important area of kingdom and Buddhist.

Ticket price is 200 thb for adults only, absolutely nothing for so much contents. Took my small family here in which we first took the sky train from the city. After the we got off the stop it was way too hot to walk so we just hopped onto the taxi. Friendly guards to lead you to the ticket booth. Saw a lot of cool things about Thai culture and Bangkok. Remember to leave your water bottle outside. Most of the indoor exhibits were clean and air conditioned! The coffee shop was nice and cool as well for a quick break. Great for the family! It's really worth to visit this place. There are three free guided tour available which is English, Japanese and French guided tour. We were very happy to join the English guided tour which explain quite detail about the history of Thailand and the muzium. We reached here quite early so no crowd to buy entrance tickets. Good place for history lovers. Gives out a lot of information about Thai Culture, people and history. Very well maintained, Air conditioned. Takes approximately 2 hrs for detailed tour. Shows the connection between India, Hinduism and Buddhism, where everything was began from India.

주소: 4 Thanon Sanam Chai, Khwaeng Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
The museum, focused on Thai history and culture, turned out to be more interesting than I expected. I would definitely recommend it to anyone with an interest in these subjects. Theres an audio guide available in English, German, French, and other languages. The museum isnt overwhelmingly large, so it can be explored in a relatively short amount of time.

Pros
Audio guided
Not so challenging to clear
It does what you expect of a museum

Cons
Not that I can think of The museum was full of interactive activites from treasure hunt to history show and role play activity. My kid absolutely loved playing card games to know more about Thai culture. The traditional food room was fun, too. Strongly recommend to families with kids. The museum was simply amazing! Almost everything was interactive, just don't forget to walk around with audio guide. From food culture to children's games and school life, you learn everything about their past and even current identity struggles. I would recommend sparing 12 hours for the museum and have fun while learning. The ticket is quite affordable in my opinion and was money well spent. The museum is conveniently located a few minutes' walk away from the pier. The building itself is very beautiful and if you have time after all the exhibits, enjoy some drinks or snacks from the food trucks  mini cafes in the museum garden.

The exhibits were very interesting and wellmaintained and the audio guide was great! I liked how interactive everything was. Definitely a must visit if you're in Bangkok. The entire museum can be explored within 1.5 to 2 hours on average. It wasn't crowded when we visited in the morning, even though it was a Saturday, so you don't have to buy tickets online and can just purchase them in person.

Last, I'd like to give a shout out to the friendly and helpful museum staff receptionists, exhibit caretakers, janitors, etc. as well! Good for tourist or small group travelers who wish to understand Thai culture.  The museum is a 3storey colonialstyle building, displaying works related to culture, beliefs and the warm charm of Thainess, with a touch of humor. Take the elevator to start viewing on the 3rd floor and continue down to the 1st floor.

At the back there is a wide lawn and a health food restaurant and a cute cafe. Sit and admire the beautiful garden and vintage buildings. I've been there twice and still like it.

주소: 273 Soi Saphan Yao, Khwaeng Si Phraya, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand
리뷰:
Beautiful museum in Bang Rak. Its a bit misleading as it should be called Bangrak Museum because it covers mainly the history and development of this particular area.

The house is owned by the family whose ancestors lived here but they opened it for the public. It captures the life of a well educated upper class Thai family in the middle of the 20th century. You can visit three houses the  we house the family lived in, the clinic the first husband of Indian descent was working in and a third house that serves as a Bangrak History museum.

Entrance is free and the volunteers working here are super nice, helpful and lovely. You may wanna spend 4560min here. Nice, free tour of three homes, including one Indian Doctor who also hosted Rabindra Nath Tagore,a prominent public figure  and Nobel Laureate in literature.
The attendentsguides were super nice and explained in details.
The houses were is good conditions with nostalgic touch. The weight machine, locks,working light switches, and gas light were awesome. I stumbled upon The Bangkokian Museum after getting lost in the city, and it turned out to be a fortunate discovery. The volunteers at the museum were incredibly knowledgeable and friendly. Some of them spoke English fluently and were eager to answer any questions about the history within the home. It was a truly enriching experience, and I am grateful to have visited. Highly recommend this gem of a museum! If you enjoy history in the sense of how people lived early 20th century in Bangkok, then this venue might resonate with you... Also the very caring staff concerned that I was overheating because the ac was switched off and the day 26Sep20242567 happened to be particularly humid... 3 different spaces to view, the first a formal house dedicated to modern living of the time, the second a pavilion dedicated to the good doctor's medical practice, and the last, more contemporary building with Aircon showing the development of Bangkok from the early 20th century onward as it began to grow and develop into the city we know today.

No entrance fees.
Signin and photo and phone number required with plenty of smiles this museum is slightly of the beaten track and with a slow pace offers another view of Thailand that isn't as immediately obvious to tourists.

Note  several stairs, slippery wooden surface and no formal mobility access points might not make this every person's cuppa.

Happy to have seen and learn!
Smiles and two thumbs up! There are altogether 3 houses here.  One of them was transferred from another location, originally belonged to a doctor related to the family. The facility is managed by government after the owner donated the property and maintained as museum. Nice little museum to have a flash back of early life during the 1940s to 50s. Remind me of my grandparents modest timber house in some detailing.

리뷰:
What a great museum, we were so impressed. It has so many things on offer for the little ones. The standouts for us were the 4D movie the pure joy from the kids when the bubbles popped out made my mouth hurt from smiling, the water park and the careers area for under 6s my kid loved this and we had to wait for almost an hour til we had to call it quits.

Really grateful that even as foreigners we can access it for free. Id be more than happy to pay a donation to contribute to its upkeep and resourcing. I think every city should have a science museum.

Thanks so much I came here with my 3yearold. It was not too crowded. The outdoor area seemed fun bit it was too hot, so we chose to stay in the airconditioned area. There were many interactive activities. However, we could not get in the lego play area because the slots were limited. Also, all of the activites were in Thai language with English subtitles only, so it was a bit hard to understand for foreign kids. A free place for kids . foreigners just need to show passport. they will provide a wrist band,it just used for entering the front gate.4D cinema is very good for kids.although the movie is in Thai.but so easy to understand via the animation. there are some more measurements for kids. check out my pictures. The entry is free, but many of the exhibits or galleries are broken and not working. Some areas also lack air conditioning. Make sure to bring your ID for entry. Its conveniently located near Chatuchak Weekend Market, so you can easily visit the market, park, and this place all in one trip with your family. Spent 3 hours here before went to Chatuchak. So my plan works. Let the kid be tired and you can shop freely after that. I think we went to 3 rooms in here. My kid is below 2 years old so not all rooms will allow her to go in. Overall, she enjoyed so much here. Thanks Bangkok!!!
Oh ya I forgot. Parents need to take turns going in the room. Only one parent allowed.

주소: 4 Chao Fa Rd, Khwaeng Chana Songkhram, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
Only three galleries open as of Sept. 2024 as they prepare for the Bangkok Art Biennale, which opens Oct. 24. It will be interesting to see what they do with this space. The old mint and its courtyard offer a great venue to appreciate Bangkoks 19th century, Europeaninspired architecture and the art therein. Until then, not really worth the 200 baht admission if this is itthough the charge seems to be waived some days. So stop in if you happen to be in the area, but dont go out of your way. Btw, pics allowed with no flash The National Gallery of Bangkok  Located on Chao Fa Road in Bangkoks historic Phra Nakhon District and is housed in the building of the former Royal Thai Mint. You will see unknown and renowned Thai artworks here, both old and new.

Great place for a rainy day, thats not a shopping mall   Give yourself at least 1 hour here.

Ticket cost 200 baht 6 USD Open Wednesday  Sunday, 9am  4pm

Directly across the street is The National Museum.
Easy and convenient to see both in the same day also 200baht ticket. plenty of the most beautiful Thai art works from the past to the present. The exhibition is very interesting. Large and cozy, plenty of arts display
30 thb for the ticket The National Gallery is a short walk around the corner from several other parks and museums. For only 30 Baht, visitors get access to main spaces that are open as well as the sculpture garden. Visitors should not pay anymore than 30 Baht either in advance or online. They do a lot of repairs and recirculating, so everything is not always open... With that said, we had a chance to see local artists and a Thai professor's exhibition. There is a timeline of past artists influenced by Western culture as well as a welcome from King Rama IX. Overall it's worth an hour and a half of your time. Families will love the expanse, shade and air conditioned exhibits and picnic area at the National Gallery.

주소: 939 Rama I Rd, Khwaeng Wang Mai, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand
리뷰:
It's a contemporary arts centre. Art, music, theatre, film, design and culturaleducational events take place in its exhibition and performance spaces.

Free entry art exhibitions are there all the time. It's 8 story building. At every floor, there are different art exhibitions. Also at the Underground level there is a quiet library where we can seat and read the interesting books related to different Arts. I am really happy to be here . I come on weekdays and spend around one hour inside the art gallery . I purchased a few handmade items which are tote bags and postcards. I'm happy to be able to contribute a little bit for the students. I had no idea that this place was completely free to go into and they run various exhibitions 100 worth a visit. You can access it via the BTS line. A lot more contemporary style art with a very Thai crowd not many tourist actually only ones that wander in occasionally. Multiple different types of exhibitions and shops as well as coffee and a really nice restaurant taste wise! The general exhibition is closed at the moment and will reopen on the 24 of October 2024

An amazing building with artsy shops and cafes as well as the art centre library in the souterrain and a small theatre on one of the upper floors.

When I went there, there was the geographical indications exhibition in cooperation with the European Union on display in the atrium.

Clean restrooms with water bottle refill stations. View  Bangkok Art And Culture Centre.
.
Opened in July 2008, this is a contemporary arts centre for art, music, theatre, film, design, and cultural or educational events to be held in its exhibition and performance spaces.
.
Designed to symbolize an intellectual assembly point, the curated exhibits are regularly refreshed.
.
There were several interesting commentaries in the exhibits during our visit, from the situation in Gaza, to the ethics of AI.

주소: 30 Sukhumvit 36, Klongton Klongtoey Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
I recently visited Art Gallery 36 in Bangkok, and my excitement levels were off the charts! This place deserves a solid 5 out of 5 stars. What truly sets it apart is the diverse range of artworks on display  you can immerse yourself in a world of different arts, each with its unique charm and style.

Vee was incredibly friendly and helpful throughout my visit. He not only guided me through the gallery but also went the extra mile by sharing contacts easily in order to stay in touch.

Moreover, I was pleasantly surprised when Vee showed me around the entire gallery. Their passion for art was evident, and it made my visit all the more enjoyable. Art Gallery 36 in Bangkok is not just a place to appreciate art it's a place where you can forge connections, explore diverse artistic expressions, and have a truly memorable experience. I can't recommend it enough! Good pricing and great collection. Store owner is very friendly. Cool art gallery with lots of oil paintings. Pretty big selection in a small space, so its good if you dont have too much time. Great art, be sure to see the upstairs as that is where they keep the good stuff I visited the gallery today and should confess it's a such a good place to have a look at, if you're thinking to buy a painting in Thai or Lao styles and not only. Among dozens of paintings you might find even the Vincent van Gogh's Starry night! Seriously. Special thanks to Vee and Am for being hospitable!

리뷰:
Large and refreshingly cool space off a busy road linking Sukhumvit with Phetchaburi Rd. How enjoyable depends on what exhibition is showing. Small gallery tucked away down a side street.  It's a quiet place perfect for thought and discussion with friends.  There are 2 buildings and 5 floors total.  Some of the art I didn't really understand but that's what art does, it gets us thinking.

Friendly staff, good AC. Lots of cafes nearby They welcome you with a great smile and they are very helpful  the exhibit is great and we saw a art turning into a marble glass. We went there some of the exhibit are under renovations but the art is amazing. This gallery is a bit hard to find since its tucked away deep within the sois but the journey is worth it. This place is very spacious and beautifully designed. There are 4 stories in total but only two were opened at the time of my visit. Admission is free and the staffs were very enthusiastic and friendly. A 3story gallery with breathtaking architecture featuring avantgarde art pieces. While parking may pose a slight challenge, it's manageable. The air conditioning creates a comfortably cool atmosphere, complemented by friendly staff members. Be sure to visit their Facebook page beforehand to see which artists are currently featured. Admission is free, and restrooms are conveniently located on the first floor.

주소: 84 Thanon Ratchadamnoen Klang, Khwaeng Wat Bowon Niwet, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
Very interesting exhibition consisting of a wide variety of media.

Films, sculptures, paintings and interactive works of art are displayed over three floors. I really liked the mix. It would be great if more bilingual explanatory panels were used. The loftlike building is fantastic as it draws the focus to the exhibits.

And we all love a free entry  The building itself is very well reconstructed, the space is very modern and airy.
I saw beautiful exhibitions on each floor, all of them very stimulating and thoughtprovoking. It was wonderful to see how young Thai artists see and think about their country and how they are able to portray it. I loved the visit! Thank you  Extremely memorable. Had an unexpected amazing time here. This was one of my favorite places. I won't spoil it but it was beautiful. Very interesting art center.
Many great surprises waiting the visitors.
Three floors of great art, culture, work shop, exhibitions, history lessons and fun.
It's free entry for everyone and no limit time to spend inside.
It's in a unique location where you once you finished, you can walk to another two art museums next door and the Golden Temple near by.
Undoubtedly, it's a fantastic art center you must visit if you are in Bangkok. Part Museum and Part Art Gallery it's free to visit and makes for a great double event with the nearby Rattanakosin Exhibition Hall.
Two floors, the 2nd Floor is all about ASEAN, the collaboration of  10 SE Asian Countries. Its great and quite good fun as you have many interactive displays where you can compare the similarities as well as differences between each country. For example, see yourself dressed in the National Costumes of each country. See popular dishes prepared by a Cartoon Type chef etc.
The other part of the building on the 1st floor is a display of modern art, paintings and video, as well as photographic themes like martial arts, national festivals and National Dresses. Easily spend an hour here so three hours if you combine with Rattanakosin.

Very cute and lovely little indie art gallery. If I'm free, I'll definitely drop by to have a quick look. The overall experience unfortunately depends on who they're presenting at that point in time, and what's being hung on the walls. They don't squeeze too much of their artists' works in the space, and makes it just nice for an enjoyable experience. After you're done, sit by Hearth Art Cafe, for a quick coffee, before you go. Interesting fusion between an art gallery and a coffee place. The interior style is very cool and the music and art combine into an ambiance that is different in a good way from the million other coffee places in Bangkok. Recommended to check this out! Such a nice gallery and cafe in a classic wood house locating right in the middle of the city. Not so far from BTS Surasak. Recommend if you want to check out some arts or stop by for a fancy drink with such a good gallery vibe. Lovely art gallery  cafe hidden in an alley.
Came for the art, stayed for the drinks.
Free entry and cats are friendly too Great little caf and gallery!  If you want to drink nice coffees surrounded by good art, that's possible.  If you want to go and see serious work in the changing exhibitions, that's also possible!

Presentation is excellent.  Lovely place for a date.  But it's also a hardcore art space, they show some of the top local painters.

Do take note of the precise location enter from Soi 23 via the little outdoormall area or directly the alley connecting to Surasak Road is private and usually closed.

MOCA at Four Seasons has the best ambience amongst art galleries Ive been to, lotus  flowers are blooming outside and calming music is flowing through the atmosphere. They always have a 3D art, which I appreciate contemplating on. Saw an awesome Bill Bensley exhibit here in June 2023. A lot bigger than you expect from a hotel art gallery . Best of all it's 100 free even if you aren't staying at the hotel A modest modern art gallery located within the Four Seasons Bangkok by MOCA. Exhibitions feature contemporary art and are subject to quarterly revision. If you get the chance to visit the Four Seasons Bangkok, it's a nice spot to roam about! At this hotel, you may also take in the breathtaking view of the Chaophraya River. Gallery in the hotel exhibits art from various artists on quarterly basis This is a space within Four Seasons Bangkok for exhibiting Art.

Loving whats on exhibit.

Will come often to see whats on.

Very small, but cozy place. Tiny cafe with oneroomgallery. It has SWINGS!!! 
Great atmosphere A tiny art gallery  coffee shop. Super chill  Small intimate gallery and cafe. Well curated art and photography exhibitions along with the occasional play or screening. Excellent brunch spot The little gallery come with a garden cafe, the drinks isnt sweet like normal Thai drinks do, recommended to chill for the morning

This place is heaven for art lovers. It has rooms for different exhibitions. The day I went there were 4 different exhibitions in 2nd floor, each has its own colors and all free entries. The place is also riverside, you can take the boat to cross the river and go to Icon Siam Tang Gallery Bangkok is located on the 2nd level of River City.

Interesting concept as the gallery represents mostly Chinese Artist and some Thai  Asian Contemporary artist as well. The exhibitions rotates from the to time. Its worth the visit if the artist that you like is currently on display. Located in River City Bangkok, the space is large and airy but there is no staff there to guide or introduce anything I really like the works in the contemporary art exhibition

리뷰:
Lovely place! A little small but super fun nonetheless since the current exhibit includes a 12min VR experience  for free too! The vibes are immaculate and the librarybookstore right beside it was an aesthetic place for photos. The staff was also super friendly so that really tied things together for us. Would recommend 1010! Such a cool space, and it also got a library with a great selection of books about art, music, tech ... Small art gallery in Bangkok. Free entrance.

Walkable distance from MRT Lumpini. Location is in the peaceful and quiet area.
There're 2 rooms separately. The library is on the left side while the exhibition is on the right side.

I got good vibes from this place. It's nice to spend my afternoon at such a good place like this. Beautiful small gallery with dedicated staff. I spent some time in the adjacent building looking at a great selection of self published books that often complimented prior exhibitions. The staff were friendly and engaging and I learnt a lot. Theres a beautiful shaded table under a tree that adds to the whole experience. Id be back often if I lived in Bangkok. Very cool space for those who are keen in arts.

주소: 101 Thanon Ratchadamnoen Klang, Khwaeng Wat Bowon Niwet, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
If you look at previous posts here, you can see that there are some interesting exhibitions. But when I went there, the shown exhibition lacked artistic demands as well as curatorial standards.

In my opinion, the "art" on display had a purely decorative function and hardly any deeper meaning. The theme was transience, but it was treated in a superficial and clichd manner.

In the entire threestory exhibition there were maybe 5 works that were somewhat interesting. A lot of it was really horrible kitsch. However, the purpose of the institution seems to be primarily to sell the works and not primarily to provide cultural education. I hope other exhibitions on site are more sophisticated. One of the very attractive sites for art exhibition lovers. Entrance fee 50 Bth. All staff are very friendly and warmly welcoming as well as helpful. No other tourist people in the gallery, while we enjoyed spending our time together. So impressive! A small gallery in the city center, where now, in September 2024, an exhibition of religious works is taking place. There are many very original paintings, it is worth visiting. But on the second floor it is unbearably hot although the other floors have air conditioning, much hotter than outside, you will have difficulty looking at the paintings because you feel unwell. Nice art gallery, worth to visit it. The entrance fee is 50 baht. 3 floors of art gallery to visit.

Near many other sites which are just one Block away walking

주소: Room 118-119, Jatujak Plaza - Zone C, 599 Soi 3, Khwaeng Chatuchak, Khet Chatuchak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10900, Thailand
리뷰: I recently bought a beautiful painting at Art to Art Gallery in Bangkok. I first visited the gallery since I was in town because of work, but only decided to buy a specific painting when I was back in Europe. I must say that Art to Art team provided an extremely professional service offering to pick me up at the hotel to take me to the Gallery when I first contacted them. Later on transaction happened in the most smooth way, and finally logistics worked perfectly, the painting was perfectly packed in a rigid protecting tube that enable its delivery in Europe in perfect state. I was constantly updated on each of the phases of the process. I strongly recommend doing business with Art to Art Gallery. Diego We couldn't be happier with our experience with Art to Art Gallery. We live in the United States and had been looking for a painting by a particular artist since 2014. The gallery found the painting for us luckily they had one of the few that exist in their gallery and worked with us to ensure that the painting was perfectly packaged and safely delivered. I was concerned about purchasing art sight unseen, but the gallery answered all of my questions and concerns and were professional through the entire process. I highly recommend purchasing art from this gallery. Whenever we are in Bangkok we pay a visit to arttoart gallery. They have a very good selection of works of modern Asian artists. We usually find pieces to buy. We also found the shipping and processing of the purchases very reliable and professional. We always enjoy to be there. This is not a gallery!  This is a small room!  Photo deception!  I don't recommend going here!  The owner forbade photography, I do not post photos. Look good

First time to have breakfast.
Good food. Good staff. Good place.
Cozy. Clean. Cool place to hang out if you like art in BTS Thong Lo Quiet, airy and cool cafe downstairs. Fair prices 85100 for basic machiato or cortado. Some cakes on offer. Child friendly and very cheerful barista. Not crowded on a a weekday morning. Very chill setting with great aircon. I wonder if you could choose the size? Got my mango sticky rice and paired it with an ice latte here. Good clean cool space with a clean bathroom. What more can you ask for? one of the art space recommendations in bangkok thailand, the location is very strategic, but many people don't know a location as cool as this, hiden gems really, if from siam Central it's enough to take the BTS train, you can see it from the top floor of the location.

Interesting contemporary gallery with changing exhibitions and a very nice view from the top floor of the building!

The exhibition I visit is "Fluffy Fluffy Galaxy" by Miguel Delie. The staff there is freindly and very helpful. On 4th floor, there is a large clear view of Odien roundabout.

Remark
 They don't have elevator, only stair ...
 The toilet is on the top floor Over the influence is a sanctuary of contemporary art hidden in Bangkoks China town.

The third floor has a spectacular view of Odeon Circle, the historic circle in the middle of Yaowarat. The view of the Temple of the Golden Buddha, Wat Traimit, is also serene and inspiring. A contemporary art gallery in China town with great view.

Here for blood tests and got this wonderful drink as a first time of my visit. Both caf and clinic staffs provide the greatest service.
Love this place! Very friendly staff who are patient to explain the IV drip procedure with you. They made me feel very comfortable throughout the process despite this being my first time. Thank you! Cool place with great concept from PULSE Social Enterprise, with art gallery callled PULSE Gallery and artist in rsidence studio on the 3rd and 4th floor.
What we like is the coffee shop ground floor, very cute romantic flower ceiling dtails.
The second floor is community health center which provide laboratory testing called PULSE Clinic one of 6 branches in Bangkok and 16 branches in Asia, covid19 testing medical certificates, HIV PrEP, emergency PEP and lab tests offered here at affordable price. Nee cool place for Bangkok. Very friendly staff, good prices and highly qualified consultation! Its very convenient to get here, and they have very good service!

Pay them a visit, and Im confident youll leave with a newfound appreciation for both coffee and art. Small art space and very enjoyable to kill some time by viewing cool art Current exhibition Things Occupying Space  Jun.GK Definitely worth visiting. Beautiful contemporary art exhibition and super nice  helpful staff. Oh, and they serve some great coffee there as well! Matdot is an extraordinary art junction in the heart of Bangkok, where you can fully enjoy and explore the different experiences of the artistic theme. Whether you are an artist, art collector, art student, or one who falls in love with the art world, we offer a variety of innovative activities in this combination of magnificently creative spaces. A great new studio and exhibition space outside of the city centre. A little far away, but worth the atmosphere and artwork. Theres a cafe with excellent coffee too.

리뷰:
Seems like it would have been interesting, but the "moveable" maze didn't move at all during my visit, just stayed suspended from the ceiling so there was not much at all to see NOVEMBER 26, 2022  MAY 28, 2023

FIELD COLLAPSE

Artists
Savinee Buranasilapin
Tom Dannecker

At 100 Tonson Foundation ,Bangkok ,Thailand

Field Collapse is a gallerybased environment inspired by construction sites, where the details of a workinprogress communicate social, economic, and aesthetic messages that often go unread. 100 Tonson Gallery earns it reputations for being the finest and one of the first Contemporary Gallery in Bangkok. The gallery is located on tonson street. The same street as the Embassy of The Netherlands.

Despite the narrow street and I have to agreed with other comments on here saying the the cars passing by are quite dangerous as the footpath are very narrow and trees are everywhere. Be very cautious on commuting via foot.

The place deserve 5 stars from me despite the not very convenient walking on footpath, due to the arts works selected there. Sometimes there are live performances as well. Artworks exhibited are rotates around every 2 months. Owner and staff are super friendly and kind. Great exhibition space!  Interesting contemporary artist choice.  Thoughtful installations.  Let artist experiment and express.  Porch on the outside, warmth inside I love the exhibition

La Lanta Fine Art, located around Narathiwas area known as N 22 district. The nearest public transport would be the BRT to ThanonChan from BTS Chongnonsi.

La Lanta owns by Khun Fon Director, has been established since 2005. They offers contemporary art works and support Thai local artists as well. They work with emerging and midcareer Thai and international modern and contemporary artists.

La Lanta Fine Art can often be find at various InternationalRegional Art Stage and scene as well. Nice small art gallery. Went there for a workshop. Friendly people and beautiful art. 리뷰:
This is an exhibition hall in River City Bangkok. Although the exhibition hall was small, it was very nice to see the works. When I visited, there was an exhibition called Somewhere only we know, and catalogs and works related to the exhibition were being sold across the street. There was also a photo booth next to the sales booth.

There is another exhibition hall around the exhibition hall and River City Bangkok has many shops selling various crafts, so I recommend stopping by at least once to see the exhibition.

리뷰:
Medium size for exhibition. Easy to find and reach from public transportation BTS National Stadium st. Very good experience watching my friends art exhibition. It is kind of small, but considering it's very near from bangkok culture center and the art pieces is worth my walk over there, it's an amazing place. Just come before evening, you can visit many other museums within Chulalongkorn uni complex Closed until November because of Covid19.

Three rooms have changing exhibits with a lot of variety. Free admission and just a sort walk south of MBK Shopping Center. Went to see an art exhibition by Ajahn Jay from Chiang Mai. He has been a good friend for many years. He specialises in Lanna countrylife scenes, water lilies, portraits, etc.  His gallery north of Chiang Mai is a wonderful experience.

리뷰:
Contemporary, urban and street art fans should definitely check out the amazing show GOLDIE  Friends now on at Aurum Gallery  the gallery by British DJ, musician, actor and artist, Clifford Price aka Goldie 30 until the end of January. Loved the cute, irreverent pieces by Mr Brainwash and Nick Walker. A really cool gallery to visit at Warehouse. It's actually a really nice art gallery, here at Warehouse 30. Space is large, artworks aplenty, with many fancy named art works for sale. They even have a Banksy print when we were there, which was impressive to say the least. was impressed by the beauty and originality of the paintings and sculptures presented. Each work aroused my special interest and left a deep impression.

I liked the beauty and originality of the presented paintings and sculptures.

I was especially interested in the techniques that the artists used. Some paintings were done in graphic technique, there were works of broken glass, carvings on wood and metal.

I recommend this gallery to anyone interested in contemporary art and who wants to see something truly unique and original. Very nice gallery for street art, urban art and graffiti art. Gallery is owned by famous DJ, actor and musician GOLDIE. You can also buy paintings and high quality prints. Aurum  latin for gold The gallery showcased various beautiful art pieces. The staff were welcoming and friendly. We enjoyed looking at the paintings.
