주소: 10 Naradhiwas Rajanagarindra 22, Khwaeng Chong Nonsi, Khet Yan Nawa, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand
리뷰: Gallery Ver is a small exhibition gallery tucked away in a secluded spot.  It's perfect for a quick visit if you're looking to appreciate art without spending lots of time.  The intimate setting adds to the charm, making it a unique and enjoyable experience.  Highly recommended for art enthusiasts seeking a brief and delightful escape. Gallery VER nestled in an area best known for "N22" area. Where art communities and artists mostly hang out there. Gallery VER offers both established and emerging local artists to the exhibitions. Their projects and conceptual philosophy offers us a new perspective of art scene. The space is quite spacious and all staff there are helpful and friendly. Excellent place, Im so happy I found it. Several galleries united in N22 space. The longest way round is the shortest way home exhibition is just great, it open up the struggle, fate, feelings of Burmese immigrants in Thailand, echoing their invisibility in Thai society. Very cool spot. Theres actually a little clutch of different galleries here, each serving up its own eclectic offering. No one is here to hassle you, which is great, but theres also no one to offer any explanation. Part of Bangkoks independent art scene, Gallery VER is housed alongside working warehouses and other spaces such as Cartel and Tentacle the former has delicious coffee and sodas. Try to support local art, as it doesnt always get the recognition it deserves.
영업시간: no operation time

주소: 137 – 137/1, Sukhumvit 63 Road, Soi Thong Lo 10, Khlong Tan Nuea, Khet, เขตวัฒนา กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
A small, peaceful gallery with rotating exhibitions. I've been here multiple times, and the exhibitions consist of various styles, including drawing, paintings, ceramics, sculptures, etc. The information is regularly updated on their Facebook page. There's a mini cafe that only accepts cash. The gallery is closed on Sundays.

Note
 The gallery can be accessed by walking upstairs or taking the elevator to the 1st floor from the restaurant LAVA. However, it's not wheelchairfriendly since you need to walk up small stairs to reach the inside of the restaurant.
 It can be reached by public transport get off at BTS Thonglor, walk to 711 in Soi Sukhumvit 63, and take the red mini bus there costs 8 THB, getting off at Thong Lor Soi 10 or you can walk, depending on the weather Ardels Third Place Gallery is the third locationartspace from Ardel's by Prof. Tavorn. Located on Thonglor soi 10, Ardel's third place is on the second storey building. The exhibition rotates from time to time showcasing contemporary art, whether its painting or video installation.

The artspace also have a mini cafe area as well. Came to this place very exited as on pictured this place looks bomb!
And it was simply closed. The security told me it is closed for that day, however, on Google maps schedule there was no any info that this particular day the gallery will be closed..
So as a result i saw only this statue with two laughing thai people. How symbolic is it? interesting art gallery, compact but big enough for an exhibition, good selected show. Great gallery for contemporary art in the heart of Thonglor.
영업시간: no operation time

주소: Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Bangkok 10330, Thailand
리뷰:
Lumphini Park is an absolute mustvisit when in Bangkok! This beautiful green oasis offers a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. Whether you're visiting in the early morning or during the evening, the park is stunning, with its serene lakes, lush greenery, and wellmaintained walking paths. The mornings are perfect for a relaxing stroll or a jog, with the cool breeze and the sight of locals practicing Tai Chi adding to the tranquility. Evenings bring a charming atmosphere as the sun sets, painting the sky with gorgeous hues. I highly recommend renting a paddle boat on the lake or just sitting by the water, soaking in the calm vibes. Its a perfect spot to recharge and enjoy nature in the heart of the city. A magnificent place to come and sit and relax. Let the world pass you by all while sitting in a park in the heart of a bustling city.
Lots of people exercising even riding little boats on the lake.
Extremely well maintained. Easy to loose hours of your day here. Such a great spot! I could spend hours just watching the monitor lizards sunbathing and swimming around the pond. Its a beautiful place, and the crows hanging around give it a bit of a wild vibe. The park has a chill atmosphere, perfect for relaxing and enjoying nature. What a delightful place to go and get away from the hustle and bustle of the big city. It is a huge park in the middle of the city with a huge lake with a pathway that goes all.around and lots of trees for shade. The park is very safe and there are many benches and rest spots all over , ideal for a picnic or even just to go sit and relax or to have a nice long stroll. The park is massive so you will have no problem finding a nice spot no matter the time of day. They also ffer paddle boat rides to go out on the lake. There are many monitor lizards living inside the park, quite an experience seeing them just roaming around freely. I can highly recommend a visit to this park Lumphini Park is a vibrant oasis in the heart of the city, offering a wonderful escape into nature.

The park is home to a fascinating array of wildlife, including monitor lizards, cats, and ravens. Each visit promises a new encounter with these interesting creatures.

With its beautiful and varied trees, Lumphini Park provides a picturesque setting for relaxation and recreation. The lush greenery and serene environment make it a perfect spot for nature lovers.

The park features abundant walking and running paths, catering to fitness enthusiasts. Additionally, group exercise classes are available, offering a fun way to stay active while enjoying the outdoors.

Lumphini Park is a delightful destination that combines natural beauty with diverse wildlife and ample opportunities for exercise. Whether you're looking to unwind or get active, this park has something for everyone.

주소: Thanon Ratchadaphisek, Khwaeng Khlong Toei, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
Beautiful park for walks and strolls with little ones too. Pleasant views of lush green grass..huge shade providing trees .. cute birds and squirrels.  Maintained well and kept clean.

Has a nice lotus pond .. small kids park and sport centre with badminton courts that open at 5am

The kids park is alongside the sports centre and also has sensory gardens for little ones.

You can ask the guards for directions. They are helpful. Benchakitti Park in Bangkok is a mustvisit for nature enthusiasts seeking a break from the city's hustle and bustle. This picturesque park features a serene lake, providing a perfect setting for relaxation and fresh air. The park is surrounded with vibrant flowers and lush trees, offering a refreshing escape. Visitors can enjoy a variety of activities, including cycling, jogging, and running along the pathways. A standout feature is the long, charming bridge, which becomes even more magical at night, ideal for photography and leisurely walks. With a convenient public restaurant onsite, this park offers everything needed for a rejuvenating day in nature. Great place to go for a walk on the weekend or any day of course.
Amazing lake inside with a walking path surrounding it.
A very nice bridge with gorgeous lighting, where you see all people taking pictures.
Very easy to reach by BTS near asoke station
A dedicated section for pets, which you won't find in other parks.
Wonderful place overall. Im based in Bangkok. I usually visit this park quite often about once a week.  Its a huge area split into two different parks. The older park which is near Queen SiriKit has a beautiful lake in the middle, but its not shaded. The swamp park on the other side is great to walk or run around and has an amphitheatre and
skywalks If you are traveling to Bangkok, I highly recommend spending a couple hours walking through Benchakitti park, especially the Skywalk! Plenty of drinking fountains and public restrooms. Wellmaintained.

주소: 200/1 Kamphaeng Phet 2 Rd, Khwaeng Chatuchak, Khet Chatuchak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10900, Thailand
리뷰:
Very well maintained and lots of different interesting areas of the park. It was a lovely peacefull respite from the heat as the trees have created a microclimate and provided shade. Some really cool plants I have never seen before and lots of cute squirrels running around. It's a huge park near Chatucak market. Made in honour of Queen Sirikit, the lake in the middle is in the shape of her name in Thai script. The Curcumas are in season now and they carpet the park in shades of pinks. It's a very beautiful park with unique native plants brought in from all over Thailand. The Golden Leaf Bauhinia is in bloom too and the gorgeous young leaves are in shimmering bronze. When the leaves mature, the bronze hairs on the young leaves drop off and they become green. So fascinating. We learned this through a botanical art workshop conducted by SciArt network, Mahidol university and Botanical Art Society of Singapore. The professor in the course studies native banana species and brought us to see a big section where all the different bananas are brought together as a showcase.
Many people use it for exercise throughout the day as the grounds are very scenic with the plantings, multiple bridges and the interesting curvy lake. It's such a peaceful place, perfect for escaping the hustle and bustle of the city. The park is filled with beautiful trees that provide plenty of shade on sunny days. There are several ponds and fountains that add to the serene atmosphere, and it's so relaxing to just sit and listen to the water.

I was delighted to see a variety of birds and even spotted some fish and monitor lizards in the ponds. The park is quite large, so there's a lot of space to walk around or find a quiet spot to relax. A beautiful walk through nature! This park is located near BTS Sam Yot, but we had to walk through Chatuchak Park to get to this entrance.

The park is beautifully curated and absolutely huge. There are different areas with different aesthetics. There are also different paths to walk on, there is the main path and also smaller paths along the water, and some smaller specialty gardens. The flowers are beautiful, and the water is calming. The lotus pond area is also tranquil and quiet.

It was a little difficult to find the toilet, but thankfully there were guards around I could ask for directions.

If you are a fan of the Thai GMMTV lakhon 23.5, this is where the swing shots are filmed. Have a fun mission looking for the spot! We crossed the waters like 810 times looking for the filming location which has changed a little because the trees have been trimmed.

Over all, a really beautiful place to spend a day. If you plan on staying long, I suggest you locate a toilet before walking around. At least you will know where it is, unlike me  A beautiful and clean park to walk, do exercise, relax and rest. Cycling is not allowed there. I do not recommend you to run in the park as the ground is covered with paving stones. It is connected with the Rot Fai Park through a bridge. You can see both parks if you have time.

리뷰:
My favorite park in Bangkok. Very beautiful well maintained quiet place where it's nice to walk around for a couple hours, especially I like bamboo road near the flowers. They change that flowers in some months. There are ponds with fish and turtles.You might find unusual birds and you definitely will see squirrels and monitor lizards, sometimes they sleep on the palms. You can rent a bicycle, there is a good bicycle path, or run in the park if you are an athlete. Nice park, a lot of walkways and a dedicated bike lane that is separated from the walk paths. And sometimes runs through great areas of the park.
Park is a little dated, but it is kept clean and maintained as good as it could be.
Features several playgrounds and a dedicated sports center. Also there is a butterfly park inside that you can visit for free. The most gorgeous park in Bangkok by quite a stretch. The wildlife and greenery is unmatched. Would definitely recommend. Beautiful park with a lot space to run, walk and chill. I saw a big lizard there and people maintain the park so it looks very well. A public park with a perfect environment, lots of shady trees. Reconditioned from an old golf course. The garden is very well maintained. You can walk, jog, or take the kids for a bike ride with separate zones. Cycling paths are separated from pedestrians. The 2.5 km walkway around the park can connect to two other parks, Benjakitti Park and Chatuchak Park. Open from 530 a.m. Recently, a zone has been opened for pets to walk.

It's one of my favourite stops when I am around. Great view of the river and the bridge Rama VIII. It has different vibes at day and night. The staff work hard to keep this place nice and clean. The pavilion was not accessible to go into. Seems like a nice place to relax or even take a nap on one of the benches in the shade like some of our local hosts were doing A small park with a beautiful pavilion and view of the bridge. 주소: 254 Phaya Thai Rd, Khwaeng Wang Mai, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand
리뷰:
recently visited Chulalongkorn University Centenary Park and was thoroughly impressed by its modern design and serene atmosphere. The park is a beautiful blend of green spaces and innovative infrastructure, making it a perfect spot for relaxation and recreation.

One of the standout features of the park is its windy and refreshing environment. The open layout and thoughtful landscaping allow for a constant breeze, which makes it a pleasant place to spend time, even on warmer days. The parks modern design is not only aesthetically pleasing but also functional, with wellmaintained pathways, seating areas, and plenty of shaded spots.

Additionally, the park serves as a vital green lung for the city, addressing environmental challenges such as urban heat and water management1. Its a wonderful example of how urban spaces can be transformed into sustainable and enjoyable areas for the community.

Overall, Chulalongkorn University Centenary Park is a mustvisit for anyone looking to enjoy a peaceful and modern outdoor experience in Bangkok. Take a rest on weekends or weekday evenings it's suitable for everyone of all ages and is petfriendly too. There is space for many activities, such as working out, running, playing badminton, or even just talking with friends. Beautiful greenbelt w oxygenated pools, gardens,  trees , exercise and walking areas  great for community  visitors alike. Good light exercise  rebalancing ! I just went here bcs I found BanThad Thong street was a bit overwhelming lol. So I only bought take away to eat in here and it was a good decision especially when you came alone. It was a nice park, not really much to see, but great for chilling even until late of night. Not only university students, I think local and other visitors also come here too. Cute little park on the Chulalongkorn university campus. Very quiet and chill. Its not very big but a nice hangout for university students.

The park is connected to Banthat road. So there is plenty of food and coffee shops around.

Theres also a small open community mall in that park, where students sit and read or chill over coffee.

Beautiful park located right next to Mo Chit BTS station. Has a lot of walkways, water and bridges. Quite good for taking pictures and enjoying the nature.
Usually on weekends its quite a lot of people here and I was surprised this time it was not.
The park features various picnic areas and playgrounds.
Perk is pretty clean and wellmaintained. Wonderful park, with nice scenery and a lot of green color.
There is water inside also, so it is not iust grass and trees.
Has some nice bridges as well.
Very convenient to reach, as it is located near the BTS and MRT. So anyone could reach easier.
Chatuchak market is there, so you could add this activity to your list on that day  Beautiful park. Perfect place to spend good time with friends, family. Very clean  well maintained. This was a hidden gem!

After taking a stroll around the area we found this park and ended up spending hours sat by the water.

We saw some reptile like creature and some fish which made it all feel more natural.

You will see a lot of people jogging here and hanging out.

Sadly the toilet was locked by the time we got there so that was the only downside. Lovely, spacious park in the heart of Bangkok. There are plenty of small sections to explore as well as the rest rooms. You can only find water stands near the gates only, so be prepared if you plan to be lost, like me! Lol

The park itself can be intimidating as its very large so be sure to look for signs if you want to explore off the walking path, or else you can easily walk around in circles.

리뷰:
Beautiful pocket park within the local community, in memory of the late Princess Mother. Its quiet and peaceful with nice greenery.

Park was wellmaintained and theres even a gallery that showcases the background and history. Very beautiful park! Feels more like a fancy garden than a park. It is very quaint sized, historical park. Old men are doing tae chi in the main entrance. There is a huge bodhi tree and a pavilion. On the other side is the statue of the Princess sitting on a bench. In the back side there are more beautiful gardens with some ruined buildings. In the center there are offices you can enter for free to read up on the Princess Mother's life story! Great park.
Suan Somdet Ya, is a park in Bangkok, Thailand. It was established in 1993, and opened on January 21, 1997, by King Bhumibol Adulyadej, in remembrance of his mother, Srinagarindra, the Princess Mother. Lovely place to come and relax sitting in the garden. Hard to believe there is a city around. So peaceful. Peaceful and refreshing spot, can easily spend a whole day here, air con library is available with lots of books for kids  Not the biggest of parks in Bangkok, but its worth a visit if you're in the area and want some chill time. The grounds are beautifully kept and the staff are very friendly. Nice little museum in the grounds. Can easily add this stop to some of the very interesting things in the area

주소: 184/72 สุขุมวิท, Khwaeng Khlong Toei, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand
리뷰:
Great dog park inside the Benjamitti park area. Very stylish, a lot of walkways, water and tall plants that create privacy if needed. Equipped with everything your dog might need.
Also provides a lot of places to sit and relax if walking your dog is too tiring. Not very crowded, so it is comfortable pretty much at any time the dog park is a good start.  unfortunately it is not really dogfriendly yet.  You can't actually let the dogs run free.  It is forbidden and there is no fence for it.  There is also no playground for dogs here.  It's ok to walk the dogs there but there is still so much potential to make it better.  We all hope that Bangkok will eventually become a super friendly dog city. Thank you BMA! Nice dog park at north end of Benjakitti Park.
Update dogs are required to be on a leash and I think its a good idea  the park borders part of a very long canal than runs through Bangkok parallel to Sukhumwit and links to Lumpini Park too  those Klongs attract water monitor lizards which can get quite big I estimate 2030kg and which can definitely bite and eat a small dog  A pretty nice park for dogs. Theres a pretty waterfall inside, making the vibe more relaxing. I love how theres a tank of water for your dog please bring your own bowl  . HOWEVER, as I was walking, two huge water monitors literally DASHED out of the bush , so please be careful and keep your furry friends in sight. The park itself is nice, but Im quite scared to go back because of those water monitors. My ratings might be a bit on the lower side, largely because of the water monitors, which the park is not to blame. Nice park to walk dog and taking some leisure time. I like the variety of plants species and the way they designed area layout.

주소: Chaloem Phrakiat Ratchakan Thi 9 Rd, เเขวงหนองบอน Khet Prawet, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10250, Thailand
리뷰:
Awesome time there last Monday morning.  Was there for the Jog  Joy Kilo 10k race event.  Outstanding event sponsored by Jog  Joy.  My first race with this running organization, and they did a fantastic job!!!  The race through the park was beautiful.  Park is very clean with many facilities for activities such as bike riding, yoga, jogging, tennis, etc.  I'm looking forward to go back to this park again sometime soon. A nice place to go not far from Seacon Square for a morning walk or an evening stroll. Very pleasant park to go with your family especially those with kids for outdoor fresh air. Kids can bring their bikes and scooters . I am very impressed by the Geodesic Dome there for desert plants. Definitely worth a visit for 10THB as an entry fee per person and it's free after 5 or 6 pm. Amazing park....huge... it has everything u need ...
There is a nice cafe next to the lake...
You can also use the pedal boats ...
Kids playground is available also ...
Cactus and desert  plants area ...
Flowers as well..
Everything is beautiful....gonna post pics and vids Nice Park!
There is an entry fee, but it's like 0,30 ish, so it's not a big deal.
The Park is pretty big with lots of Flowers and Pavillions to go sit down and relax. The most amazing park with tons of running routes and cycling lane.

The park is free to enter after 5PM but you need to pay 10 THB for entering between 9AM5pm

Worth the visit with many beautiful flowers, plants and cute mini garden inside the park.

Furthermore, now the park is connected to Nong bon reservoir so it makes the running route even more fun and longer!

A great place to spend your evening or even half a day in the park.

Beware, it is really hot during the day so I would recommend to come later in the afternoon for more relaxing time.

Park has water stall for purchase and toilet is not free.

주소: PGX3+H25, Maha Chai Rd, Khwaeng Samran Rat, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
I found this park while I was walking to a temple and it was definitely a pleasant surprise. Its small but very relaxing!  There is a childrens playground, a basketball court, skate park , and a nice work out facility with many free weights and other work out equipment. There is a construction site right next to it but is seems to not be much of a factor! Still a nice place to relax! A beautiful, although small, park. Nevertheless, there is everything you need for a good rest there is beautiful, wellkept greenery, fountains for decoration and to cool the air , a playground for children, a playing field and an exercise area.
After a walk among the surrounding buildings, it is a nice change of scenery and a moment of rest among nature. I visited a unique park that used to be an old prison. It's an interesting spot with two old towers still standing. There are pretty fountains and a small pond that add to the charm. The park is quite compact and there isn't a lot of greenery, but it's a nice place to see at least once. Worth a quick visit if you're nearby and interested in seeing how an old prison area has been transformed into a public space. Its a nicely maintained park, i came strictly to see old jail buildings, sad most of them have been demolished, but a view watch towers left and a block of cells as well.

I was told by the guard that 7 years ago you could go inside the cells to look, not anymore.

At the park there is also a free public gym, but all equipment seemed very old, rusty, and a bit sketchy..

A small kiosk just at the entrance, selling water and some snacks. Nice park with a gym and sport playground, nearby MRT SamYot.
There are several small restaurant on the south side, outside the park.

주소: PFXW+763 Between the intersection of New Road and Rajini Charoen Krung Road, Khwaeng Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
Besides beautiful temples, parks is an another thing which deserves to be named as most interesting attractions in Bangkok. They are always well cared for, flower plantings and compositions are showy, and even though parks are very popular places among local people, there is always room for having a rest. Saranrom Park is one of those places where a random visitor can sit and cool himherself, eat one's street food meal or just take a nap. A very romantic park within walking distance of MRT Sanam Chai station...  Well manicured and scaped.  Enjoyed by several fitness enthusiasts, a small play area for kids and some sport activities provided as well with a smattering of fitness equipment dotted randomly.  Old trees,  fountains, pavilions and shrines also add to the ambiance.  If parks are your thing this is worthy of a visit, combine with nearby temple and museums. I recently visited a small but very charming park right in the heart of the city's historical area. It's a lovely spot with plenty of wildlife to see, including monitor lizards, treeshrews, and squirrels. However, be aware that there are also quite a few mosquitoes around. I would definitely recommend this park for a quick, naturefilled break from the urban surroundings. Great place to just walk, and view nature and animals. We saw a Monitor Lizard as well. A cute park that is fairly central to some tourist spots.
The park had staff at different entrance.  It was generally pretty clean looking and had some flowers.

주소: 58 Thanon Naradhiwat Rajanagarindra, Khwaeng Thung Maha Mek, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand
리뷰:
A charming park in the heart of Bangkok, easy to go by BTS sky train Chong Nonsi station and walk on Chong Nonsi skywalk to the park. This place is amazing. So many places for selfies and photos. Beautiful location by day. Amazing lighting by night. Absolute must for any tourist wanting good pics. Not your "normal park"... Think more along the lines of a late afternoon lovers promenade..  an urban green space that offers the backdrop of plants and sky scrapers against the artificial slopes built over a canal.  Different  yes. Photo opportunities galore. Child friendly? A flat no, unless the adrenaline rush of saving your child from every jagged rock, open water source and unprotected drop is your thing. Did I mention no swings, slides or sandpit either?
Do make an effort for an early morning or sunset shoot..   zero shade and with the heat radiating of every surface.. your glamour would be on the pavement in a puddle of sweat as soon as of you step of Chong Nonsi BTS  the closest stop as well.

Hats, water and umbrellas.. come armed for the weather.. there is no shelter from a sudden downpour either.

Happy photoshooting!! 23 82022 Nice spot for photo shooting especially after sunset. Easy access by public transport both BTS sky train and BRT. Hope this project will extend to another phase and I want to see the result that is this project successful or not. Actually a nice idea to upgrade an otherwise unattractive urban structure. The canal "park" connects with Chong Nonsi BTS station, Sathorn BRT station and has a direct entry to Empire Tower. I've spent many lunch breaks here with some food or fruits I got from nearby and it didn't really get that hot because the skyscrapers give enough shade. In the evening the walkways light up and it's very aesthetically pleasing. Hopefully they continue developing the project further. Planting more greens amid the concrete jungle is always a nice sight.

주소: QG34+R5M, Maha Chai Rd, Khwaeng Wat Bowon Niwet, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰: Mahakan Fort Park is a tiny park beside famous temple Wat Ratchanatdaram Worawihan. There is a small fort in the one corner of the park. The park is beautiful and well cared for and it's a good place to have small relax in sweaty and all too busy Bangkok, but otherwise, in my opinion, the fort  the park don't have much worth as an attraction. It's an ok park by the fort and the royal pavilion. Flower beds and some trees and one bench seat. There are much better parks in Bangkok....like Pricess Mother Memorial Park!! Enchanting and peaceful little patch of green in the midst of busy temple complexes and canals. Clean and well maintained, could use some more shady trees and benches, though. I was looking for Thai gardening that is here displayed for a tropic climate with bamboo and banana trees. Cutting trees remains a bit on French gardening I stumbled upon Mahakan Fort's park on my way to other attractions, and it turned out to be a nice pit stop to unwind so I kept coming back. It was pretty empty every time and has good views of the surrounding area. The park is filled with lush greenery, but it can get pretty hot during the day since there's not much shade around. The park is wellmaintained and has comfortable benches. You'll also notice a bunch of noisy crows hanging around, but they didn't really bother me.

주소: 649 665 Maha Chai Rd, Khwaeng Samran Rat, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰: Nice little park right next to the Wat Ratchanatdaram Loha Prasat. It's worth a visit if you wish to slwo down the pace and get away from tourists! There are so many trees there so you can get a shde from hot summer sun. There is a bathroom on the southeast corner of the park. Small soccer field, exercise machines, venches, pavilion, praying area in the center and kids playground. There are also chess board tables with henches all around the park. Quite relaxing and tranquil. Recommended visit  This small park is a haven from the city streets. Romaneenart Park started life as a prison and several guard towers and a small corrections museum exist to this day. The Park has many trees and small formal gardens. A good place to rest from sight seeing and shopping! Lovely space to feel a part of the community whether the benches to observe the beautiful scenery, participate in community exercise, or use the courts. The park is bigger than it first looks. I like that many of the benches are covered by bushes. Large gym inside the park if you would like the exercise outdoors and plenty of exercises places around the park. It's a nice, small, cozy park. A lot of greenery, clean, workers working all around.

Certainly worth the 200BH taxi from the hotel Been travelling through Asia for the last six months, only to find the highlight of my trip at the last day. Pendereckis tree WOW!

10 out of 10 recommend a friend Still a standing beauty, best in Bangkok! One of the most famous trees in Bangkok Lumphini park. Recommend! Suitable for all ages. Five star experience! Seems it got good trim recently. Keep growing!

리뷰:
Great little park gem, tucked away in Sathon. Cute little play ground for small children, in the shade under the trees. Bigger circuit,  about 500m ? Long for the joggers. Or goto when or Little Hooligan is climbing up the walls at home Very peacefull place lot of people come here to relax and to exercise you can bring your children too a lot of space to play.  And if you can bring some food for the fish, lots of hungry fish here.  Generally well kept park, I'm a bit conflicted about the use of so much concrete though. The landscape designers probably planned to use those spaces for gatherings and other events. Still, it felt quite hot, even though I was sitting under a shady tree and there was a nice breeze. By the way, it is not allowed to ride bicycles inside the park, you can park your bicycle at a designated area though, and the security staff is helpful. A lot of concrete. Almost no shade, just a few benches.
No playground Peaceful and chill, park is not that big but enough to have a walk and enjoy fresh air. Lot of cute cats

주소: 5/1-5/40 Thanon Ratchadamri, Khwaeng Pathum Wan, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand
리뷰:
A small beautiful park right between Central World mall and Saen Saep Canal.
Free admission. 10am  6pm. Small park next to several malls, signs say soft opening so must be a new area. Flowers are lovely and was nice for a brief visit. New small park nestled in between major shopping malls so no wonder very few people use it. As it is also close to the Saensab canal, you can definitely see the slums and obvious poverty right alongside the posh malls, high rise condos and upscale hotels nearby. Extreme contrast of rich and poor so near and next to each other. Nice new park in a very busy and central part of the city. It's usually fairly quiet so it is a good place to escape from the crowds. Not a lot of shade which would be important for the middle of the day Great addition to the area offering an escape from the close by all round hustle and bustle. Not well used while we were there, probably due to the fact it was hot and there is no shade.
The water features are quite calming and would be good to sit next to if you had a brolly to shelter under from the sun. A good place for a quiet jog as well.
Work appears to still be ongoing.

A tiny park you can cover in 15 minutes. Well design park for people near Bangkok Yai. Lots of people work out here.
The space is not that big for long run, however we can walk more round instead.
When it's night, the automatic lights can help. There's toilet inside the park as well. Nice and small public recreational park. It's total area wouldn't be over 1000 square yards which surely doesn't fit into the definition of a public park. It has a good jogging track and the small artificial water pond surrounding green plants and flowers. There's also a corner for old ladies to paddle and kids to seesaw. The oval shaped bituminous jogging track is about 500700m in circumference. Good place to jogging It is a very good park

리뷰:
The park is named Phloen Chit Pet Park.  It is straight 2.2 kilometers connecting Sukhumvit road and RamaIV road. It is very suitable to walk the animal for residence on both roads. The park used to prohibit any animal to enter. Tonight, I saw the signs replaced with new rules. Sorry it is in Thai. 1 dog  3months 2 accompanied person 15years 3 owner must be responsible in any adverse cases 4 fully vaccinated 5 dog must be on leash or animal in cage. Dog can not run freely.  6 poop in the designated area owner must clean after the dog 7 owner responsible not let dog bite people or other dogs 8 dog must not appear sick Really nice park has many activities for everyone.  Looks like it still has ongoing work to be accomplished.   Great place to visit with your family. Useless straight way park.
Why do you have to construct another park when we have a big park next door ?

Its always good when we have another park in the city but not this one.
This is the sign of corruption.

The good part is they have community fitness which everyone can use for free in the center.

The public drinking water is somehow not clean when I try. Beware. Connects Benjakitti Park to Sukhumvit Rd. Via a 10min walk. Beats walking on the street but odd that you're not allowed to bike on this flat path 
Also, the Sukhumvit entrance is sometimes cordoned off, perhaps to keep street vendors out? Connecting walkway to the main road. Not sure if this is opened 247, but much better than walking by the side of the road for walkers, especially when road is on one side a major roadway, and railtrack, whilst on Benchakitti side, its a road connecting into main road of Ploen Chit.

One of the best running parks outside central Bangkok. Well looked after, multiple toilets along the track, big pond in the middle and free drinking water station. Not as crowded as the parks in the inner city. The only down side is the lack of parking so some time you have to park quite far away. Such a great destination for exercise for those living in Bang kapi. Great running park with convenient bathrooms and water station in the Nawamin area! The whole lap around the park is roughly 2 km around the lake!. It's definitely a fantastic park for locals! Awesome experience walking and running here. Views are superb with big pond at center. This is the big park that you can come for exercise, relax or picnic.
It's free intrance, open 5 am  9 pm. Just one thing that inconvenience is no proper parking lots provided. Many people park along footpath of Siburapha road which has no parking sign along the way. Or you may try find some parking space in soi across that road. Nice, chill and quiet park in Bangkok. Saw some birds and squirrels over there. But, the smell of the river water is a bit stinky

Not a big park, but it can serve you a greenery wise while you are using this park for some exercise.

Heaps of turtles by the way  Unbelievable park hidden amongst the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. Complete eith walking and bicycle tracks along with places to sit. Stunning. Small park that is well worth the visit for those who libe by. There is parking but it is limited during peak times. There are public restrooms but bring your own tissues and wet wipes. It is my favorite park in the east of Bangkok with a parking lot. The running track is around 1 km, which is somehow short but surrounded by the lake and tree. There are also kid zone.

At the lake, I see more turtle than fish tho so you can bring your aged vegetable to feed them too.

Great place to go visit if you want to experience how the locals socialise and exercising. Its a small little green area in the middle of a busy area of the city and once you find yourself here you wont hear traffic and the loud noise Bangkok provides. The vibe is friendly and as a foreigner you can easily get invited to take part of the locals different sports activities A park by the river under the sky bridge with complete sport needs. They have, playground, Muay Thai ring, basketball and tennis court A cute little park. The whole park is covered by trees or the bridge so you always have shades and are covered in case of rain. The running track is rather small. 480m. But you can exit the park and run some sois to bring some variety to your run.

A lot of Thai kids use the park for ball games. There are also aerobic classes like in most other Thai parks. Best park but watch out during morning time have open karaoke very loud and after work hour there open loud music for exercise. Other then that love the Big tree and good wind feel at peace here cause of greenary. If it rain don't worry cause of bridge overhead is like roof. Walk across the bridge from the Saphan Taksin BTS station to visit this park.   Note the south side of the bridge has the better view.

리뷰:
Super small and quiet park at Siam.
Not a lot of places to walk, but also it is not really crowded, even on the weekend.
Nice trees at the entrance.
Some sitting is available in multiple locations.
Also there is an Amazon Cafe right in the park, so you can get coffee or something for your visit.
Also a nice shrine is located on the front side. While exploring the Siam shopping district, I came across a delightful little haven called ParkSiam. Just a quick fiveminute walk from the modern marvel of SIAMSCAPE, this park is a perfect spot to rest your feet and recharge.

Though one of the smaller parks in Bangkok, ParkSiam offers a charming and wellmaintained escape from the city's hustle. The park's design is simple yet inviting, with manicured lawns, shaded pathways, and ample seating areas. The greenery provides a refreshing contrast to the concrete jungle surrounding it.

One of the park's greatest assets is its proximity to the larger mall's in Siam. After spending hours shopping and exploring the highenergy environment of Siam. I found ParkSiam to be a welcoming retreat. The short walk is convenient, making it easy to transition from the bustling shopping areas to this peaceful oasis.

Upon entering ParkSiam, I immediately felt a sense of calm. It's the perfect place to take a break from the busy streets and relax. I found a comfortable bench under a tree and enjoyed the serene atmosphere. Despite its size, the park offers plenty of spots to sit and unwind. The gentle breeze and the sounds of nature provided a muchneeded respite.

The parks atmosphere is wonderfully tranquil. It's popular among both locals and tourists, yet it never feels overcrowded. The blend of natural beauty and quiet corners creates an ideal environment for relaxation. Whether youre peoplewatching, reading a book, or simply enjoying the peace and quiet, ParkSiam delivers a soothing experience.

If youre exploring the shopping areas of Siam and need a quick break, ParkSiam is a mustvisit. Its convenient location makes it an easy stop, and its serene setting offers a perfect escape from the city's pace. Whether you need a moment to rest or just want to enjoy some green space, ParkSiam is the ideal spot. Highly recommended for anyone needing a little respite in the heart of Bangkok! Located two streets away from Siam Paragon. Lots of school college kids come to this garden. It's a nice place for fresh air after shopping in the near by mall. Away from the road traffic. There's an Amazon Cafe near the park for an impromptu picnic. PARKSIAM is a vibrant and modern urban park located in the heart of Bangkok's bustling city center. This dynamic outdoor space offers a refreshing escape from the urban chaos, inviting visitors to relax, socialize, and enjoy recreational activities amidst a lively atmosphere.

As you step into PARKSIAM, you're greeted by a lush green oasis dotted with vibrant foliage, shaded seating areas, and interactive art installations. The park's welldesigned layout provides ample space for leisurely walks, picnics, or simply soaking up the sun while taking in the bustling energy of the surrounding area.

One of the highlights of PARKSIAM is its vibrant cultural and entertainment events, which range from live music performances and art exhibitions to outdoor movie screenings and food festivals. These events create a lively and inclusive atmosphere, attracting visitors of all ages and backgrounds to come together and celebrate the city's diverse culture.

PARKSIAM also offers a range of recreational facilities, including jogging tracks, fitness stations, and children's play areas, catering to the diverse needs and interests of parkgoers. Whether you're looking to stay active, unwind with friends, or simply enjoy a moment of tranquility amidst the urban landscape, PARKSIAM provides the perfect setting for urban dwellers and visitors alike.

Overall, PARKSIAM offers a vibrant and inclusive space where city life seamlessly blends with nature, culture, and community. It's a mustvisit destination for anyone seeking a refreshing escape from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok's streets and a chance to connect with the city's vibrant spirit in a dynamic outdoor setting. This is a small park located in the back lane of Siam square area. Inside the park there is only one Amazon Coffee shop and a water body filled with Koi fish and trees. It's like a breath of fresh air in the busy Shopping area.

Not sure how to join the water sports though I absolutely adore this petfriendly public park! Its a hidden gem with so much to offer. The pristine lake is perfect for kayaking, and my furry friend loves splashing around the shore. The bike lanes are a fantastic addition, making it easy to explore the park on two wheels.

What sets this place apart are the countless birds that call this park home. Birdwatching here is a delight, and my camera roll is now filled with amazing snapshots of these feathered beauties.

Overall, its a serene escape from the hustle and bustle of the city, and I cant recommend it enough to fellow pet lovers, nature enthusiasts, and anyone looking for a tranquil retreat. This park truly has it all!  Beautiful park having proper walkingrunningcycling track. Centrally located huge lake surrounded by greeneries all throughout, makes the ambience peaceful. Cycle rental shop situated at the entrance. Our first visit here and we loved it! We arrived at about its busiest, so we look forward to visiting again for a workout during less busy mornings. We just had a nice walk. What makes it nice is the shade and break from the sun! My favourite park in Bangkok to take my dog out for a walk! Most dog owners are considerate and follow the rules dogs on leashes, must pick up dog poo and the big lizards are not dangerous, if you keep your distance. I don't recommend letting your dog in the water to swim because dogs have died in the past from contracting Pythiosis there, and small dogs could be snatched by the water monitors. There are also public restrooms available as well as quite a few restaurants and cafes at the park entrance.

The Bangkok Symphony Orchestra plays beautiful concerts for free at Lumphini park during the cool season JanuaryFebruary.

This is their 30th anniversary.

Today was their last session for this season and it was absolutely wonderful. Great performances and a beautiful atmosphere.

The songs were introduced in both Thai and English and the MC asked some questions of the crowd for prizes which added extra fun.

The park is free to enter and you're allowed to bring a picnic to enjoy as your listening. Huge park for run, walk.
Kids play area
Swan boat  or kayak till 1730  free  close 1800 

Parking  yes 30 B  hour , 20 b after first hour This is a nice park in the center of Bangkok, you can meet many fat monitor lizards, ravens, cute cats there. Pretty nice place to chill during the day. My personal favorite is community sport time around 56 p.m.  there are many people any ages doing group work out. Unique Asian experience. Also all bathrooms are free and clean. Definitely not my favorite park in the city because of so much tourists there, however it is a nice place to be fir some time. Very cosy place to reste from the heat and the buzzing streets of Bangkok.But bring a Map and a water bottle, you can spent a lot of time in it without realizing it. A bleesed to visit tough. Thx BKK Royal Bangkok Symphony gives free concerts every Sunday from December through February.

Once the sun sets, the weather is perfect for outdoor concerts. Straw mats are available for rent 40baht and a few beverage stands are on the perimeter of the pavilion. Pack a picnic and enjoy some excellent musical performances.

Need to buy ticket in advance so it will be comfortable. There are monkey, elephant and some other shows available at specific timing. It will be a good entertaining. Need to pay extra if want to take photo with any animal closer. In summer time it's too hot. The place was really good. Worth the price. We went on a weekend so it was really crowded. People from all over the world were there mostly Indians because they had around 610 tourists groups. I would love to visit again on a weekday and see if its not crowded and maybe I would enjoy more. I would recommend buying tickets in advance because the prices are lower online. The only thing I didnt really like is the prices of the food. You are not allowed to take water and food inside but you can buy it inside the zoo, inside the zoo the prices are too high. I understand that its a tourist spot but either dont raise the prices or let people take food and water themselves. Easily the best place we visited in Bangkok  the kids loved it so much and even the adults. We really enjoyed the safari tour and wide range of animals they have at the Marine Park.

Walking shoes are a must as the park is very big and attractions can be far apart from one another.

Stroller friendly and plenty of places to park strollers when visiting attractions and shows.

For some reason, Google indicated that a Sunday morning is usually not too busy. Had no reason to doubt it since it has never proved us wrong at that time. So we went on a Sunday morning and arrived 30 minutes before the parks opened and there was already a lot of people and tour buses waiting. The park was really REALLY packed.

If you enjoy some quiet and peace, not having to queue for food and toilet, I strongly recommend against going on a weekend. Our driver said that weekends are the busiest and it usually isnt like that on weekdays.

There are quite a few restaurants and food stands to choose from in the park. Blossom Restaurant is one I do not recommend  it came with our park tickets from the travel company. For a buffet restaurant, we only had 6 types of food to choose and they were mostly tasteless. My kid and I both had tummy problems after that too. 22 Aug 2024
My kids love this place. All the shows are excited. You have to arrange your time to catch all the shows
Buy tickets online and book a roundtrip car to take your family to the safari
After watching all the show, the driver will pick up you and go to the safari zone where you can see the animals without barrier
The buffet is so so, acceptable Safari world, Bangkok was a fantastic experience. Reach early and go on weekdays to avoid crowds. There was various shows throughout the day which start exactly at the given time. Take a map and plan your day accordingly. We loved the orangutan and elephant show. The dolphin show was too crowded. You also get to click pictures with birds, tiger and orangutan for an extra charge. An experience for kids and adults alike. The food served at the savana restaurant is average quality. But there are other cafes all along the way. The best part for. Me was the safari in the car and the giraffe feeding. The former lets you see animals at close range in their open environments while you are locked in the car. A Must visit!

There's a colddrinks shop on the corner outside, always open when the track is. The blue 200m track next door is OK for a jog or warm upcool down and is open past 0800 perhaps even all day. We tried at 6am and the gate was closed, locals confirm it is not open. There is a small blue 200m track next door which is fine but hard and busy in the mornings. All the other tracks in the area are also closed  Old stadium with a well prepared 400m track. For me it's the track that counts i.e. 5 stars. Thais come here for running especially in the evening. Open to every one between 59 am and 48 pm.

리뷰:
An Unforgettable Night at Bruno Mars' Concert in Bangkok

I recently had the incredible opportunity to attend a Bruno Mars concert in Bangkok, Thailand, and it was nothing short of spectacular. The stadium was packed, a sea of people stretching as far as the eye could see, yet remarkably, it remained cool and comfortable despite the sweltering heat outside. This made the whole experience even more enjoyable.

Bruno Mars was absolutely phenomenal. His performance was electric, full of energy and charisma, truly showcasing his worldclass talent. The live music, the vibrant atmosphere, and his dynamic stage presence combined to create an unforgettable show. Every song was performed with such passion and precision that it left the audience captivated.

The overall production of the concert was impressive, with topnotch sound and lighting that perfectly complemented his performance. It was an evening of pure entertainment, and Bruno Mars proved once again why he is considered one of the best live performers today.

Attending this concert was a fantastic experience, and I would highly recommend seeing Bruno Mars live if you have the chance. It's an exhilarating event that music lovers should not miss! A must visit if you get a chance to watch the Thai national team. Amazing atmosphere. Its not the best place to visit when it rains and dont bring your car because the traffic is bad on match days Yesterday, I visited the soccer stadium to watch the soccer game between Korea and Thailand.
It was a 730 p.m. game and it was 20 minutes away from our accommodation, so I left home at around 430 p.m.
I took a taxi to hear that parking was not available, but the road to the stadium was so blocked that I arrived after 530 p.m.
My ticket was not a reserved seat, so I sat on a firstcome, firstserved basis, but the children were reluctant to sit down because they said there was a lot of bird droppings in the seats. 555
I took a bottle of water with me, but I couldn't take it inside, so I took it away.
And there was a place where only two water and coke were sold.
Even if you get paid more, it would be nice if you put a lid on it.
People bought several and went to the seats, but it was too far and it was hard to find a seat, so I was very anxious to carry them without a lid.
It was so hot and hard throughout the game, but it was good to see a good game. AFC ACL2

Great stadium, clean toilet.

Public transport.
Come by Airport Link Phaya Thai  Ramkamhaeng  then take a but to RU or take a bus to RU. Was here twice both for concert. Actually the stadium is too big for a concert, if your seat is on third floor you hardly see anything on stage. The steps are high and steep so don't recommend for people with heart and movement problems. The organizing procedure for a concert is as professional as in Singapore.
The traffic is a huge problem. No metro or sky train near here. The nearest station is Rakhamheang station which is 5km away. After a concert the Rakhamheang road is totally packed, no bus can go through it. Taxi and motor taxi fares skyrocket. To avoid traffic jam, catch a water taxi to Saphan Mit pier then walk to the station, it's very cheap and easy to commute. Water taxi ends its service around 7pm so after the concert the only way to get out of the crowd is walking as far as you can and bargain with taxi drivers.

Hope you enjoy your healthy program here.

Amazing atmosphere in the stadium when its full capacity. A little far from Bangkok city but if you get a chance to watch a big match in Thai football you must visit this stadium Thammasat Stadium, located in Rangsit, Pathum Thani, is a striking venue that impresses with its considerable size and capacity. Hosting around 25,000 seats, it stands out as one of the larger stadiums in Thailand, capable of accommodating a significant number of fans and ensuring a vibrant atmosphere for various events.

I recently attended a match between Bangkok United FC and Uthai Thani, part of the 2nd Thai Premier League, and the experience was remarkable. The stadium's vastness is immediately noticeable, providing ample seating and good sightlines from nearly every section. The crowd was enthusiastic, and the venues facilities efficiently managed the influx of supporters, contributing to an enjoyable matchday experience.

Overall, Thammasat Stadium is a topnotch facility for football fans and large events, offering an impressive blend of size, comfort, and atmosphere. Whether you're a local supporter or a visiting fan, it's a fantastic place to catch a game and soak in the passion of Thai football. Football is causing damages to the running track by loading heavy equipment on the track with logo signs or cars from U17 AFC and ambulance parking on the track. The trash that's left over onto the track that maintenance does not clean upwater bottles, taping, zip ties, nails, screws, dirt, rocks, etc. The sports manager shows no care for the stadium and others who use the stadium, he's just happy getting paid. Also he does not communicate in advance to those who use the stadium. Movie crews are allowed to drill holes into the track. The preparation for freshy games the students arrive during our training sessions and stand in the way. But during their set up the stadium is closed to us for training...?????!!!! Makes no sense and no respect for others.

Stadium great for soccer fans people are posting but no one is talking about how awful the damages for the athletics fans. And those training on their from the national team. Great when we were the only team using the stadium. Any trash on the soccer field is tossed onto the track. Just love the respect. And I would be ashamed how the track looks compared to smaller schools. I'm embarrassed when foreign athletes come here for training camp. They ask this is the national team track?!?!?

Finally, yesterday a football team showed their true colors which they try to show a great image for fans. Yesterday, afternoon a lady on the phone who works for a certain club where our national athletics team train as well said that, "club name pays for the stadium so they do not have to tell when they have training or games. And that everyone knows this." And they placed fake turf on the track which we use to run on and the women said," if we damage the turf we are responsible to fix it." But yet they put the turf on the track used for running and they have damaged the track and used the hurdles to hold up their sponsors signs and zip tie it so I'm unable to use the hurdles for training but yet they feel they are entitled to everything. And their use of power and money in a bad way no empathy or care for other sports. I have never experienced this in America. We all respect each other and communicate to work together. I have two experience with different Thai clubs who has used this stadium for home. I wouldn't be surprised if all Thai clubs use their power and money to let you know this is how things work and you should know this. Definitely ego problems and no respect for others. That goes same for TU sports manager.

And this is why the athletics association doesn't want to repair the track because TU management and the football team will continue damaging the new track. I recently had the pleasure of visiting Thammasat Stadium for a match between True Bangkok United and Port FC, and I must say that I was thoroughly impressed with my experience. The stadium's management and cleanliness were exceptional, making for a seamless and enjoyable experience.

Upon arrival, I was greeted by friendly and helpful staff who directed me to my seat. The stadium itself was clean and wellmaintained, with ample seating and excellent views of the pitch. The seats were comfortable and provided plenty of legroom, ensuring a comfortable viewing experience throughout the match.

The management of the stadium was equally impressive. The entire experience was organized and efficient, with clear signage and helpful staff to guide me through the stadium. The food and drink options were also topnotch, with a wide variety of choices and highquality offerings.

Throughout the match, the atmosphere was electric, with fans cheering on their respective teams with passion and enthusiasm.

Overall, I was thoroughly impressed with Thammasat Stadium and its management. The cleanliness and organization of the stadium made for a seamless and enjoyable experience, and the passionate fans made for an unforgettable atmosphere. I would highly recommend a visit to Thammasat Stadium for any sports fan visiting Bangkok. So  cool to be here to experience Bankok united in the Asian champions league! Amazing wibe to the stadium with the supporters making a lot of noise! Had a lovely time!

Visited on a Saturday morning for the 10am fights and regret the early breakfast as the stadium has 34 restaurants selling nice street food but we were too full to try. There are also drinks you can buy but you are not allowed to take these bottles into the stadium with you.

The ticket price is 800baht for standard seats and double that for ringside. We could sit anywhere apart from ringside and were right by the fighters entrance with elevation that made it easy to see the action.  Much preferred to the lower VIP seats where you could mostly see the ring cables.

The fights were unexpectedly high intensity with one match resulting in blood drawn and one with an actual knockout. Still the matches that went to a decision were still exciting and the format was very quick so there was no extensive waiting.

It makes sense at the matches were televised online live and the production very well done particularly the slick camera work for replays. Favourite place.
Amazing crowd.
Go oftentimes for one championship.
Best place to watch boxing  I had the pleasure of visiting the New Lumpinee Boxing Stadium in Bangkok to witness the One Championship card matches, and it was an incredible experience. The stadium was impressive, with a capacity of over 5,000 people and stateoftheart facilities.

The fights were intense and thrilling, with some of the best fighters in the world showcasing their skills. The main event of the night was between two highly skilled fighters, and the atmosphere in the stadium was electric as they battled it out in the ring.

In the end, the results of the One Championship card matches on Saturday, February 25, 2023 were as follows

Main Event Champion vs. Champion World Title Bout  Winner FABRICIO ANDRADE
CoMain Event Featherweight Muay Thai world championship  Winner TAWANCHAI PK. SAENCHAI
Women's catchweight submission  Winner DANIELLE KELLY

The New Lumpinee Boxing Stadium provided a fantastic setting for the fights, with great views from every seat and a lively atmosphere that added to the excitement of the matches.

Overall, I highly recommend visiting the New Lumpinee Boxing Stadium to witness some of the best fighters in the world battle it out in the ring. With topnotch facilities and exciting matches, it is an experience that any fight fan won't want to miss. Clean toilets, small food court with descent prices. Drink prices easy. Goodview from all corners. Easy to get a taxi home. Amazing experience ! We were at the ringside and we felt like VIP! We saw everything, even sweat and blood, and I recommend it !! My most favorite part is how the fighters are respectful to one another, hugging and cheering up the one who lost !

Walk up a central spiral staircase to the top floor with 360 views of greater Bangkok. Many Buddhas on display and placards with wisdom of Buddhist teachings.

The temple is laid out in layers, with the ground floor being an exhibition explaining the history and origins of the temple. The second floor being a library, where one can freely take books and give a donation. I found 5 small books and offered 100 THB which the staff said was more than enough.

Meaning Temple of the Royal Niece, the temple was built to the order of King Nangklao Rama III for his granddaughter, Princess Somanass Waddhanawathy in 1846. During Visakha Bucha Day 2019  or Wan Pra Yai   marks the three important incidents in the life of Lord Buddha  on the same day  the full moon of the sixth lunar month. The three significant separate events are 

1. The Buddhas Birth 

2. The Enlightenment of Buddha   While sitting under the Bodhi tree, he found his answer and attained the enlightenment at the age of 35 years.

3. The Nibbana  The Buddha passed away on Tuesday, the Vesak full moon day in the zodiac year of the small snake under the two Sal trees in the Sala Grove of the Mallas in Kusinara, the capital of the Malla state, nowadays located in Kusinagara of Uttrarapradesa, India at the age of eighty years around 2547 years ago.Wisaka Bucha Day falls every year in the month of July. This year it is on Saturday 20 2024

Wisaka Bucha Day is regognized as most important memorial day in Buddhism for the Lord Buddha. Wisaka Bucha day is also recognized by the UNESCO in 1999 as World Heritage Day. Thailand where is the permanent location of the World Fellowship of Buddhists, was chosen to host celebrating event for the day and Sunday 21 July   Buddhist Lent or RainsRetreat

Wat Yannawa  the boat temple, is a Buddhist temple Wat in Bangkok on Charoen Krung Road, Sathon district.

While most people are on their way to Icon Siam or Asiatique  Its only a 5minute walk to from Saphin Taksin BTS station. The inside shrine is very cool, lots to look at, but without being able to read Thai, very difficult to learn and translate what things are. Always a personal struggle when you cant understand the meanings of things  Also, no photos allowed inside and not very friendly volunteers towards foreigners inside. Only English was what would you like to buy. All my other interactions outside were great and the young monks on site were a joy to watch.

Entry is free. Lots of places on site for donations. Give yourself an hour to walk around and make your way to the river to feed the fishes.
I always bring lots of change and 20baht bills.

The temple was built during the Ayutthaya Kingdom, before the founding of Bangkok. It was originally called Wat Kok Khwai  because the community of Dawei people in the area bought and sold buffalo later, it was renamed as Wat Kok Krabue .
During the reigh of King Rama I, the temple gained royal status and the ubosot was built. During the reign of King Rama III, a viharn was built in the shape of a Chinese junk boat. The temple was renamed as Wat Yannawa, which translates as the boat temple. The two chedis on the deck represent masts and the altar at the back represents the wheelhouse. Because of this unique structure, locals call the temple sampao chedi the Chinese junk with chedis. Wat Yannawa Thai , commonly known in English as "the boat temple", is a Buddhist temple Wat in Bangkok on Charoen Krung Road, Sathon district. The temple has a long history from the Ayutthaya era to the present. During the rule of King Rama III, a viharn was built in the shape of a Chinese junk, giving the temple the nickname "the boat temple". This construction inside the temple houses a space where people pray a nearby ubosot enshrines Buddha images and illustrations of the Loi Prathip Royal Lantern Festival . Additional exterior buildings enshrine a Buddha relic from Sri Lanka and the Goddess of Mercy.

Wiki Free Admission. Just a short walk from Saphan Taksin Station.

이름: Tha Tian Pier ท่าเรือท่าเตียน
주소: PFWR+84G, Thanon Thai Wang, Khwaeng Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
If we want to cross to the wat arun temple,we must take ferry from this pier..it only takes 5 minutes crossing chao phraya river to the wat arun temple Tha Tian Pier is a bustling transportation hub located on the banks of the Chao Phraya River, serving as a gateway to some of Bangkok's most iconic attractions. This pier is particularly famous for its proximity to the Grand Palace and Wat Pho, making it a favored spot for tourists eager to explore the rich history and culture of the city.

As you approach Tha Tian Pier, you'll immediately notice the lively atmosphere filled with the sounds of boat engines and the chatter of travelers. The pier itself is wellorganized, with clear signage directing passengers to various boat services, including ferries, longtail boats, and tour boats. Its a convenient point to hop on and off, providing easy access to the riverside attractions.

One of the main draws of Tha Tian Pier is its stunning views of the Chao Phraya River. The picturesque backdrop includes traditional Thai architecture and modern buildings, offering a fascinating contrast that showcases the citys evolution. The bustling river activity is captivating, as you watch boats maneuvering and locals going about their daily routines.

Once you arrive at the pier, you can easily access the nearby attractions. A short walk will take you to Wat Pho, home to the famous Reclining Buddha statue and a center for traditional Thai massage. The Grand Palace is also just a stone's throw away, allowing visitors to immerse themselves in the grandeur of Thailand's royal heritage.

In addition to its role as a transit point, Tha Tian Pier is also surrounded by a variety of local food stalls and restaurants. After visiting the temples, you can enjoy delicious Thai street food right at the pier or explore the nearby eateries offering a range of traditional dishes. The aroma of grilled seafood, pad thai, and coconut desserts wafts through the air, enticing passersby to indulge.

The pier is particularly vibrant in the evenings when the area transforms into a lively market. Local vendors set up stalls, selling handmade crafts, souvenirs, and street food, creating a festive atmosphere that attracts both locals and tourists. The riverside view during sunset is breathtaking, providing a perfect backdrop for memorable photographs.

In conclusion, Tha Tian Pier  is more than just a transportation hub it is a vibrant cultural spot that connects visitors to some of Bangkoks most treasured landmarks. Whether you are using it as a transit point or spending time enjoying the local food and scenery, Tha Tian Pier is a delightful experience that captures the essence of life along the Chao Phraya River. It's an essential stop for anyone looking to dive deeper into Bangkok's rich heritage while enjoying the beauty of the river and its surroundings. Get across to Wat Arun from this pier for just 5 bhat instead of private boats who will charge 40 bhat unless you're doing a tour. If you want to go to Wat Arun from Wat Pho you need to take a few minute's boat ride from this pier. Now it costs 5 baht per trip. You can go easily from Wat Pho to Wat Arun with the boat from this pier. You just need to buy and pay with coin on the spot. It only takes 15 minutes to reach the Wat Arun Pier on the other side.

주소: 749 On Nut 7, แขวง อ่อนนุช, Khet Suan Luang, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10250, Thailand
리뷰:
The shrine of Mae Nak stands next to Klong Phra Khanong, at Wat Mahabut, a large temple on Soi 77 off Sukhumvit Road On Nut Road. The shrine is a low building under large trees with a roof that encompasses the tree trunks. The main shrine has several minor shrines around it.

A beautiful young woman named Nak, who lived on the banks of the Phra Khanong canal, had an undying love for her husband, Mak.

While Nak was pregnant, Mak was conscripted into the Thai Army and sent to war where he was seriously wounded in some versions it is the Kengtung Wars, while others are not specific.
While he was being nursed back to health in central Bangkok, Nak and their child both died during childbirth. But when Mak returned home, he found his loving wife and child waiting for him. Neighbors warned him that he was living with a ghost but he rebuffed them.

One day, as Nak was preparing nam phrik, she dropped a lime off the porch. In her haste to retrieve it, she stretched her arm to an impossible length to pick it up from the ground below. Upon seeing this, Mak realized his wife was a ghost. That night, Mak sneaked out the house and fled with Nak in pursuit. According to Thai folklore, ghosts are afraid of sticky Blumea leaves so Mak hid behind a Blumea balsamifera Thai  pronounced nat bush.
He then ran into Wat Mahabut temple, which as holy ground, a ghost cannot enter.
In her grief, Nak terrorized the people of Phra Khanong, furious at them for causing Mak to leave her. However, a powerful monk captured Nak's ghost and after confining her in an earthen jar, threw it into the Phra Khanong canal.

There are regional variations to the rest of the story. In one, an old couple new to Phra Khanong find the jar while fishing in another two fishermen dredge up the jar. In both cases, Nak is freed when the jar is opened.

In alternative versions, a venerable monk named Somdet Phra Phutthachan To Phrommarangsi defeats Nak by confining her spirit in the bone of her forehead and binds it to his waistband. Legend says the waistband is currently in the possession of the Thai royal family. Admiral Prince Abhakara Kiartivongse, Prince of Chumphon, also claimed to have had the relic. In another, the monk assured Nak that in a future life she would be reunited with her beloved husband, so she voluntarily departed for the afterlife.

Wiki A nice wat to visit because I was curious about the story of Mae Nak. It feels really spritual, and lots of pigeon haha This temple is amazing their is a big lottery market.
I the video if u could place the coin in the middle ur wish would come true. Just a rumor lol. But see I could stand the coin in the top of every coin amazing. Wow

리뷰:
The temple's serene atmosphere offers a spiritual retreat right in the heart of the city.

Note that taking pictures inside is not allowed, and you'll need to remove your shoes before entering.

The temple is easily accessible, making it convenient for visitors. A mustvisit for those seeking a peaceful and meaningful experience. One of the South Indian temples in the heart of Bangkok, you have mostly all the idols here the main is the one of Uma Devi. The architecture is beautiful just like any South Indian temples, the pandits are mostly Indians but can speak Thai as well. Its quite
Serene and peaceful inside and can sit for long while chanting. Photos are not allowed inside, you will be given a mask in the entrance itself. For Indians staying here its the place to go during Navarathri since they celebrate all the nine days. Just that this place dont have BTS connectivity and finding a place to park is a challenge. One of the best thing of this temple is you find array of Indian Puja shops where you can find everything right from Puja items to the idols to dhoops and agarbatti. Please  keep long Distance

Hug U Beautiful temple visited by both local and visitors from India, Malaysia, Singapore, Sri Lanka and more A busy Hindu temple where a constant stream of city residents come to pray and make offerings. Slip off your shoes and slip on a mask, which is required even this long beyond the pandemic. Once inside, youll see devotees buying trays loaded with offerings, which they first pray over before offering to priests inside the shrine. In return, they receive a ceremonial bindi from a priest. This is a functioning temple, so respect the reverence. Absolutely no photos allowed once you set foot inside.

주소: 2 Saranrom Rd, Khwaeng Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
In scale of Bangkok, Wat Ratchapradit Sathit Maha Simaram is a small, even a tiny temple. The temple is located beside Saranrom Park, and it is, of course, very beautiful, and historic, too. For a regular visitor there are numerous details to wonder, and  during our visit closed  the Viharn is amazing, even exceptional... one can just marvel what there is inside that fabulous building. As said, the temple is very beautiful but doesn't maybe belong to those for an ordinary tourist "must see" temples. Will need to revisit this temple.
Closed for mother's day. The custodians on duty cleaning for the day but the temple doors themselves closed.
Small site but with great detail and some banners posted on the outside about the history of the temple  only in Thai. Ratchapradit Sathitmahasimaram Temple was built in 1864 His intention is that this temple shall be one of the three main monasteries of the city according to the tradition since Sukhothai period, namely Wat Mahathat, Wat Raja Burana and Wat Ratchapradit Sathan.

His Majesty King Mongkut originally named the temple as "Rajapradit Sathitdhammayuttikaram Temple, The Temple of the Dhammayut Order specifically dedicated the land especially to Dhammayut monks. His will manifested in the royal edict, the marble slab behind the Buddhas hall, and the poems engraved on the monasteryzone marker pillars. After that the name was changed to "Wat Ratchapradit Sathitmahasimaram, the Temple with the Great Monastery Zone Markers. Since there was no chapel in this temple, they used the zone marker pillars around the temple, both the Buddhas and the Sanghas zones, to indicate the boundary that the ceremony can be performed.
In 1665, His Majesty King Mongkut invited Phra Ssanasobhaa Sa Pussadeva, the tobe 9th supreme Patriarch of Thailand to be the first abbot. He was King Rama IV student and one of the ten first monks in the Dhammayut Order.

His Majesty King Mongkut paid great attention in decorating the temple with fine arts. He demanded that the carving on the door and windows emulated that of Wat Suthat, the inside window carved in the Japanese style of Wat Nang Chee, on top of every door and window having an emblem of the crown, the kings sigil, and the stars on the ceiling inspired by that of Wat Rajapraditsathan and Wat Suwan Dararam of Ayutthaya. Furthermore, there are paintings of deity groups roaming freely over the sky, the mural of royal ceremonies in 12 months which were painted in the reign of King Rama V with the background of the previous reign in order to reflect the prosperity under the rule of King Rama IV. Inside the temple is the famous Buddha image, Phra Sihanga Patimakorn, under which is where the royal ashes of King Mongkut were placed.
There are a large number of His Majesty King Mongkuts relevant edifices and antiquities in Wat Ratchapradit such as the royal temple which illustrates The Great Crown of Victory on the gable, the crowntopped pulpit as Rama IVs sigil.

Psna Cetiya the marble pagoda is a Sri Lankan style pagoda, inspired by the detail in the commentary of Mahparinibbna Sutta that the Emperor Ashoka had built the rockpagoda
Prasat Phra Boromarup and Prasat Phra Trai Pidok are the Khmerstyled buildings, inside of which are the statue of King Rama IV and 150 yearsold palmleaf manuscripts of the Pali Canon in the bookshaped wooden boxes respectively. Originally, these buildings were constructed in the reign of King Rama V with marbles with the fourfaced god, Brahman, on the top, then they were rebuilt in the reign of King Rama VI. THE FIRST CLASSED ROYAL MONASTERY OF RATCHAWORAWIHARN WAS BUILT FROM KING RAMA IV'S BELIEF THAT TRADITIONAL ROYAL CEREMONIES IN THE CITY REQUIRED THREE TEMPLES NAMELY WAT MAHATHAT, WAT RATCHABURANA AND WAT RAJAPRADIT.

AS BANGKOK HAD NIETHER WAT RAJAPRADIT NOR A THAMMAYUTIKA NIKAI TEMPLE CLOSE TO THE GRAND PALACE, WHILE WAT BOWONNIWETWIHARN WAS NOT CONVENIENT FOR THE KING AND ROYAL FAMILIES TO TRAVEL TO AND FRO, HE THEN ORDERED TO BUILD THE TEMPLE.

IN THE REIGN OF KING RAMA V, THE ASHES OF KING RAMA IV WERE KEPT UNDERNEATH THE PRINCIPAL BUDDHA IMAGE IN UBOSOT THE ORDINATION HALL.

THE MURAL PAINTINGS IN UBOSOT DEPICT 12 ROYAL CEREMONIES AND A SOLAR ECLIPSE WHICH IS A MEMORIAL TO KING RAMA IV'S TRIP TO OBSERVE A SOLAR ECLIPSE AT TAMBON WAKO OF PRACHUAP KHIRI KHAN PROVINCE IN 1868. The beautiful temple very close to the grand palace just 2 mins by walk. This temple is pretty quiet, but stunning decoration of Buddhist style.

이름: Royal Hall of Dusit Maha Prasat
주소: พระที่นั่งดุสิตมหาปราสาท 202 Maha Rat Road, Khwaeng Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand
리뷰:
Behind the west boundary wall, an open pavilion Phra Thinang Aphorn Phimok Prasat built on a platform as a robing pavilion  the king's royal palanquin mounting platform. Decorated with gold and silver glass mosaic. It is one of the most elegant buidings of Grand Palace and it has a throne near the center of the hall where the King sits while giving public audience. It is open only during weekdays and by the time we reached there we were already tired to explore it fully since it sits near the exit from the Grand Palace. The pathinangchakkeemahapasat building was constructed in the reign of king rama the fifth, to commemorate the centenary of the Chakkri dynasty.
It was designed in Renaissance style, with pure Thai style roof, or the nickname as "The Westerner with Thai hat".
On the second hall. there is the central throne hall that use as audiance hall.
And on the top floor, the royal ashes are kept.

On the ground floor, in the old day, was used as ancient weapon but now no more.it moved away.

Hit Like if it useful.
Thank you for visit Thailand. Very beautiful place  amazing design and architecture

주소: 326 Worachak Rd, Khwaeng Ban Bat, Khet Pom Prap Sattru Phai, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10100, Thailand
리뷰:
This wat temple has an amazing khondancethemed side temple to honor the spirits of the khon dance and to offer amulets in their honor. The main ubosot is beautiful and nice for meditation. This is a must see temple if you are near Chinatown. It's so convenient to come to This temple. The parking is big. Toilets are clean. I normally comes in the morning, before 10 a.m. Easy in and out. The monk ceremony with coffin donation is great.  Careful with the people that sorround it, they want you to buy jewelry. Its beautiful!

We got here as part of tuktuk kinda scam tour. But its beautiful!! Small tranquil temple nestled near Chinatown. A good place to visit for meditation. Have powerful amulets as well. Can make Wishes Come Through

주소: Dao Khanong, Chom Thong, Bangkok 10150, Thailand
리뷰: I really liked this market which was full of locals. It is smaller but I liked that, it was just enough for a one night out. Half of the market are food stalls many dont have english menu and half of it are mostly clothes. There are also some bars with live music. Prices in markets are really afordable, I think even cheaper that chatchuk market. Adventureous hidden heaven for locals. Not so touristy, a wode selection of local cuisine. Simplicity i actually chanced upon a kid playing with her pet, a yellow real life baby duckling. That was authenticity of this place. Kid roam around on their own safely. Best is the place where there are live band and bar to sit around. Love the fish bowl size mojito. The location is a bit out of the way and not very convenient to get to at night. There is quite a lot of food and a variety of small goods, good for spending the evening, but maybe not the best place if you are looking for food or clothes. Also when we left the place to take a taxi, we encountered a refusal and another one asking for a price, the third driver saw us too poor and offered to pick us up. Very pleasant night Market with a somewhat more local vibe than some of the others I went to in Bangkok. It is quite bog actually and has a variety of food and shopping available. You can even get glasses done for a reasonable price herehowever it takes about 1 day to make . Very interesting mix of food available and food was quite reasonably priced One of Bangkok Night Market to visit. Lots of food and alcohol to go for. Many clothes to buy but not the cheapest thou. Recommend to eat as much as possible to have the best for your night. Packet those you cant already food back to your hotel. Walk as you go naturally, doesnt need to hesitate to buy what you want.

주소: 971 กรุงเทพฯ-นนทบุรี 29 Khwaeng Wong Sawang, Khet Bang Sue, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10800, Thailand
리뷰:
Great place to go! Love the vibes and so cheap. The street foods are nice! Interesting Wild West town retro market. Mostly food  drink place with a lot of bars.
Few vintage shops dotted mostly at the start of market but more for browsing. If u into vintage, better go to train market surburb of Bangkok but worth the trip. Perhaps I've visited on an off day Sunday evening but there doesn't seem to be much going on.  Plenty of deserted sections with just a handful of tshirt and vintage stores and empty bars serving alcohol to teenagers. the place looks like it's waiting for a renaissance. in any case I'd say avoid going on a sunday you might have better luck on a weekend night. p.s. the actual vintage market is on the opposite side of the road, as marked on google maps Nice place to take. A long walk in and the same way out. Lots of local. Feb 2023
 Local wet market  Food stores  Very raw  interesting
